Note: Good Ribera !!! As usual strong body and great sense in palate. I suggest it with very typical spanish food: bellota ham, cocido madrileño !!!! Amazing red !!!
Very pleasant Ribera del Duero. Low acidity, more on the dry-side and tannic, with powerful notes of ripe blackberry, blueberry, tobacco, leather and hints of vanilla.

Mulberry and leather on the nose.  vanilla chocolate and a mix of plum and cherry on the pallet. Nice long and tart aftertaste. 
At around 15€ I think this is really good.

Quite rich and intense.  High altitude wine... that achieves the quality that is pursued with this cultivation practice.  Continuously well qualified.  Peñín Guide gave this vintage 90/100 which means Excellent Wine.

Strawberry sauce, blueberry. Cocoa powder, vanilla, cedar… the fruit is dominated by the French oak. On the palate, dry med acidity, med tannins, a little dusty and astringent. High alcohol. Musty Wet gravel on the finish, with cigar box.

Nose is oak, dark chocolate, blueberry, cassis. Intense and pure. Taste mirrors the nose, adds velvety tannins and a great balance. Completely dry - full bodied but not sweet. Great intensity and length. Wonderful price performance rating :-)

Fine RdD with good nose of ripe cherry, vanilla and a bit earthy. Good taste of dark fruit, oak and licorice. Misses a little power. Medium + tannins and long finish with a little acidity. Good value for money.

Red raspberry, strawberry, cherry and under ripe plum on the nose with notes of leather and cedar. Palate is big with soft yet strong tannins, great acidity and vibrant fruit and floral notes. An addition of Blueberry, dried tobacco and anise.  Long finish on this great wine.

Would say 3.8⭐.
Some good earthy tones and ripe fruits showing. Good to drink young.
Vanilla oak tobacco blueberries on the nose blueberries tobacco oak lots of tannins in the finish
Good food wine- it has the tannins and taste to match beef and lamb!
Tried in Zurich (TASTE SPAIN 2022)
Lovely colour, a bit of ruby chocolate. Really emjoyed this smooth wine
Very nice heart full bodied vino. Deep earthy notes
Good Ribera with dark cherry, nutty and oaky notes with earthy afterstaste. Mid-strong boldness with mid-strong acidness. Great for beef.
Bought it for 12 euro. Great value 4 stars

Really dark wine, with purple edges. You can’t see through the glass. “Curtains”.

Characters: dry and rather soft, the tannins are humble.

Great palette of vanilla, cherry and leather - with a long smooth aftertaste. 

Grapes grown on over 900m altitude. Thinking on ☕️, how it grow slower on altitude but develop a smooth taste. 

My 7:th RdD, and average score is 4,3. I also rated one as a 5. About 3% of my rated wines gets full score. 

RdD is highly recommend. ❤️

🍷🇪🇸 Tell me your best Ribera del Duero.

Full Bodied, dark colour
On the nose, plums, hint of smoke, tobacco and leather
On the pallet,  lots of savoury notes, olives, blackberries and elegant level of tannin. 

Overall, it’s good drinking wine and hard to read it’s flavour characteristics.
God
Good entry Ribera del duero, nice to grilled sirloin
I like this wine… not bad at all and definitely something I would recommend seeking out.
Body, black fruit, loved it
Vanilla berry cigar blueberry
Very nice wine!
Young wine. Sweet at first with a strong taste at the end. Sweet and tangy notes
Smooth, dry spicy finish.
Super nice Ribera! Sad that I couldn’t get hold on more :(
Well balanced but a little young.
Light and fruity on front but pepper Finish - very good!
Good value.
Great value!
Not really my cup of tea (or wine as it were). It didn’t taste bad, but just didn’t give me anything interesting. Gave me heartburn and headache, even though I only had a couple of glasses.
oak black fruit earthy
Young and light body wine red fruit in nose, like cherry and strawberry. In mouth oak, tobacco and earthy.

Region: Ribera del Duero
Grape Variety: 100% Tempranillo
ABV: 14%
Stopper: Cork

Full bodied red wine.
Deep inky red in colour, on the nose, aromas of blackcurrant and blackberries with notes of spices. Medium tannins. Well-balanced in acidity. Rich and intense red wine in style. On the palate, oaky, displays black and dark fruits character, deep, rich, fruit-driven, jammy and fleshy, hint of leather, wood and spices, touch of pepper and dark chocolate. It has long finish.

Pairs with beef and venison.
Classy, elegant, Ribera. Balanced with loads of dark fruit, blackcurrant, chocolate and liquorice. Dry finish. Great present from Christmas in February!
Blackberry and hint of cherry, which brings a nice acidity to an otherwise very smooth experience. Tasted from a magnum…although it didn’t exactly get to age…

At the nose, bramble, black cherry, juicy blackberry, vanilla and coconut, leather and tobacco. At the palate, ripe, juicy, rich and textured. Very satisfying and relatively fresh. Eclectic when it comes to food pairing, tried in magnum with bbq pork ribs and mexican tacos, equally good
Superb value medium to full Ribera del duero. Blackberries and rapsberries, vanillla, oak, touch of spice and leather. Very nice.

This wine was an absolutely beautiful surprise.  Smooth with well balanced acidity.  Hints of leather, tobacco, blackberries, and earthy tones.  Great value for the price.  Must have wine in your cellar or wine rack.  I definitely recommend this wine.  Pairs beautifully with a nice steak or roated lamb.

The nose opens with barnyard notes, tobacco, oak, bramble and cherry. Earthy, smoky but playful.

The palate is juicy and mineral with lots of cherry, raspberry and strawberry notes inside. Also creamy cheese. Med tannins and good acidity.

Short and non-remarkable finish.

Simple but good.

Lingonberry, smidge of prune, and some tomato leaf on the nose. The flavor is blueberry, cranberry, salt minerals, tannins, pepper a bit.

Opaque purple color. Full body, very thick. 

Very full wine with flavors that don't overwhelm. Seems like light oaking or neutral oak. Very nice Tempranillo. 

3.7
Very nice, Julia likes it
Good Ribera enjoyed with good friends celebrating life and friendship!!! A gift from Karen y Berta at Osmy’s house with them, Edu & Zuly. (03/13/2021)

Probably the best bottle we’ve had in 🇮🇩 so far!  🇪🇸 RdD always seems to deliver and with a pleasantly surprising old vintag.  Interestingly, we had to destroy the cork to remove it.  Perhaps had something to do with storage?

Inky maroon in the glass with brown hues.  Date, prune and oak on the nose.  Anise, stewed tomatoes, prosciutto, prune and black currant on the palate.  Doesn’t feel like this bottle has much time left. 3.8✨
Great balance, concentrated black fruits, oak, silky tannin and great finish. Good value for the price.
Nosebof berries and leather, dark vibrant purple. The taste is full of dark berries with hints of chocolate and vanilla. Beautiful to drink.
This is smooth and earthy in Flavors with a crisp fruit nuance on the backlog the tongue. Aromas of cherry, leather and lead. Flavors of cherry, slight pomegranate and black truffle.
Dark berries upfront. Dense purple running to full bodied with oak and leather to the midpalate. Medium long finish with some smokey, dark cocoa and brief hints of rhubarb(?) perhaps. 14.5%.
Rich savory inky deep red. Coffee caramel and bitter burnt leather on the nose. Smooth tannins. Medium finish. Very good Tempranillo and very well aged.
Decent young Ribera with oaky hints as well as lots of red fruit cherry blackberry plum black fruit leather tobacco easy drinking
blackfruits, oak and smoke - descent ribera to go with charcuterie
It went beautifully with a steak.

In the glass dark red dense
On the nose raspberry undernote of rubber
Dark berries
Powerful aroma coffee chocolate oak
Violets 
On the palate smooth dry tannins vanilla raspberries black cherries oak chocolate coffee 
Full of character
Bra acidity
Well crafted
Full bodied 
Long aftertaste 
Develops with airing
Shame the wine couldn’t last forever
Fantastic in a bottle

Another very good example of Ribera del Duero. Beautiful ruby color with tobacco and wood on the nose. On my palate dark berries predominate but species are present. Medium finish. Pair with red, grilled meats. Very good P:Q ratio.

Black cherry, chocolate, vanilla bean on the nose and palate. Medium plus body with moderate acidity and a round chalky tannin structure. This went very well with mexican food, and held up on its own after the meal as well.
Deep ruby colored, intensive nose of cherry, blackberry, some vanilla and leather notes. High spirits, high acidity with high bright tannins. Full body with mid+ berry finish. Very nice one
Good RDD, dry, soft, oaked, rich arma, delicate tannins, 3.9

young and vibrant, very extracted with impressionable tannin. Purple flowers, bitter chocolate, with ash smoke in the back end. Interesting but still very tight for a great vintage in Spain. 90 points. May 2018

The colour is ruby with a clear ring. The aromas are black currant, blueberries, licorice, violet, earth, oak, cloves. The palate is medium to full body. Medium plus tannins. The flavour is ripe black and blue fruits with spice and the finish is medium long.
Great Spanish honoring the DO; excellent!

4.3. Medium intensity ruby in appearance. On the nose violet, cherry blossom, ripe red fruit. Intense flavours in the palate. Strawberry sauce, cherry compote, blackberry, plum, fig , prune, baking spice. Dry. Medium plus on the body. Moderate acidity and ripe tannins make this a well structured wine. Lengthy finish. Another fantastic wine from this bodega.
A classic delicious RdD Crianza, with refined oak and expressive but smooth tannins wrapped in a bold Tempranillo base.  I do love this appellation, second only to Toro.
Blackberry, cherry, oak, leather, vanilla and mocca on the nose. Palate with lots of fruits like cherry and Blackberry. Nice acidity and smooth tannins.
Very fruity Ribera del Duero 🇪🇸 Intense black currants blueberry cherry leather smoke oak vanilla cedar tobacco 🍷 Medium plus body, tannins and acidity.
Nice spicy Crianza. Hints of leather and tobacco in nose and good complexity in taste.

3.8. Dark berries, blackberries, spice. Very good either charcuterie.
Good RDD
Worth it for the taste and the price, even imported in Indonesia. Less than IDR 300k the bottle, it’s definitely an option to keep in my list
Almost sweet. Perfect with pulled pork.
Fruity red with smooth taste at the end
Nice
Madrid

Ruby red. On the nose oak, vanilla and cigar box. On the palate plums, cherries some mushroom spice, and vanilla. Nice balance and silky tannins. Full bodied, dry. Could drink this often. Went well with steak and creamy mushroom sauce. Paid USD15 in Ukraine. Would buy again. 4.0
Black fruit, dark deep color, soft finish. It was a shuttle Tempranillo. I enjoyed it with BBQ chicken wings.
Great quality RdD. Big blackberry, spice and heavy on the alcohol in a pleasant way. Mouth coating mid palate with lots of softening tannins and fruit with cedar and tobacco. well made classic wine!

Attractive garnet red color with high acidity, high alcohol and medium body! Medium plus flavor intensity with earthy, roasted pepper notes, leather, dry tomatoes...and well integrated tannins! Drink now with food!
It's bold and fruity with notes to black fruits like blackberry and currant and spicy hints to oak, vainilla and tobacco. It's also full bodied.

Unfiltered Tempranillo from vineyards located above 900 m altitude, following an aging of 12 months in 500 l french oak barrels. It is rather dark ruby red in colour with a nose showing: blackberry, plum, black cherry, liquorice, earth, and nutmeg. Fresh fruit-forward, delivering same as nose. It has medium acidity, soft tannins, fruity aftertaste, and medium-plus finish. Note: it is more fresh and less focused on tertiary aromas than its RdD peers.

Nice tempranillo, but I would say, basic one. 
Even after hour of aeration, high acidity covers some notes. 

Generally, nose.of honey and strawberry. Bold body, high acidity and high tannins. Taste of blackberry and chocolate with tobacco aftertaste.

100% Tempranillo from Ribera del Duero, Spain. Aged for at least 10 months in 500 liters French oak barrels. Notes of blackberry, blueberry, plum, blackcurrant, tobacco, leather and licorice. Medium to full body, medium tannins, medium plus acidity, medium spicy aftertaste

Dark cherry red coloured 100% Tempranillo coming from vineyards at 900 m above sea level. 12 months of French oak barrels of 500l. Red cherry, raspberry, spices. Medium bodied with a rather high level of acidity. 89 pts.

A truly food-wine. Reminds me of a young French Grenache or carignan with initial sourness and tannic bite. Giving it some air it’ll become more rounded and smooth, but never as expected for a 100% Tempranillo from Ribera del Duero. The grapes behind this wine comes from higher altitudes (approx 1000 m above sea level) making the wine more ‘young’ in expression with young fruits and medium to high acidity. The smoothness comes at the end securing the heritage and a wine above 3 stars

A real good and decent ribera del duoro, which not disappoint one🇪🇦

Yes, 👍 is really, really good, like most of all riviera del duero, dry, well balance, medium to low acidity with the complexity of the old world, not a fruity wine like new world but really good.
Good wine, little dry.

Has a fruit-driven nose, quite open and aromatic, with notes of black fruit, earth and dark spices, quite harmonious and integrated. The palate is medium-bodied with very fine tannins and good freshness. It matured in 500-liter oak barrels to keep the fruit and freshness. Soft and silky, quite impressive.

Always interesting to compare Rioja with RdD..... the Ribeira usually is the more muscular of the two. Same here; the nose is good; ripe cherries, coconut, vanilla. 

But on the palate it is less refined. Med+ tannins, med acidity. The 14,5% abv is burning a bit. Flavors in line with the nose and certainly enjoyable. Development and refinement do not really compare with Rioja. Med+ finish. Pretty good still. 14 pts @ De Logie
Nice Ribera dek Duero, good balanced red and very light tannins
3.6, medium purple in glass, vanilla and oak on the nose, fruity on entry, dry and persistent tannic finish, slightly acidic
Very nice Tempranillo, just a bit too much on the thin/ spicy side for me. That being said, great $10 bargain purchase!
Chewy deep red with cherry flavoured and smooth clean finish. Slightly chilled makes this a fresh drink during summer

Classic and classy Ribera. Dark ruby. Nose bursting with dark fruits, vanilla and chocolate. Rich dark fruit and full palate, plush but slightly chalky tannins. Overall smooth and enjoyable.

Nothing changes in this Borsao Garnacha & Syrah blend. Robust, sharp winemaking. Polishing is not the word here. This particular vintage (expect the red and black berries and currants) has plenty of ripe sour cherries notes inside (or at least I felt it that way). Bole is always a bright and fire exposure of the Campo de Borja terroir. And as I say all the time about Borsao wines. Too good for the money.

As you would expect its medium body with slight acidity which leads to fruity bitterness and great fruity chocolate aftertaste as its matured in french oak. My second approach to Bole from Borsao winery, this time 2015 vintage, previously 2014. And I must to admit that I like third wine. Good blend of Shiraz and Garnacha taste really good. Nice dark red colour in the glass welcomed fruity trip of nose. Lot of red fruit of cherry and raspberry with vanilla and pepper. All these made this wine very incredible. On the palate soft tannins with medium acidity completed with nice medium last finish of oak and cherry. Recommend to try. This bottle I got in small shop.

Garnacha - Syrah blend with a few months in new oak. Very good dark color, strong and powerful fruit, grippy but tasty tannins and a pronounced but well-made oak profile.

Grenache and Shiraz - a fav blend.  It has the zing of shiraz reinforced with then body of grenache.  Nice finish. Definitely worth a revisit.

Spanish September. Aged 3m in French oak this Grenache-Syrah blend from DO Campo de Borja (southeast of Navarra) is top value for money. Borsao are consistently good.

3.7✨ A satisfying drinker!  A blend of Syrah and Grenache that hits the right chords with homemade burgers at the island. Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Beautiful primitivo di manduria.  Almost semi-dry wine.  On the nose, wood, chocolate, to taste black fruit.  Medium body, long after taste. Recommendation…
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: I must say that all the wines I have had from this producer have been excellent, and all are reasonably priced. This 2017 vintage does not disappoint. I'm glad I have more.
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Much better than the price (and the recycled cork😑) would suggest. Dark ruby with strong purple hues in color, it’s ready right upon opening when served at room temperature. Blackberry, chocolate, sugarplum, fresh red fruit, vanilla, plastic 🧐, crashed almond, and very well integrated oak— sweet on the nose, berry-fresh on the palate. Medium+ finish. Mighty delicious solo, this Primitivo makes an excellent pairing with meaty/cheesy pizza😚👍👍 There’s no sediment, and it’d, perhaps, excel for another five years or so.
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Nose of chocolate, vanilla and oak, on the palate taste of dark chocolate, plum and cherry, with long oaky finish. Low+ acidity, smooth medium tannins, medium +  alcohol but very well integrated. I really like this wine 🤩
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Absolutely fan-tas-tic! Full bodied, with quite sharp tannin as for barrelled wine. There's lots of aromas of cherry, oak and chocolate. The smell is a bit jamy but totally not overwhelming. I'ma buy way more bottles before upcoming christmas, it will be perfect for that occasion.
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Wonderful primitivo, it is a testimony to the fact that primitivo can be big, powerful and quaffable without falling into the trap of overwhelming ripeness and sugar content. Classical features on nose and palate, cherry, chocolate, jam, cigar, vanilla, clove and raisins are to name a few. Off dry, full body and mild acidity, combined with gentle tannins, med+ length finish and spicy aftertaste, great QPR.
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: I really enjoyed this one. This is a wine that knows what it is doing. Deep purple colour with jam, plum and oak. I often find that sometimes these wines, particularly those from the US, become too sweet but this gets it spot on. My only complaint would be the flavours felt a little “tight” at times, but this is a minor quibble.
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Rocking And I think someone commented pretty much the best Primitivo they had tried - I agree -  quite big but manageable body - you are cloaked in blackberries - yummy - like drinking bramble and apple crumble - bloody lovely and perfect with cheese -
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: As a Riserva, a Primitivo di Manduria must age for 24 months, nine of which in wood, before it can be released. This Primitivo has aromas of wild berries, plum jam, red currant flower, dry violet, spices, on a backbone of graphite. Love the color and the first impression is superlative!
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Very nice fruitfull fullbodied primitivo di manduria, awesome experience, with nice tanins and longlasting taste…👍
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note:
2017 vintage, pale ruby.   Oak, fresh red fruit, cherry, sweet herbs, liquorice on the nose.   M+ dry 4.5 / M acid 3.8 / M+ tannic 4.1 / M+ body 4.2 / M+ finish 4.4.
Palate of ripe red fruits, sweet plum, cassis, oak, tea, herb, sweet  spices, liquorice.  Fruit major, balanced & smooth, good wine with long sweet tannin finish.  Not so complex but very enjoyable, can age further.  A 4.3 overall.

Deep red color with condensation.
Complex fragrance such as wild berry fruit, plum jam, spices, cocoa powder etc.
A smooth mouthfeel and a long and wonderful lingering finish.

Note:
One of the nicer primitivos from the wine club. 
I’d describe it as light, fruity and fun!
Nose: ripe black fruits, cigar box, caramel

It palate evolution is sugar, spice and everything nice. Powerful girls in a bottle.

Note:
ORIGINAL ZINFANDEL

Not a lot of people know that Zinfandel and Primitivo are basically the same grape. Primitivo was indigenous to Apulia but only increased in popularity and quality when the grape became famous stateside during the 19th century.

It was both earthy and smoky on the nose, while the palate showed more fruits such as blackberry, sweet spice and liquorice. It tasted sweet and heavy on the palate with smooth tannins. But because of the sweetness, I don't think I can drink a lot of this.
Wine: Li Filitti Riserva Primitivo di Manduria 2017

Note: Moderate nose with toast, rubber and yeast. Not much fruit. The palate is too sweet for me, but has good acidity and pain d'epice. Just 3 stars due to the sweetness. I can understand the popular vote though.

Note:
Heavyweight Primitivo  - unfortunately not a champion.
Very dark red purple colour.
Intense but intruding bouquet of overripe fruit; plums, dates and raisins. Vanilla and sharp alcohol (14,5%).
Thick consistency, a simple jammy fruit bomb, quite sweet, almost vulgar. 
Perhaps I'm biased, as this is not my style of wine for sure, but I can't rate it any higher.

3.7 - This nice wine is different every year. The 2019 vintage contains 40% Merlot, 30% Cab Franc, 15% Cab Sauvignon and 15% Petit Verdot. For 12 months in French oak. Bigarreau cherry colour. On the nose, forest fruits intertwined with balsamic and spicy notes. Fresh and fruity on the palate with -again- lots of balsamic notes. The wine has sufficient volume, a good structure and maintains freshness, with a toasted aftertaste. Uncomplicated, pleasant and easy drinking. Paired very well with goose.

A bit disappointed but seeing as it is still a very young wine I imagine the experience will be better in 5 years, so I'll keep a bottle in my cellar.

Vanilla, chocolate, green pepper, balsamic, red cherry and strawberries aromas. Elegant tannins medium with medium acidity. The oaky notes in mouth are present with red cherry, chocolate, vanilla and balsamic flavors. Medium after taste. Very good wine.

Another good price jewel from Spain! This blend is from Castilla and is made of 30% Cabernet sauvignon, 21% Cabernet franc, 19% Syrah, 18% Petit verdot, 12% Merlot and with 15.5 % of alcohol. Deep purple in color. Expressive nose of blackberries, blueberries, violet, leather, balsamic, and oak. Palate has the fruits notes plus some mineral notes. Tannins are rounded and has med acidity. Not a big finish. The alcohol content is high but with the wine is in perfect balance. One to have again.
Pretty developed wine. Pronounced intensity. Dark berries. Black plums. Licorice. Soft tannins.  Best time to drink this vintage.
Interesting that even the winemaker’s note said it is easy drink but I had the other feeling. Yes it was balsamic but oaky vanilla and leather too. Good tannin level. Enjoyable wine.
Strong vanilla flavour. Good qpr
This is very good!  I like the red fruit and the depth of taste. This is a very nice wine.

Very good wine
Medium-bodied. Deep purple color. Low tannins, comfortable mouthfeel and intense flavours of dark berries, and light minerals.

Hm - Exciting but not my cup of tea, due to the strong vanilla flavours from the wood. 
On the other hand, if you like that it‘s gonna be a blast.
Lots of dark cherry, black fruit and touch of liquorice, feels like this will age well.
Nice discovery. Like the pepper vanilla combination. Blackberry body with leather notes in the finish.

Fine entry level wine from this estate. A Bordeaux blend of CF, Merlot, PV and CS. Easier than a regular B, spicier but not completely ripe. 

(3.8) Raspberry nose with noticeable pirazines. Medium acidity, some red fruit, dry, medium bodied, slightly creamy green tanines and paprika, peppery spiciness. Drying finish with baking spices.
Amazing Cuvee from Spain, it has a medium body so is very drinkable and fruity, not really oily, but very smooth. Enjoyed it really! 4.2

A complex wine, with strawberry and some spices like vanilla and cinnamon. Its so elegant in mouth, with a outstanding balance between jammines and acidity, and bold body with nice aftertaste.  It no doubt i wil give 4.2 to this wine. I would drink it again.

Deep purple color. Blueberry jam, blackcurrant, cherry, vanilla, oak cigar box, pine bark and blown-off candle smoke with nostalgic hints of horse stable on the nose. Medium(+) tannins and acidity. Ripe blackberry, black olive and dark chocolate on the tongue. Long coffee espresso and pepper finnish.

Complex 15% ABV blend of Merlot (39%) / Cabernet Franc (30%) / Cabernet Sauvignon (15%) / Petit Verdot (10%) / Syrah (6%). Not the fan of bitter finnish, but it’s a great quality wine!

I rate this bottle 3.9

Bordeaux blend from Castilla. 
Rich fruit nose. Then chocolate, liquorice and rich ripe tannins. 
Strong at 15% but shows balance and some elegance. 
Really nice.
Excellent combination of 4 French grape varieties in a Spanish made wine. Elegant, fruity, modern. Really nice. Highly recommendable.
Bordeaux blend from Spain offers a lot for this price. Medium bodied, vegetal & spicy. Bell peper, raw meat, cherries and nicely integrated oak. 88/100
What a nose! Spicy! Aromas of red chilli and oak shavings full of sour cherry and bark. Very smooth palate; much lighter than expected. Fresh berries and a shorter than thought finish.
Well balanced body, leather, oak ash and ripe blackberries. Better with meats on the heavy side. Open and rest for at least an hour before drinking.
I really enjoyed this Spanish! Great value for the price, especially if you like dark fruit notes. Very dry and opens up from somewhat sweet to more acidic. Bought for $23 at quickie pickie!
Very good wine overall. Elegant, mild body and soft tannins. A little over on the acidity side, but still quite enjoyable.

Amazing. Not too mature, perfect mix of grapes, full of flavours and odours! Got it via Virgin Wines for about £10 ish.

Deep ruby colour. On nose, cinnamon, cocoa, vanilla  and spices notes.  On palate, ripped red and black fruits, very nice acidity, slight mineralisation and elegant wood embedded in velvetly tannins within a superbly balanced structure providing a magnificent, silky-smooth finish.

A very nice Bordeaux style blend from Spain! Dark, lush blackberries and a striking balance of acidity and tannins. Medium/full body. Nice deep purple hue.

Such a good wine to be found at less than $20! If you're bored with Tempranillo and the like, give this a pour.

Bordeaux blend from CastilIa region.

Pronounced nose of plum, vanilla &  cocoa with a hint of green veggies.

Rich acidity, tannin, fruits & alcohol, but the every element is well integrated and keeps good balance. With some umami, very pleasant to drink. The wine was the most reasonable among those at the night, it was the best for me.

3.9. A lovely Spanish Bordeaux blend that takes like a French wine. Some Earth on the nose with lots of ripe cherry on the palate with white pepper and a medium finish. Not a complex wine but one that makes you think a little bit, very pleasant

39% Merlot, 30% Cab Franc, 15% Cab Sav, 10% PV & 6% Shiraz.
Boiling lentils & pinto beans meet stewed red fruit, strawberry marmalade, dusty Mediterranean soil & bushes. Christmas cake, orange peel, gravel, cinnamon & oregano.
The palate has medium acidity & soft tannins.
Wild strawberries, raspberries, white pepper, cardamom & dusty, old cabinet carry the flavors.
Quick finish & underwhelming on the palate, couldn’t hold its own against the charcuterie board. Feels overripe. More CS & PV, less of the rest.

Easy drinking, well rounded Garnacha.  Nice strong nose on initial open.  Primarily dark tart cherries on both the nose and palate, followed by a bit of strawberry.  Bright and crisp acidity, but well balanced with medium tannins.  Good on day one but better on day two.

The secondary notes from age in this still-kickin garnacha show nicely, providing a better than expected experience. Medium bodied and easy to get along with, this is a wine you can pour at will at large gatherings.

Winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

Note:
3.6🌟 Blend of TR/TF/TN/TB, all comes from 25+YO bushes. Aged for 18M in mostly 2&3 use French oak barrels. 
Med ruby, violet reflections, M++ body.
N: Blackberry, blackcurrant, raspberry,  plums, strawberry, damson, cherry and smokey violets. Herbal by juniper, thyme, rosemary. Bit peppery. Chocolate, cedar, vanilla and mineral notes.
T: Juicy w. nice accents of oak and spicy rear palate. Blackberries, blueberries, red&black cherry, raspberry. Chocolate, vanilla, herbs de Provence, pepper mix, minerals.
👇
Winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

Winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

Note: Say hello to this Portuguese powerhouse with royal blood from the Douro region. It’s a blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz according to the label. Ruby colour with lots of medium legs. 18 months of oak layering leads to scents and flavours of oak, smoke and vanilla. Lots of red fruit and black fruit too. Also present: dried fruit, eucalyptus, mint and cinnamon. Medium+ finish with a peppery feel. Silky tannins. Great value. They’ve renovated the old farm to a beautiful quinta nova.
Winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

Comes from Valencia and made of rare grape named Marselan (Cross of CS&Grenache). Matured for 14M in new French oak.
Deep violet, M+ body.
N: Wild cherry, aronia, hawthorn, raisins, unripe blackcurrant&blueberry and raspberry. Basil, oregano, sodium, medical notes, tobacco, green pepper, vanilla, smoke, earthy licorice and leathery hints.
T: Red&blue plums, blueberry, chokeberry, tart cherry. Herbal, earthy, smokey and bit gamey. Floral elements.
👇👇👇
Wine: Just Fucking Good Wine Organic Tinto 2019

Note:
An organic undisclosed blend from Valencia.
Concentrated aromas of stewed dark berries, with Blueberry standing out. Deep, unctuous aromas but alcohol or light VA unbalances it.

A powerful 14.5% with deep, rich flavours and medium tannins.
High acidity, full bodied. 
Great length with lighter fruit and liquorice appearing from the mid palate. 

MLF is apparent after a bit of air. 

Could benefit from from a few more years ageing to integrate and mellow.
Wine: Just Fucking Good Wine Organic Tinto 2019

Note:
Plonk... as we English say. This is glugging wine. Do not think I look down on this wine, far from it!!! The wine is ethically and organically produced and has marvellous if simple appeal. 
It has bags of flavour and very soft rounded tannins and goes remarkably well with tapas. Apparently this is Marselan grapes, the French originated scion of a cross between Cabernet Sauvignon and Grenache. The flavours are of dark plum and forest fruits, maybe a touch of leather.

Deep red purple color. Aromas of cherry, blackberry, oak, and spice. Slightly sweet, dry, low acidity, light body, smooth turning to rough texture. Flavors of cherry, blackberry, oak, chocolate, and earthy.

Blend of 46% Petite Sirah, 52% Malbec & 2% Merlot, deep Ruby with aromas of red and black fruits, herbs and spice. On the palate flavors of ripe blackberry and black cherry with tobacco and black pepper. Rustic tannins, medium+ finish ending with fruit and spice. Drink now, no aging benefit.

Not my typical wine but it went over well with the masses, and I'd take this over Ménage or Apothic any day. 3.2. Rock on friends

Well here is a wine that doesn't quite work. Leathery cedar nose, spicy flavors of blackberry and smoke - all fine - but there is an unripe, slightly sour finish that pops up long after. I respect the length of the finish, an extra half star for that, and the price is nice, but the after taste is mildly unpleasant.

Having a hard time trying to figure out how I feel about this wine. Pretty opalescent purple in the glass. Faint nose of blackberry with a flinty edge. Flavors of dark summer fruits sit on a very earthy background. There is an odd yeasty/tartness on the finish, which is kind of off-putting. Like a marathoner that can't finish the race, this wine just can't quite cross the finish line. Lovely, well crafted but it only gets about 3/4 of the way home. Some may like it but I won't be buying again. Really 3.25/5

Found this blend initially similar  to the winery's Trail Boss Cab Sauv. However, while both start out sweet & smooth this Tenacious Red lacks the spicy bite of the Cab Sauv. It's fairly fruit forward and medium bodied, not too dry, with a smooth finish. Much like the Trail Boss it's a decent red that is pleasant yet unexceptional.

Plum nose, medium body deep purple colour, starts moderately sweet with and off dry with initial plum and black cherry notes and hints of pepper ending smooth and sweet with mild tannins and a hint of oak.

PURPLE COWBOY for a PURPLE COWGIRL.

I found the perfect hostess gift for my wine loving friend who owns a pair of purple cowboy boots.

I will post the review of this wine if she decides to serve it. In the meantime, it's a delight to have low key, non wine snob friends who deeply appreciate any gift of wine you bring.

The more I learn about wine's finer attributes, the more I realize that wine snobs have every right to hone in on faults & specifics. I respect that.

I respect relationships more. Amen.

A great surprise from Douro. Produced from Touriga Nacional, Touriga França and Tinta Roriz, it has a beautiful nose, with aromas of blackberry, plum and oak. Full bodied, velvety tannins, a nice structured texture and with a nice acidity. On the palate, again, black fruit, but also tobacco, hints of cherry, violet and oaky notes. The long finish makes it a very nice and pleasant finishing.
Loved this one! Cherry blossoms, oak, vanilla, cocoa, tobacco, dark berries great balance, a blend from Douro.
I’m getting some spice from this but lovely.

Not really a wine I know much about, but frankly very delicious. Deep red, fruit, slate and cedar. Rich, but just about fresh enough so it never became a chore. Really nice quality for £20.
Wine with good strong taste. Smell also good but no so strong, what makes wine very smooth for drinking. vanilla black fruit blackberry cherry dark chocolate oak
Mid to full bodied touriga and roriz fest. Acidity kicks in first and the fruitiness follows. Very well made.

On August 21st at home, with wife & kids, my wife prepared a delicious codfish that we paired with this jewell from Portugal, Douro, by Roquette & Cazes winery. Intense violet red color & red reflexes. Ellegant nose with raspberries, strawberries & black currant, wrapped in tobacco, toast & spicy notes. In mouth, ellegant & well structured, silky & well integrated tannins, full bodied, adequate acidity, delivering gorgeous red fruit flavors honoring nose till its lingering & lovely smoked cherry aftertaste. Cheers!
Perfect
Top
Deep ruby color, blackberry, black cherry, plum, medium plus aftertaste with nice vanilla, oak and light spice. Even slightly better than 2017. Very nice.
Finesse on the nose and hearty in flavour. This hits the spot. Found it on special in a local wine store. Highly recommended. Deep cheery, liquorice and mild chocolate.

Douro! Collaboration between 🇵🇹 fam. Roquette & 🇫🇷 fam. Cazes, very nice! Decanted for 4h to balance out. Very inviting, warm, smooth &  fruity nose with raspberries, black cherries, plums & blueberries. Furthermore Mon Chéri, garrigue like herbs, fine touch of cedar & vanilla spot, touch of liquorice & some blond tobacco. Quite juicy on the palate with fruity & elegant acidity and some spices. Long silky finish with smooth balsamic Mon Chéri ending & coffee spot. What a nice bottle this is! 4.3 👌

Loved this wine! Great bouquet & the tastes kept on coming with this silky smooth wine; cassis, smoky, vanilla, black cherry & a lovely sweet lingering finish. Medium to fuller bodied so grab hold of this one if you have the chance; highly recommended after decanting for a couple of hours.

Deep red with rose highlight. 
Aromas of truffle, coffee, chocolate, oak, leather, red currant, cranberries. 
Dry, fairly bold, slightly acidic and a velvety long tannin finish. 
Notes of plum, blackberry, cherry, opens with raspberry and mellows out into truffle play dough. 
Great wine 
4.1
To much vanilla.

The wine is apparently a result of a project between Quinta do Cranston and Chateau Lynch-Bages, which probably explains why I enjoyed it so much. Elegant, Full bodied yet fresh with silky tannins. Dark fruit, plum, chocolate with a bit of oak. Really good for the price.
This is stunning. Almost went for a full 5 ⭐️. Powerful dark plum punch, oak and vanilla. Really leaves you wanting more.
91 for me. Full bodied, deep cherry, vanilla, oak. Well balanced. A great Portuguese red with some character. Fairly good value @€18
Great Portuguese Duero. Full body, round, raisin, black berry with fresh tones of red fruit. Dining with @[1|937288|Mark van Delft]

Project from the Roquette (Crasto Douro) and Cazes (Lynch-Bages) families. Dark berries and cherries. Oak (18 months). A really nice bottle at a very fair price.
Powerful and yet elegant. Dark fruit, vanilla, sweet licorice and tobacco. Fresh acidity and mature tannins in a long beautiful finish. Perfect with red meat.
Balanced oak, blackberry , violet, sophisticated, smooth. Excellent highly recommended oak black fruit blackberry cherry violet blueberry blackcurrant @
Packed full of jammy dark fruit, plum, cassis. Some red fruit. Good amount of oak and tobacco. Hint of vanilla and also some floral notes on the nose.
Fruity smoky noise. Lots of fruits, cherries, currents, vanilla, oak, pepper as it goes down.

4,3 - once again a great Douro red. Bold, great fruit but a lot of finesse. Long.

Wow!!
Will definitely be investing into this wine again
Loved this Douro. Balanced, mild body, mild acidity. Vanilla and black fruit notes. Very pleasant.
O’Briens wine festival- really good example of a Douro. Superb
As fruit forward and intense as a Port, but without the alcohol. Impressive Portuguese Red outside of their usual fortified produce

Delicious Bordeaux blend.
Dark red fruits, vanilla and oak. Full bodied and balanced.
oak vanilla plum black fruit
A very nice wine to match.

Touriga N, Touriga F and Tinta Roriz blend. Bold and well structured. Dark fruit and mild vanilla notes on the attack, red fruit and an intersting freshness on the long finale. Opens truly after +3h from unbottling. Remarkable.

Was looking for a moment to take it off my wishlist! Full body and powerful, but with incredible smoothness which really impressed me. Notes of fresh red fruit like strawberry and raspberry, hints of oak and violet. Lush and dense, with long aftertaste. Great wine for Mother’s Day lunch!

Very beautiful Douro 👌 not frequently in love with the Portuguese side but this one was a very pleasant surprise. Dark ruby color with a nice gradient, elegant notes of plum and oak on the nose mixed with some vanilla on the palet. Intense bouquet with a long finish.

A great Douro wine. A result of the united efforts of a great Portuguese winemakers family and the prestigious Bourdeaux oenologists from Chateau Lynch-Bages. The result is really a mix of an Atlantic-driven Portuguese corpulent red wine with the expression of finesse (more in some years' time) of Bordeaux.

Fragant aromas of fresh red forest fruits, intense sweety underforestry, cotton candy.  A hint of raspberry-flavoured children toothpaste. In mouth, less refined as expected but with full potential. 3D.

Deep purple color. Violet, cherry, black cherry, tobacco, vanilla, and prune jam on the nose. The palate follows the nose and is full with vanilla and tobacco. This wine has loads of silky tannins and a long aftertaste. It is fantastic and definitely worth the money!

94/100. What a good wine! Intense, bold, spicy and gentle. Notes of blackberry, cedar, tobacco, violet and fresh strawberry. A class of a wine. Can you imagine what time will make to this wine? Only good things. Young and powerful. Great douro and Bordeaux combination. Smeels like a bordeaux but tastes like douro. We should be doing more this marriage. Cheers

Second time I have had this wine and it is just as excellent as I remember. The sell of ‘Portuguese wine with french influence’ is an accurate one - classic Douro intensity; blackberries, tobacco, wet leaves. But has the rich oak and refinement of Bordeaux. 

Great tannic finish.

4.5/5
One of the most elegant and complex Douro wines in this QPR category.
The wine is packed with black fruits, especially plums, wrapped in a thick vanilla blanket and surrounded by pleasant hints of tobacco.

Great wine from the Douro valley and the best Portuguese wine that I've tasted so far. Full-bodied with lush and dense fruity flavours from blackberry, plum, cherry and violet. Accompanied by oak, vanilla and almonds from the 18 months aging in the french oak barrels. Long lasting and smooth finish leaving you to wish for some more (94/100).

A Qta. do Crasto & Lynch Bages JV. Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz & Touriga Franca, 18m in French oak.

Med ruby. Blackberry, black cherry, damson & raspberry provide ample fruit. Oak influence is classically French in style w. spice box, cedar, liquorice, clove & anise. Some tertiary of leather, cured meat & tobacco. Developing.

Dry. Ripe w. raspberry, black cherry, blackcurrant & loganberry. Liquorice, clove & leather. M+ alc, m+ fine tannins, high acid & lovely balance & concentration to a long finish.

Definitely a 4.2 or higher
 At de monsoon Michelin with suckling pig
  Absolutely superb  Beth mold black fruits. Let ot breathe.

The bouquet has Notes of sulphur and chemicals. Chemicals, wood and a dry and full body make for a great treat with enough structure and power to match red meat or even truffle. 

Recommended.
4.4 Really delicious.  Red fruits. Medium+ acidity. I would not place this in Portugal. More so Bordeaux. So wine making certainly had some influence. Great price point for this bottle.

Wow! Very interesting wine.
Beatiful violet color.
Well balanced with oak.Full and rich palate with a long finish.
Touriga Nacional60%
Touriga Franc25%
Tinta Roriz15%
Ótimo vinho!
Deep & dark as a forest lake. Well-balanced with plenty of dark berries and a long finish. Could easily be shelved for a couple of years more. Great buy 👍
Very nice wine subtile oak, nice balance of acidity. Not to tannic, with hints of red and black fruit
Great wine. Although with 14,5% you don’t feel... extremely smooth and great finish. Plum, cherry and pepper. Great wine
Top 8.5
Christmas dinner 2021. Excellent wine.
This wine is so good!  Big, bold, deep purple, and a mouthful of dark cherries, blueberries, mocha, and velvety tannins.  Just wow!

From the Douro valley, Aged in french oak for 18 months. 
Interesting blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Balanced and delicious with notes of  vanilla, red fruit,  oak, and violet. Lovely long finish. 
Abv sitting at 14.5%
Decanted for an hour.
This is an excellent full body red.  Enjoyed after some fine French Bordeaux and it really stood its ground.   Fruity and smooth.  Will get more

Nose: tobacco, cherry, dark fruit, leather, oak, some spices. Taste : cherry, slight vanilla, full bodied, low/medium acidity, quite dry, smooth, medium cherry finish that is nice. 4.3 A good Portuguese Douro red, very drinkable. I picked this up for £18 - bargain. Great QPR.

Beautifully bold Douro red, with a fragrant nose with jam and violet. Pronounced legs and opens to some vanilla. Mouth full of dark fruit, plum and distinct oak. Sublime finish! Glad I have a second bottle!
A ruby red complexion with hints of chocolate, red berries and a hint of violet and spice on the nose. This extends through to the palate with cherries and medium tannins
(4.1) Impressive value for money. Smells of dark fruit and subtle toasted oak. Even at 14%, it still feels cool and restrained with dry tannins and well judged oak influence.
Deep garnet colour, vanilla oaky mocha blackcurrant, peppery high but smooth tannins, good acidity, balance of fruit and oak, full body, long finish, potential for ageing
4 stars simply for how cheap this is. 3 to 3.5 for me - a bit floral - but for $15 it's full of expression and personality. Recommend trying.
blackberry blackberry very smooth medium tannins Long lasting aftertaste could easily compete with Argentine Malbec rated at similar level
Dark purple, black fruit, ripe, herbs. Still modern and ripe and for early drinking, but significantly better than the 2003 version.
A very curious red that begins with too active tannins and develops to be a smooth, dense and consistent round flavour with a very good balance!
a Lynch & Bages portiguese wine.... the heritage is evident.  splendid tanin aftertaste with a solid acid nose.  Great experience
Full bodied, deep dark fruits, particularly blackberry, licorice, high acid, smooth, and delicious. Highly recommended and a great deal price wise.

Color of a deep purple, opaque.
Aroma and flavor of fresh black and red fruits - black fruits of plum and blueberries and red fruit of cherry and strawberry -, a powerful oak, tobacco, some leathery, vibrant spices like pepper.
In the mouth, a high intensity wine, but with an impeccable equilibrium, good tannins, medium acidity, good alcohol.

It's a so vivid, so flavorful and intense but precise wine that I only see in the best portuguese. Excellent wine.
Beefcake of a wine! Big Douro t-nac led triple blend but could easily have guessed a quality Bordeaux. Black cherry, oak, BIG tannins, and m+ finish. Better yet to come but drinking super now
Plum tobacco blackberry very very smooth tannins.   Thanks wynn for the discovery!

Dinner with Tomas Roquette from Quinta do Crasto, promoted by the blog vaocubo.com, April 18th.

Rounded and young, long life ahead.

Rate 4.2
A flowery Bordeaux like wine. Violet, bit of vanilla, pleasant tannins. Delightful
oak tobacco vanilla black fruit
This is amazing. Really a great treasure!
Verdict stands as the last time
Vertical tasting in 2018-02-28.
Spicy, black fruit, some leather and oaky notes. Medium-high acidity, medium tannins, medium-long finish. Buy again.
Dark red. Liked the nose, wood, licory. Pronounced acidity. Spicyness increasing by the glass. Mild tannins.
Dark violet in color strong spicy aroma. Very smooth yet complex and bold. Very good company for meat.

Deep ruby colour.

Lovely on the nose with pronounced intensity, aromas of vanilla, chocolate, blackcurrant, plum and some herbal notes.

Pronounced intensity on the palate with lovely balance, medium plus acidity, medium plus but well integrated tannins, full body, high alcohol, medium plus finish.

Really enjoyable wine and punches above its price point for complexity and depth (was under £17 on sale). Great straight after opening, even better after 1hr in decanter.

Fantastic QPR ratio for this wine. Full bodied beauty with medium (+) acid and medium well polished tannins. Black cherry, cassis, smoke, cigar and pepper. Very approachable now, probably made for early drinking. Fantastic quality for the price. Highly recommended.
Dark ruby color. Licorice, maraschino cherries, and vanilla on both the palette and nose. Full bodied, high acidity, with tannins that could use some time to mellow.
Second bottle of this big red. Still a bit firm but with added tones of herbs and spice. Plenty of dark fruit but still not at its peak. Best in a years time.
M intensity. Ripe fruits, sweet spices, oak, pepper. M  tannins and acidity. Nice complexity. A great positive surprise and a new experience drinking Portugal wine
Great balance of acids and tannins. Nice lingering finish. Taste of blackberries and hints of tobacco. Nice oak. I like this wine.

On the nose: blackberries, black cherries, dried plum, cedar
on the tongue: very well structured and integrated tannins and acidity, full and rich palet but still keeping it elegant, condensed black fruit flavors with a hint of oak. Long finish

Port grape varieties vinified in a dry style by a partnership between a Portuguese and French (Paulliac) vintner. 

Deep ruby in the glass and a med+ intense nose of plum, black berry, spices, sour cherry, pepper, oak and vanilla.
On the palate dry with a med+ acidity, med+ body, med tannins, high alc and a med+ finish with notes of black cherry, chocolate and jammy plum.

This is a stylish combination of two styles and families - grapes and taste of a Portuguese wine with a Bordeaux-style winemaking technique (aged for 18 months in French oak). Very elegant wine with great body and finish. One of my all-time favourites

Amazingly fulfilling adventure with this one. Quite complex on the nose. Definitely oaky, huge amounts of vanilla and lots of ripe black fruits. Mouth full of blackberry, some plum, dark cherry and vanilla. Nicely structured tannins, velvety texture. Round and long finish. Solid 4.3⭐️.

Very stylish & classical taste of a Portuguese wine with a Bordeaux-style winemaking technique. Elegant bouquet of vanilla, violet, lavender and some wild berries fruits. Its very velvety and delicious on the palate, tannins were absolutely refined, lovely & smooth like a Bordeaux! There's a noticeable notes of spices, toast, vanilla, raisins and strong presence of oaks too! (Aged for 18 months in French oak); Persistent, long & firm finish. 95 Points!

Excellent, extremely rich and well balanced. At the end of 2021 still young, tannic and full of strength. (plum, tobacco, blackberry dark fruit) Seems like became better still my previous tasting in 2019. Very confident.

I mean... what a wine! I asked my wife to taste blind and she said “some weird kind of Bordeaux “ reading the label afterwards... she could not have guessed better... it is a Douro & Bordeaux JV and the Douro family is the Crasto’s. What a wine. Super floral with some dark red berries... GOODNESS
Really nice, layered Douro wine which starts off as a Bordeaux and then evolves to a more southern treat in the glass. 4 stars because of the serious price.

Interesting to revisit this Douro which is the result of a cooperation between a Portuguese and Bordeaux wine family. Had this vintage already two years ago. Nothing indicates slowing down of the evolution potential.

Typical nose with black cherry, vanilla, slightly charred oak and black currant followed by a still youthful palate with strong but balanced acidity & tannins, alcohol, blackberry and black cherry. Revisit in another two years? 3.8
Light and nice
Stewed plum, raisin, blackberry, black cherry, tobacco, crushed rock
A really wellmade portuguese. A round body with notes of cherries, plums and a touch of cranberries. Wellbalanced acids and medium to low tannins that gives a long and soft aftertaste.
4.3. Very pleasant, smooth yet bold. Does drink like a Bordeaux. Oak, vanilla, cherry, violet.
Deep red colour. Beautiful violet, mixed berries, soft herbs and forest floor. Fine tannins and rounded acidity. Fresh, aromatic and lingering finish. A really nice wine at reasonable price.
Beautiful wine, soft tannins and wonderful with hearty foods

Perfectly balanced! Good opening time. Doesn't seem like a 2007. I would say younger.
Aroma: red fruits, tobacco, eucalyptus
Mouth:  full , good acidity that gives it a nice long finish
Rich color, nose and fruit taste. Dry and tart. Smoothed as it opened. Going to decant the next bottle. It paired well with grilled tri-tip.
French-styled Portuguese wine. Clear, deep purple. Clean, high intensity aroma of black fruit, tobacco, nutmeg, vanilla. Dry, high acidity, high tannins, full body and long finish.
great with lamb.. not much tannín or aftertaste
Completely opaque and dark ruby in color with cherry on the nose with tobacco, herb, black currant and cherry on the mid palate and balanced tannins. I highly recommend this Portuguese Douro red!

Another nice Douro, with the 3 main grape varieties from this region: Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz (known as Tempranillo in Spain) and Touriga Franca. 
Oaky, full bodied and long lasting
Excellent douro with a French twist, soft velvet and red berries and finishes with subtle oak, truly delicious. Licorice and cherries come through but all very well balanced.
Bramble blackberry leather and cinnamon
Oak, tobacco and black fruit. Nice wine that fitted perfectly with a rib eye steak.
Deep ruby color. Nose is tarry, with violets and black and red fruit, it reminds me a bit of Barolo. The taste is red fruit, full bodied, clingy tannins and heat up nose. Great wine.
oak vanilla and black fruit are wonderfully coming together.
So genial !!
Very decent Douro. Still young and needs decanting. Air opens it to a lovely bouquet that fits well with meat dinners. Medium acidity, somewhat complex, gentle oak.
Great wine. Very complex to the nose with fresh berry fruit notes and elegant hints of violet and spice.
Really impressive, couldn’t quite brink myself to give it 4.5. Deep and dark, a wine with a purple hue. Reminded me a bit of some of the expressive wines of the Southern Rhone, perhaps Gigondas?

A casual one I got from airport to drink in hotel room while I do some reading while the kid napping lol. Powerful red with a good amount of cassis , dark fruits, wild berries and medium long finish. Abv 14.5.
Tastes like an altentejo
Full bodied, strong oaky notes. Amazing Portuguese find.

Beautiful violet colour. Intense aromas of berries, like blueberry and blackberry, ripe cherry, hints of violet, cigar box, vanilla, oak, cinnamon, coffee beautiful soft tannins, good acidity, with a long finish. Superb wine.

Cellar clean out thursday, 

Douro. Producer Roquette & Cazes. 60% touriga nacional, 25% touriga franca and 15% tinta roriz 

Dark, blue-red colour. Full bodied. Nice structure with the acidity 

On the nose spices, plum, cherries and tobacco. Florals, mint and toffee. On the palate oak, plum, black cherries, coffee and violet pastilles. Chrushed black peppercorn and some blueberry jam 

Always a pleasure going for Portugal and this time was no exception. Paired well with a rib eye steak. Solid 4,0 stars

.....I don't have a lot of first hand knowledge about wine from Portugal, but that's likely to change thanks to this wine; I' a huge fan of big, bold reds and this certainly one; best described as Napa Cabernet-like richness and structure.

A dark red color. On the nose. aroma of blackcurrant, plum and spices. The palate follows the nose. A full-bodied complex and elegant wine. Fresh and juicy. Vell integrated tannins. A long and tasteful ending.

This is good stuff.
         
My rating is 3.9 Stars.
           
Keep on drinking my Vivino friends.

Ruby colour. Beautiful rich nose with blackberry, black currant, plum, some earthy notes, leather, oak, licorice and vanilla. On the mouth, it shows good acidity, well resolved tannins and a long spicy and concentrated finish.

Incredible partnership between Joao Roquette (Crasto) and JM Cazes frenchman from Bordeaux.

70 hectares  of vineyards located in the heart of the Cima Corgo. These are carved into the xist bedrock on the hills above the Douro river, reaching altitudes of around 2000ft.
Vineyard terraces are planted to a host of classic Port varieties, in traditional mixed plantings.The winemaking at Quinta do Crasto combines traditional foot-treading lagares with state-of-the-art temperature-controlled equipment.

Monster!

Rev:(ENG this time)
Blend of Portuguese grape varieties with winemaking of Daniel Llose (Château Lynch-Bages) and Manuel Lobo (Quinta do Crasto).
Opaque on the color with violet rim at the edges. Forest fruits, plums, violets, sweet spices, chocolate and discrete presence of tobacco on the nose. In mouth full-bodied, well integranted tannins, nice balance and a relatively long finish. It's difficult not to like and looking at his price range is always a very good option

Rich and velvety Douro.


👁 clear deep ruby

👃clean, medium intensity, complex, aromas of black cherry, black currant, black pepper, charred wood, cedar, cocoa and vanilla. Youthful 

👅 dry, with medium (+) acidity, medium tannins high alcohol. Medium (+) intensity flavors of black cherry, black currant, vanilla, dark chocolate and smoke. Medium (+) body and medium (+) length finish

🎯 very good quality, drink now suitable for further ageing.

Dark and inky coming out of the bottle, this is an incredible value. A nose that speaks of dark fruit leads to a balanced coating of the palate. The flavors are dark and brooding, but not overbearing. Plum, leather, clove, peppercorn and oak meld together for a middleweight powerhouse. My second Douro, but definitely not my last.

Opulent ruby colour with an elegant nose of dark cherries, plums and herbs. The palette was a bit tight and rather jammy on opening. My first thought was: too young?

Re-read the label to find the advice of decanting. Oh well.... Anyway, it did open up to very well integrated flavours of herbs and dark fruit. Medium body with long-ish finish.

Fantastic deep dark burgundy in the glass. Smells of olive, bramblebush, black fruits. On the palate - wow an expressive bouquet of flavors. Very well structured. Violet, oak, hibiscus, black cherry, plum, sun dried tomato, vanilla, dried fruit. 4.6 overall.

Excellent red from the Douro.  Cassis and dark berries on the fruit layer.  Deep aromas of sage and dried herbs blend in with black olives, cedar and toasted coconut.  Balsamic.  A bit of vanilla cream.  Good body with a long lasting finish. Tannins are smooth but show their presence towards the finish. Well balanced acidity.  Although a dry wine, seems to have a very discreet residual sweetnes. A great wine.

Profound ruby colour. Pronounced aroma intensity, violets, fresh black fruit, varnish. Nail polish, floral, vannilla, toast, coconut.
Dry, medium+ acidity, high tannins and alcool. Medium+ body, pronounced flavour intensity. Black fruits, poched plums, oak, toast, cassis leaf, pepper, cherry, sourcherry. Long finish. It can be drank now but it has ageing potential.

Vintage 2014
Consumed July 2021

2 hours decanted

Eye - Violet purple, heavy viscosity and legging. Bright rim hue, sign of prime

Nose - Chalk, plum, licorice, vanilla, orange peel. note of pepper and tobacco. Complex.

Mouth - Juicy acid, smooth fine tannic presence. Chewy and lightly dry & heady. Med-bodied with excellent oaky plum-ish finish. Med-long length.

Comparatively much better after decanted, than bottle pour - as compared to another tasting of the same wine.

Our hosts were very kind to serve this wine on New Years eve! I appreciate that🙂
Oh well, every wine geek knows this project, so I ain’t going to repeat this for the millionth time...
Instead of writing that down, I’m just going to do a little refill with this Portuguese Douro nectar! Oh bummer, empty bottle!
Thierry, where can I find myself another one?!?...🍷🥳🍷

Portuguese wine theme evening with a HUGE line up of 20+ bottles

Got to try only 14, without spitting a single drop... which meant a BIG hangover the second day 😂

So I am only rating them based on how much I liked each. No Notes

Very approchable now

CHEERS 🍷

This is a very good wine. Old french-portuguese family making a more than decent blended douro red. It is 8 years old and survived a double move from Lisbon to Switzerland to Singapore and still alive a kicking!

4, 2 deep garnet hue, aromas of black cherries, black berries with vanilla and ceder notes.Full bodied with Velvety tannins and a medium plus finish. Sexy and bold, big family affair, two big families uniting to create this beauty, Lynche bages and Quinta Do crasto. Best of both worlds, stoked

a few months latter, not very different.. means an excellent wine! the aromas ( red fruits, oak) the mouth, the body, the long final... the pleasure!! fortunately i have a few more bottles to taste! good in this turbulent times..

Really solid wine from Portugal.  At 6 years old this blend delivers all sorts of flavors.  Lots of brooding dark fruit, mint ,eucalyptus,  sage.  It's a bit surprising what time can do this is my second and last bottle which is much better than my first bottle.  

Full body blend with lots of flavors of that will go well with many dishes.  Wish I had more seems like this will last another 5 years without a problem.  91 pts qpr $30.

Deep purple. M- nose with plums and blueberries and hints of earthiness and liquorice. Full body, m acidity, tannins and m  alcohol. M- length. Spices, vanilla, black fruit and blueberries. Nice and complex wine with good balance!

Dark red earthy tones.
Aromas of fresh strawberries, violet and a hi T of citrus.
On the palate it's chocolate and coffee. I really like the heavy concentrated spike of those tones.
Great balance of grapes, tannin and acidity.
Would pair with Italian or even Indian cuisine. Not the perfect stand alone wine.
3.85

Clear, medium ruby.
Nose: Intensity M. Cedro. Black fruit. Red flower. A young wine.
Mouth: Dry. High acidity. Tanino M. Body M. Alcohol M. Fresh red fruit. Spices. White pepper. Licorice.
Final: Medium more. Very good wine. Drink now, but it has the potential to guard because it has a lot of acidity and good fruit that over time can develop interesting flavors in the bottle.

Deep dark purple! 
Collaboration of Crasto and Lynch Bages proprietor Michel Cazes.
The fruit smolders from the glas and perfumes the air. This budy is charming and elegant. Grafite and sweet tannin bursting the scene. Great approach!

Roquette family (Portugal) + Cazes family (France) for Douro Valley wine. Aged 18 years in French oak. Strong - 14.5%, but not feeling it. The first - very tannic taste, after raisins, vanilla, dark fruits, some cherry notes. Colour - dark red.
Elegant, berries, well balanced marriage of Cazes and Roquette. Grapes new fir me... on my journey into the wines of Portugal!
One of the best.  Earthy dry rich.
Still excellent, a very enjoyable wine

Had one bottle in Lisbon time out food hall.
Did not Analyse but loved it
Best in Finnair lounge
Really good, taste of plums, a bit vanilla...

What a beauty! Gentle and soft tannines. Souplesse is what I want to mention this great wine from the Douro. A flowery taste with red fruit and a lengthy taste. We want to buy more the year 2015. Similar to this wine is e.g. a grand bordeaux for the price of an average bottle.

A Pauillac-based winemaker has tried to make a Bordeaux-style blend out of Portuguese grapes.

The result is a powerful blend of 60% Touriga Nacional, 25% Touriga Franca and 15% Tinta Roriz. Aged for 18 months in French oak barrels.

Opaque colour with bluish purple rim.

Complex nose with cherry and other berries, oak, spices and a thick leather jacket.

Elegant yet powerful palate. Full bodied. Grippy tannins. Balanced finish.

Roquette & Cazes Duoro 2018

🏆 Lovely Duoro w top pedigree from Bordeaux/Duoro valley for a pretty insane price… intense, full of fruit & spice, rly satisfying!

🍇 Touriga Nacional 60%, Touriga Franca 25%, Tinta Roriz 

👁 Dark ruby w purple rim 

👃 Plum, wild strawberry, cinnamon, ripe bramble - 🙌

👅 Dry, med+ body w med+ tannin, med: acidity & alc at 14%. Red plum, blackberry, fruitcake, sour cherry, plum & hints of sweet tobacco, fresh leather. Super well balanced, full on yet fresh & great fruit notes.

Yum, bought on basis of excellent V reviews & it delivered. 
Blind would guess a quality 🇫🇷 varietal, so not surprised to see the collaboration with Lynch-Bages + the 18 months in 🇫🇷 oak, but untypical 🇫🇷 grapes of Tourigo Nacional, Franco + Tinto Roriz.
Dark fruit, oak and vanilla on the subtle nose (maybe a touch of cherry?) lead into lush body with few tannins, yet a rare intensity for a 4 year old wine.
Some liquorice notes in the finish.
Great with chicken supper & on a livestream video call later.

What a delight. Well balanced, fruity, fresh acidity and smooth tannins. Notes of plum, cassis, blueberry jam, dark chocolate, oak, vanilla and mint. Silky texture and medium long finish. Very good value!

Aromas of cherry, black pepper, oak, raspberry, soft dark chocolate & licorice. Flavors include plum, cherry, black pepper, orange peel, dark & milk chocolate, with high yet balanced acidity & tannins. Full body with a rich plum & oak finish. Rough texture & a concentrated dense structure.

typical Portuguese punch. Cinnamon and black cherry notes. High acidity, the tannins are felt, another year or two in the bottle will calm this down and really bring the fruit to life because there is plenty in it!

Deep purple color.
On nose blackberries, boysenberries, black currant, vanilla, oak.
On palate full bodied, high a bit burning alcohol, medium non-persistent and developed tannins. Confirming nose + tobacco, chocolate. Great balance and complexity. Intense fruit characteristics. Long finish.

Much oak and even more vanilla, this almost smells like a strawberry Crème Brûlée on the nose. It’s a very good wine actually, with a hugely pleasing and complex experience being delivered on the palate. It’s intensely smooth and very moreish, with some delightful vanilla and an excellent fruity smooth finish gleefully abounding. I want to say something silly, but this is quite nice so I’ll try not too. Upside-down ducks. Oh dear, I failed.

In-flight selection. Wine with character, still young, but already expressing well. Dry, deep ruby colour, full body. Structured, fleshy, black fruit, blackberry, black cherry, jammy, oak, smoke. Lovely, wine. This can be kept in the cellar for another 5 to 10y and maybe more.

🍷a dark blueberry red 
👃🏼top aromas of sour cherries (when agitated), with smooth and seeet underlying aromas of mocha (coffee and chocolate) and a dryness coming from smoke
and finishing with truffle and leather. A very complex bouquet of aromas.
👄 slight acidic of sour cherry before smoothing out to leather, chocolate, coffee and mushroom. A hint of play dough and mushroom whixh is probably coming from the truffle. Bold and dry wine with fairly well developed tannins. Incredibly balanced with a long finish

4.2⭐️
2nd outing & with a bit more time to ruminate on it, I’m even more impressed. On opening - intense, dense puréed black & red berries, very fruit forward. But w/complexity of oak spice, mineralic notes, puckering acidity, gorgeous high, fine tannin it’s a wonderful, fresh mouthful. Benefitted hugely from a days aeration, where the exuberant vanilla tinged fruit seemed to settle into the wine. 

Balance is everything, case in point. 

🍇60% Touiga Nacional | Touriga Franca 25% | Tinta Roriz 15%

Starting a tasting of all the Quinta do Crasto wines, by drinking a hybrid produced together with the family from Lynch-Bages.
This vintage will possibly be a 4,5 with 4h decanting- but has nail remover varnish and stickiness in abundance straight from the bottle. 
However with patience, a very friendly and long fresh pine / herbaceous induced Douro drink.
The price worthiness is amazing considering who the parents are.🙏🏻

Now very good, in some years it will be fantastic... Deep ruby colour with a sprinkle of granat,  clean and cristal in the nose floral Touriga Nacional at it's best,  long finish and very interesting body...  Follow and don't lose sight...  it will  grow ...

Douro wine! 

Wow this one is really good, still room for further improvement given its very young age, only 5years, can improve the next decade for sure. The wine is a collaboration between the family Roquete 🇵🇹 and Cazes 🇫🇷, nice to see such great wines coming out. 

A great full bodied wine, completely my style, with ripe black fruits, cherry, blackberry, vanilla, leather, great spices, good tannins, wine with a long lasting finish. Already very good but will gain more balance. 
Rate 4,3⭐️
Douro blend with dark fruits, violet, spices and toasty aromas. Round, acidic, full bodied. Earthy  and warm with a long finish.
Very good Douro. Strong violet and berries. Tannic with long finish. A successful cooperation with the owner of Château Lynch/Bages.

Agree with Vivino rate of 4.2
Deep purple color, nice aroma, very smooth.
Powerful, rich, well balanced with long finish. 
Very enjoyable.

Well balanced, elegant
Beautiful nose
Stunning... dark fruits, some cinnamon going on...👍🏼
Happy friyaaayy
One year since last tried and it’s perfect. Bold and balance. Go Portugal.
Mind bending. Very intense flavors and taste. So much cherry.
This is proper razzle dazzle, get some

Wow a stunning Red with a Bordeaux style! 
A cooperation with Lynch Bages from Bordeaux!
Very nice.
A Last Bottle special. Very solid and priced well. Spicy and fruity - plum and clove. Highly recommended.
Bold and juicy blend of red and dark fruits. Dry, sweetened with vanilla and floral aromas. Full bodied flavors deliciously presented. Nicely balanced with oak and leather
Let it decant for 90” and opened up.  Was better than 1st bottle.  This is a very good wine but there are much better choices in the $35 price range

Deep purple in the glass, cooked black fruits are dominant here, plus some oak; somehow fresh to the nose but intense. High acidity, high tannins and alcohol, full body and long finish.. palate confirms nose for this excellent red from Douro DO in Portugal
Complex and elegant. 9,0 PM

Portuguese wine 
Dark fruit purple colours. black fruit plum blackberry cherry oak tobacco vanilla chocolate almond
Lovely wine. Deep ruby colour in the glass, smooth and fruity with a taste of blackcurrants and a hint of cherry.
Aromas of rape fruits and violet with notes of wood. Full body, well structured, long and soft finishing.
Purple colour, deep dark berries, oak, long length. Very Bordeaux rich and generous. Drink with steak!
Deep beautiful color. Intense flavor of black berries. Long finish. My kind of full bodied red wine blend from Portugal
Good bold red wine. Very dark with no mudding. Prunes with a slight vinegar and green peppers noes. Very hight tannins.
Wonderful Portuguese red wine. Really you have to taste it. It is so sweet, so delicious with a nice meat. 👏👏👏🤓
this is a Douro wine! rich full of life, intense on mouth and nose. Full bodied...powerfull. Better with friends!
Very complex and a little bit strong. Dark berries both on the nose and in the palate. Aged leather marks the lasting.
Hints of berries and violet. This is an elegant and structured wine with soft tannins and a long finish.
Dark ruby, notes of cherry and berries, light floral touch, long finish on the palate. Very well balanced, light yet full of character.
WIP

@[1|29860604|Gareth Griffith]Wow what a tasty wine. Took about 1.5hrs in the decanter to really open up. But really intriguing on first opening. Cherry, redberry on the nose wet earthy tones. Slightly acidic well rounded. Leaves you wanting more. 100% would have it again.

Goodness - what a beauty. The nose is superb, and the taste does not disappoint. Never heard of the grape (shameful, I know) had on a balcony in Madeira. Some beautiful chocolate, vanilla deep rich berries with a long finish. Well worth a try ❤️

Excellent traditional Douro red blend of 60 TNacional, 25 TFranca and 15 Tinta Roriz. Was terrific with BBQ pulled pork. 

Deep purple-black color with a translucent rim. 

Nose of dark fruit,  dark brown sugar and tree bark. 

Opening of ripe black fruit favoring blackberry and blueberry with leather, violet, dried leaves and graphite. 

Medium- plus bodied and medium acidity with a deep, complex tannin structure that starts strong and fades with respect.

Peace and cheers!

My first Portuguese Duoro Red, Milky, Oak. Hint of Flora. As time progresses, it develops the Oaky are much stronger, eventualy it ended with a lovely Flora smell. Bold, surpisingly very dry, only reduced after some time with a hint of spiciness and a much stronger tannin on the  palate. However, i felt was not that refine. Very good on the nose but don't really enjoy the taste. Price $56.70 with 18% disc.
Nice, but quite strong!  A true full bodied flavorful PT wine😀
Great douro
Oak cherry
liked it. smooth
Spicy, oaky, bold and tannic.
From the WG tasting. Full fruited, juicy red!
Dark fruit nice tannins spicy. Long finish
Very elegant red from Douro. Strong on wild berries and some violet on the nose. Ideal for going with Sunday roast in a cold autumn afternoon .
Full bodies and rich. Complex and deep taste. Really nice drinking wine.
Super nice, smoked plums and berries, gotta try again.
My favorite of this Portuguese night.  Very well balanced. Great tannins and long finish.
Delightful. Rich dark fruit with a silky feel and good tannic structure.
Rich ruby color, dense fruits, complex with long finish.  Great!
Still holding strong. Douro with a french touch :)
Quite classic tight french - from Portugal. Small nose, cherries, good warm tannins. Needs air. Great with veal and mushroom jus.
Amazing full body, long finish wine. Simply BOLD. Love it
Floral blueberry. Dry, med-low acid, high tannin. Blueberry blackberry yogurt wood flowers. Delicious if a little too tannic.
Really nice. Blackcurrant and Playdoh almonds
Great qpr. Deep flavors.

it’s a good buy

Good Wine . Very smooth
very intense taste good choice for lunch
Solid. Great value. Got this from Bartholomew Broadbent.

A nice Douro, fruity, balanced.  Plum, toast, medium-full body and acidity.
WS 91pts. Rich plummy spice
Big, round, smooth, dark.
A great douro for a reasonable price. Easily paired with pazenello salad!
Powerful full body. Wood and leather nose. Smoothly balanced dark fruit and tannins. Excelent
Excellent smooth Portuguese red. Perfect with veal/lamb.
