Super dry, elegant, complex red wine with licorice and cherry and smoky vanilla and chocolate notes and a long, smoky cherry finish.
Very good red berries. Great body. You can get it for around 20 euros in Portugal. That's a great deal.
Chocolate, caramel,  tobacco.  Very soft and elegant Portuguese wine, pairing very well with our newyear's eve dinner.  Full-bodied and high flavour intensity.  Long finish. Very nice.
Beautiful deep purple with strong legs. Peppery, tobacco, prunes. Well balanced with smooth tannins after 30 mins. Long in the mouth with delicate red fruit in the finish
Vantage 142
Blackberry, plum, fig & mild vanilla notes. Slightly earthy.  Medium oak & good acidity.  Needs about 30 minutes to open.  Worth the $20 paid on Last Bottle.
While young, complexity was demonstrated via elements of black fruits, liquorice, earthiness and herbs. Mid finish but enjoyable as the wine opens up over time.
Another one that you just drink at Portugal
Fantastic full bodied wines. Ripe red fruits - berry fruits. Lovely lingering finish.
Present tannins, hints of berries, fresh, but bodied. Dense, cherry and chocolate.
Berries tinge of oak, plenty of tannins on finish. Needs to be decanted and allowed to breath
3.9  Dark fruits, vanilla, well balanced, smooth, fairly full bodied. 14% but wouldn’t know.
Nice indeed, tested in business lounge at HEL airport non-schengen
Very good, lot’s of taste.
Smooth, full and perfect. Not much tannin and vanilla
Surprising nice wine. Full of body and flavor. Suitable for strong cheeses or just to drink it alone vanilla oak blackberry @[1|43908118|Roy Povarchik]

4.2

Dark, claret colour.

On the nose, light oak, subtle vanilla and leather, and cherry. 

Taste of cherry, vanilla and light clove

Full bodied, tannic wine.

Classic Douro.
Cor ruby
A really enjoyable Portuguese wine, very fruity, tannic and dry. Paired well with cheese. Great value.
Fantastic red from Portugal. Red wines from the Douro region of Portugal has become my favorite. Excellent taste and still resale priced.

Impressively Deep purple color. On the nose toasty note chocolate and cedar. Powerful yet balanced acidity and tannins.  Plum red cherry chocolate.  Lingering notes of milk chocolate. And vanilla. Reminiscent of good Ribera

Deep inky purple hue. Medium nose plum,  leather, chocolate, raisin, black cherry, oak. 

Dry, medium-plus acidity, body, alcohol, medium tannins. Medium flavour intensity, medium-plus finish. Dark chocolate, blackberry, leather, oak, dates, tobacco. 

Decanted for couple of hours. Super smooth, lengthy finish. Weighty body and flavours, lovely with a big piece of ribeye! 4.1

Rich aroma of blueberry, mulberry, cherry, licorice, tobacco, coffee beans and good integrated oak. The taste is fruity and fresh with nice deepness. Good mineral tannins structure and lively acid. The nose is more from Portugal and the taste is elegant ala France. You can drink the wine now with potential 5years. Ideal partner for venison with forest sauce and chestnut crockets. 90+/100.

4+
Really loved this one. On the nose, black fruit, spices, light oak and leather. Confirmed on the palate. Drank a few days ago so not as fresh in my mind, but I know I loved it enough to put it on my wishlist.

Pleasant surprise. Join venture like that somethimes deal too many interests. But here noble nose of blueberry,bramble fruit,tobacco, levander and liquorice. Rich,supple on the palete with nice definition of fruit and freshness core. Fine oak integration without Bordeaux intervention. Tannins of minerality texture through charming, subtle finish also on the second day. Despite its very good drinkability and willingness, promising potential to age. Drink now and over the next 4-5 years. 91+/100.

3+ 60% Touriga Nacional, 25% Touriga Franca and 15% Tinta Roriz grapes. Winemaking in steel conic vats with maceration for some days. Maturation in French oak barrels for 18 months. Deep ruby red color with purple highlights. Nose of cocoa, ripe fruits, spicy and balsamic hints. In the mouth it is silky, crispy with medium concentration and good balance. Maybe the oak is a bit evident and the wine is a bit deep with a lack of drinkability. Not so complex but also so young. Persistent final with spicy hints.
Like it but again.

Plum, blackberry, vanilla cake, cherry jam. Middle light body, blackberrys and black chocolate. Ready tannins. Easy to drink. 
89/100
Overwhelming sensations experienced from drinking this wine. Outstanding value for money.
Invcredible shining blood color. Superb complexity. Deep wood, completely integrated, fruits, wild aromas, truffle, foin, animals, forest and wild boar venison...
Lots of everything. Love it. Blueberries, blackcurrent, creamy vanilla, good acidity with gripping tannins. Good length. Drink or store for a few years. Buy!!
Dark red dence. Red berries. Buttery. Oak. Vanilla. On the palette. Balanced but high acidity. Nice tannins. Fruity. Still young. Will improve in cellar to five years
Red fruit, pepper, spice, plum, cherry, oak, vanilla, baking spice. The body is medium on this wine with a long pleasant cherry finish. Nice wine, needs 30min to open. 4.2
Typical red from the Duoro. Had it from a restaurant and although it was decanted it needed more air to open up properly. Still it was very enjoyable with a ribeye on the bone.
Powerful red Douro: blackberry, plum, graphite, cedar, vanilla, touch of heat, full body, smooth long finish. Lacking acidity to balance the sweatness of the black fruit and oak - 91.
Violet color charged. Red fruits aroma, involved with elegant floral notes, In the mouth  is elegant and full bodied, with polished tannins  Harmonious and  persistent aftertaste

A bold wine with a nice pepper aroma. Very well pronounced Tobacco and black fruits flavors.
Great wine to have with meat (I had with a great chunk of lamb ribs and it was awesome)

A really aromatic expression of the Duero region with fresh wild berries, mint, stewed prune, baking spice and tobacco .
Full- bodied , harmonious and incredibly refreshing on the palate , with silky tannins that give a real sense of balance.
This is an elegant wine with excellent volume and a serious and lingering length!

To close Saturday evening, good conversation, fun and another red. It’s been a while since I tasted this, when I was still leaving in Brazil. Great Douro, made out of 3 lovely Portuguese grapes: Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, which is actually how Tempranillo is called in Douro. Nose of blackberries, currants, herbal notes, chocolate and burnt sugar. Full bodied, structured, dense in the palate, with Plums, blueberries, menthol, fine herbs, tobacco flavors. Young and promising! 4⭐️

What an outstanding Douro! Great mix of raisin maybe licorice and some pepper, besides the usual plum and black fruits. Maybe a bit too young, the tannins are still very lovely, probably 2-3 years more and this is going to be big and bold.

This is more a Bordeaux blend made in Portugal (see the people involved, as marked on the front label) than a 🇵🇹 wine*. 

Oak notes with some vanilla, very smooth blend. I guess many people would be fooled in a blind tasting and rate this is a French wine from Bordeaux - and as such it would excel on o price-to-quality scale). 

*Jorge Roquette (Quinta do Crasto, Douro)and Jean-Michel Cazes (Chateau Lynch-Bages)

Medium purple with pale pink hues on the edge in the Gabriel Glas. 
Decanted for an hour and further in the glass to open up to perfumed aromas of honey, oak, vanilla, mint and ripe cherry that fills your nose on first whiff. 
Medium intensity, luscious, ripe tannins and mouthwatering acidity with some spiciness. Long, silky finish.

Douro meets Bordeaux! 60% Touriga Nactional, 25% Touriga Franca, 15% Tinta Roriz. 18 months in French oak. Dark red color almost purple. Full-bodied, needs air to refine and the right temperature to keep the alcohol nose down. Obviously black fruits, black chocolate and flavors like gravy. On the palate strong, fat, but with smooth tannins and texture. A long finish! Needs more years to become more elegant.

Classic Douro from the classic red grapes  of the region.
Fresh , balanced , tasty.
A lot of red fruit , herbs and spices.
Leaves a nice feeling on the palate.
A good experience and a nice representative of the region , still quite young will be much better in 3-5 years

Clear medium purple. Clean intense nose. Dry, medium acidity, medium round tannin, medium body. Hints of black cherry, licorice, wet wood, sweet spices, blueberry, black plum, olive, tobacco, oak, mushroom, leather, earthy, clove. Long finish. Well aged, good to be consumed now 2020.

My beloved quality Portuguese wines finally here - no need to go to Douro. I'll go anyway:) Unless I find Kopke locally. A glass of Roquette & Cazes 2015 has made my day. All you can get in a well balanced all sort tourigas blend was here. Good quality for democratic price!

Intense purple, and bright. Cherry and chocolate in nose. 
In mouth, strong, full bodied, thick, though quite balanced, great finish and easy drink. Excellent vintage....highly recommended label.
Dark purple color. Full body. On the palate, more spice, dark earth, as well as deep black fruits. little over-powering, but airing it really helped to smooth out and a good finish.

O’Briens

What a wine!! Drink it alone or with food, it is so tasty that it will always outshine every thing else. You can smell the spices as well as its sweet aroma and just be inebriated by it.
Then you pour it in your mouth and enter a new world. Tastes blue berries, tastes like poetry.

Mainstream Douro made of Touriga nacional + Tinta Roriz + Touriga Franca. 18 months French oak. Intense ruby colour, notes of ripe blueberry, dark plum, a hint of violets, vanilla and pepper. Soft, full bodied, balanced, medium + aftertaste. Well made, very convention, though

I don’t usually buy into the wine JV stuff- perhaps case the ones in South America are like minefields - but this project between Lynch Bages and Quinta do Castro is truly wonderful. 

The nose showcases dark berries, cherries, tobacco, earth and chocolate- all wrapped in a pronounced oaky coat.

The palate is somewhat more refined and less imposing. Great flavours of cigar, vanillla, wood and dark fruits. Lengthy finale. Can only imagine what it will be in 10 yrs. Today its a solid 8/10

Dark red lush with redfruit aroma and plum nose. Harsh at first eases as it settles strong full bodied, opens with vanilla and long finish with earthy and leather notes. Best leave for half to one hour, certainly great for the price. 4.2/5

Dark plum on the nose with an explosion of bold jammy flavours, oak and tobacco. Probably won’t choose this without good smokey bqq or steak. However if I want a strong wine packed full of flavours I’d definitely go for this. 3.8

Deep dark color. Strong aroma,  tobacco and fruit. Taste is plum,  black fruit and red fruit as  cherry, even some  licorice.
A bit dry and tannic.
Expected more. It is OK but not outstanding. Overrated.
Needs to decant and let it breathe for an hour at least.

You're not deal with any "auld muck" here!
Deep, deep purple colour.
Nose is a little subdued of dark fruit, smoke and a hint of vanilla. 
Palate is full bodied with strong structure. 
Flavours are similar to the nose but more complex.
You get a feeling that this is hiding something and all you need is time.

Subtle almost sweet almond and oak scents
Bold, spicy cherry on the palate
Mainly pepper on the aftertaste
Deep purple, dark berries, flowers bouquet on the nose, full body and complex wine. Very interesting and long finish.
Purple red. Cherry candy, violets, dark red fruits. Medium-full bodied. Quite a bit of rounded but slightly grippy tannins. Some spices.

vanilla tobacco pepper dark fruit earthy
Amazing wine 😁
Punchy, tobacco spirit with cherry and green apple background. A thick and tough red that condenses four very straightforward Portuguese grapes.
The cold weather has been improving it flavor however. Its strongness is perceived at the begning. Low amount of wood but quite suite and persistant
Beautiful and rich nose, alcohol is well integrated, medium body and long fruity finish, too fruity for my taste. Lower end of 3,5.
Pretty decent wine, this was my last wine at Timeout Market in Lisbon. Took a while to open up, fruity, perhaps try more in a few years.
Smooth and rounded made me almost happy which is a miracle but at this price should be a 4 but still a nice drop just wouldn't buy again.
Medium-full bodied. Clear French wine-making influence from the taste signature. Recommend to decant for at least 30-40minutes. Fantastic value - can hold its own to most $100 reds
Ola galeras. Bem vindos a meu review. Let's talk about this wine. Clearly it's fantastic. When I initially tasted the wine, it felt nasty on my lips. But after taking a second sip, I was blown away.

Beautiful complex Douro! That paired nicely with the BBQ 🍖 🍗 we were having !! 

Deep ruby color.
Aromas of game , vanilla and raspberry.
Full bodied, slightly tannic still on the palate, raspberry, cassis, pepper , cigar box , and game.

14.5%  ABV 
it still has aging potential To retry in a couple of years

A joint venture Douro wine created by two families—the Portuguese Roquette and the Cazes from Bordeaux. Very dark purple inky wine that is very concentrated and layers of prune, leather, black currant and blackberry

Deep dark beautiful ruby red color, intense nose having notes of blackberries, black forest fruits, riped plums. Young and bold, need at least 1hour breathing time. Excellent structured muscled tannins yet very pleasent, well balanced acidity and perfectly integrated alcohol. Voluptuous on the palate with notes of blackberries, riped plums, oaky, vanilla and a hint of spice. The finish is long, elegant and remanent preserving the notes from the palate. Excellent ageing potential. A wine to be remembered.

What a great Douro! With 18 months oak ageing, this 2013 vintage combines in excellent balance berry and black fruits, spices and subtle oak, with a great body and lengthy finnish... Where is the next bottle? 😋

60% Touriga Nacional, 25% Tinta Roriz,15% Touriga Flanca. Deep, inky purple robe. Complex nose, expressing aromas of blackcurrant, leather as well as some spices - vanilla, nutmeg. Well
Balanced palate, offering good dark fruit and fresh acidity. Reasonably long finish

Clear medium purple 

Nose: clean, pronounced intensity, cooked fruits, cherry, black berry, plums, char wood, chocolate, vanilla, tobacco 

Developing 

Palate: dry, medium (+)acidity, high alcohol, medium (+)tannin, medium (+)body,medium (+) intensity, chocolate, cooked berries, black berries, plum, overripe figs, tobacco, vanilla, medium (+)finish.

Very good, personally I love it very much with plenty of tertiary notes.

Dark deep red. Attractive  nose of dark and red berries, ribena, violet  followed by peppery lift. Rounded and flavourful. Complex palate with balanced flavours of blueberry, violet, plums, licorice & sweet spices. Smooth soft tannins with fruit defined aftertaste.

Nose: Blackberry with nice note of acid vanilla chocalate. Taste: nice tannins not too soft and good potential for some more aging. Blackberries tobacco leader. Needs food, we had flaeskesteg (roast pork) and was good match. I say it again: the onknown secret of wine and perfect value much more than port!!!!!

16 - 18months in French oak barrels (70% new, 30% used once)

From the nose, does not seem to be an world wine making technic as it was very fruits (black currants) forwards that surprisingly very friendly to the nose. Not to mentioned it's great floral sensation that overall has shown a very elegance n soothing nose. It's secondary notes, was all layered behind with spice, tobacco and very light hints of vanilla. 

I strongly believe in 3-5yrs time, this will be a gem when primary & secondary note mate. 😁

Dark and bright purple dress. Highly aromatic nose with notes of fresh forest fruits, violet and shiny hint of vanilla. Powerful intensity,  elegant on the palate and releasing  a grip of dark fruits, spices, silky tannins. Full bodied and wonderful long finish which develop sophisticated  aromas. (4.1 points) I recommend this Portuguese wine from the Douro Valley

Deep blue red. Fruity with blackberries, immature blue plums and white pepper on the nose. Medium bodied. Some oak spice. Medium+ acidity and medium tannins. Well balanced and very drinkable now but will last 5+ years. Medium tail.

Essential here to aerate. The initial aroma is alcoholic but after a while it vanishes and the black fruits aroma of Touriga Nacional comes out. Chocolate, grass, oak. Pronounced tannins, acid, bodied. A heavyweight wine. Infinite end.

Quite enjoyable. Good structure with a balance of sweet and sour fruit and a backbone of tannins. Rich plum, mineral, tobacco, spice with some port overtones. As it opens up floral overtones, more fruit, dried berries, licorice and cinnamon 90/100

Deep purple color. Licorice, tobacco, vanilla, plums, pepper, oak and flan pudding with caramel. Medium to high astringency, bodied, medium tannins and a long finish with cassis cream and oak aftertaste. Nice wine!

4.25/5
The idea to combine the know how of 2 connoisseurs in wine making, Jorge Roquette, owner of Quinta Do Crasto in Portugal and Jean-Michel Cazes, who owns Château Lynch-Bages, gave birth to this superb wine. 1st release was on 2002.

Made of 60% Touriga national(initially used in port wines), 25% tinta Roriz (tempranillo) 15% Touriga Franca 
Purple color, 👄 taste of some red fruits,violet, spices, strong tanins, medium to full body, hint of wood, long finish!
Definitely can age for 10 more years
14.5%

Complex aroma of fresh berries and vanilla on the nose. Elegant start, red fruit, vanilla and oak all blend exceptionally well. Light and smooth tanins and a great enduring finish. Great wine. Gave it an extra half star this time around for the 2013 vintage in Magnum bottle, aged very nicely!

Deep ink purple color, tears on the glass easily seen, raisin, pepper and vanilla tertiary aromas to the nose. Nice fruitiness and high acidity to the palate. Full bodied, we enjoyed this amazing wine with lamb chops and a Greek salad. Very impressed with this blend from the Douro region of Portugal.
Dry, full body, lots of black fruit
Very bold and tannic spanish jewel. oak vanilla plum tobacco
A fab Douro- full bodied with a long finish. Perfect for a curfew Dinner with tapas & cheese

Deep purple color.

Medium round body. Was expecting a fuller body but this works well.
Medium+ and pleasant acidity.

Was expecting a powerful and strong wine but found it much gentler.
Alcohol is still there and punchy.
Overall very enjoyable wine and when you consider the makers and price, excellent VFM. 
A bit more complexity and you get a 4.5+ wine.
Recommended.
A wonderful wine for anytime of the day when you are a red wine drinker. Bold ,heavy with flavour and an amazing nose. Drink it from the right glass.
Well structured, good and present tannins, solid black fruit with cocunut/vanilla Tones from american oak
Delicious had by the glass at a wine bar in Lisbon for Tim’s stag before everyone arrived on the Friday.

A red wine from the Douro River Area of Portugal. A blend of 50% Touriga Nacional, 25% Touriga Franca, 20% Tinta Roriz(aka Tempranillo) and 5% Sousao. These varietals are used in making Oporto. Also used for big, fruity, dry red wines. This wine is black in color with a purple edge. Lush black fruit with hints of oak in the nose and finish. Bold tannins as well. At about $16 a real value and will add to your memory of varietal flavor traits. Look for Douro wines from the Spanish side of the border as well.

A Bordeaux-style project that beats Bordeaux at its own game. Smooth, elegant, hints of red fruits, no acidity, perfectly balanced. This is an absolutely stunning wine that will probably only get better with the years. I’d pair this with meat.

Nice blend of red and black fruits. Dominant cherry, oak and liquorice. Lovely tannins. Plum sweetness with a dry cherry finish and hint of spice.
Inviting dark red with long slender legs, fine nose with blackberry leather dark fruit on the palate black cherry red fruit medium body dry with high acidity. Works well with portoguese cousine.

Good wine, intense violet color, full-bodied.  In the nose a complexity of aromas.  In the mouth, dark red fruits, some floral and herbal elements.  Young, fresh, elegant, balanced and well complex finish.

Very understated. Lovely tannins. Damson cherry blackberries vanilla flavours. Peppery leathery notes, hints of rosemary, peppermint cinnamon and aniseeds on the herb end and sour cherry, red currant, lingering plummy finish. 

Enjoyed very nice. 👍🥂

Once again, an excellent Douro that feels generous with lively. Fruits such as blackberries and pineapple are pleasantly wrapped in green spices and natural tannins. Acidity is balanced with a dry and long finish
Vibrant black cherry, some violet and oak aromas. Fresh in the mouth with soft tannins. Still very young wine…
A nice fruity dry red from Douro. Red berries, a hint of chocolate. Integrated tannins.
Bold yet smooth. Brilliant accompaniment for a warming winter dinner.
Impressive red Portugeese! Dark full fruit, nice tannins and long impressive aftertaste
Nice Douro red wine oak blackberry plum
oak blackberry vanilla cherry
Black fruit oak and vanilla. One of their basic wines but good. Drunk on their balcony.
Also where we stayed. Amazing place and amazing wines.
Superb!
Full bodied. Complex aroma. Pairs beautifully with bolo levado (furnas Portuguese bread).
3.8. Almost perfume scent. Mellow, subtle vanilla and fragrant fruit. Smooth aftertaste and nice complexity with hints of herbs and liquorice.
Douro
Very balanced red. Clear and intense red, with an intense aroma. We can find notes of black fruit , herb's and spices. Persistent flavour, with tannins present.
Good choice! Not to much presumptions, a safe choice for white meet, fish or just a quiet glass of wine.
Red fruits dominate, bold but smooth.
Dark berries. Simple but very enjoyable
vanilla blackberry plum oak leather
Well balanced mineral forward and delightful wine

Intense nose with some pepper and vanilla, and some yougurt. Quite some tannins and acid. Tastes a lot of pepper, with some blueberry and some cherry. Almost nutty aftertaste. Tasted without food, would work better with.
Ripe red fruits, earthy, mellow tannins with long vanilla finish.

Wasn’t my taste. Possibly
The bottle was too long already open
Full bodied if a little tannic
I really would love to go back to Portugal, wine is so nice.
Fermented notes and red fruit on the nose.  Flavors of blackberry, sour cherry and hints of oak. Unbalanced and overly tannic with high acidity. Needs more aging.
A super heavy and dense wine.  The Tourigas are out in force.  Not an easy drinking wine.
Well balanced acidity and tannins, very enjoyable, dry and fruity. Was so good with pasta.
Really solid wine - if it was Italian you’d pay twice as much
Good price for this quality, I strongly recommend if you like Touriga Nacional
smooth, dry but easy to drink
Fresh dry & easy drinking
Red with great legs and a smooth base. Smoky smell but very light and easy to drink
Notes of cherry, plum and blackcurrant. Great with duck
Had in Alvor ,very nice ,but I just don’t think  I’m a duoro fan. Got one P+S didn’t like too much either.
Blackberries with some floral.  Nicely balanced.
Dry and tannin forward. Not much fruit. Would prefer with food, I think.

Nice level of tannat, oak, cherry.
Dry and medium/long finish.
Excellent value! Fruity and elegant wine

Fresh and zingy aromas with spicy notes (and scribbles I can't read in my TNs)
Plum flavours with herbaciousness thrown in.
Medium bodied, well structured.

Portugal tasting and rounding up to a 4 ⭐️
Blend of Touriga Nacional & Franca, Tonta Roriz, Sousão
Deep garnet colour
On the nose, black fruits, leather and spice 
Medium bodied with lots of up front fruit flavours of dark plum, blackberry and blueberry but with high balancing acidity

Wood, blackberry, black cherry, cassis, vibrant, exciting, structured supple tannins with a juicy, succulent palate and long mineral clay finish.
Unimpressive. Bad choice dad
A little rough.
Easy to drink, blackberry, woody

Portugal Tour 2019 - 15 years ago, my wife and I were spending our honey moon hosted at this winery with a magnificent view of Douro river. Today we opened this bottle to celebrate this memory and the blesses of our marriage. Thank you my Lord! Nose of raspberries and currant rounded up by subtile tobacco and spices. In mouth, medium body, well integrated tannins, mature fruits ellegant flavors with medium lasting and very pleasant subtile roasted aftertaste. Cheers!
Very good value for money - well deserved 4 for a nicely balanced red - red fruit and cherry - some oak and vanilla - not too dry not too acidic
Nice Portuguese red. Cherry with a little petroleum, licorice, and raisin / prune. Vanilla from oak. Surprisingly bright and acidic
Deep purple color. Dark fruit and warm spices, blueberry, blackberry, black cherry, vanilla, chocolate, oak. Dry, medium acidity, grippy tannins.
Black cherries in nose. Cherry and plum in taste. Oak, leather and vanilla. Dark, bold and tannic. Nice Douro Red. 3,75 points.

Limited notes.

Dark red

Notes of blackberry, plum, earthy dusty bramble, leather, chocolate, smoke, licorice chalky minerals and a bit of pepper.

More fruit forward and slightly less brooding than I was expecting but it is good, especially for the price.

Rating: 90-91

Highly enjoyable Duoro consumed at Hawksmoor. Deep and inky blackcurrant combined with a certain jammy vibe. Adequate length, acidity and balance. Really good drinking and a beautiful pairing to a bit of beef

Deep ruby hue. Medium nose cherry, oak, blackberry, raisin.

Dry, medium acidity, full body, medium-plus alcohol, tannins. Medium flavour intensity and finish. Tobacco, leather, smoke, blackberry on palate.

This is bold, punchy and balanced. Great wine - 4.0

Well this was better than expected ! Vanilla, dark cherries , blueberries , and even chocolate going on. Really enjoyable after a rough evening. it would be even better with some flavorful meats and cheeses. Next time I guess!
One of the finest wines money can buy! Pepper, nutmeg, blackberries - pure joy, for the price!
Balanced fruity. With nice body. Dry
Dark in colour and yet with lightness. Full of flavour without a dry aftertaste. Quite a strong flavour but very drinkable and accompanied both meat and fish well.

Solid 4 for the $$ super great deal. Cherries and lots of crunchy tannins ! 
Let it air like at least an hr and it reveals its balance. Nice wine i would buy again.
Rich and dense ripe red jammy cherry and raspberry fruit. Deliciousness in a bottle!!! Vanilla is tagteaming with a medium acidity wine and some tannins.

Well balanced, nice tannins.

On the nose some raspberry.

Flavour from oak, tobacco and sweet dark fruit.
Dark color, light aroma. Fresh and elegant wine. Soft tannins, good acidity. Fruit in the taste not in the weak nose.
Complexe smell with leather blackberry and blueberry in the nose. Dark fruity taste with Long aftertaste.
Pleasant dark cherry, raspberry jam, blueberry. Spices. Dried tarragon. Juicy, ripe fruit. Full-bodied. Good Douro red!
Dark red fruit aroma with some spices notes. Young, fresh and floral wine with good tannis, well structured body and long and complex finish. Very elegant and equilibrium wine!
DCanter Portuguese wine tasting. Beautiful violet rim. Interesting nose. Nice balance on the body. Medium to full bodied. Nice finish. Somewhere around a 3.8

🇵🇹 
Deep ruby with inky rim/ blackberry and herbal nose/ blackberry, raspberry, vanilla and tobacco/ medium bodied, medium+  acidity/ easy drinking, dry
Rich and full bodied, tastes of black fruit and oak spice. Well integrated tannins. 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinta Roriz, and 30% Touriga Franca. 9 months in oak.
Fucking delicious
blackberry cherry plum black fruit
Black cherry and black currant
Red fruit & oak notes
Caramel, black fruits.... Nice
Dark cherry flavours on the nose with a touch of spice. Generally well balanced wine
Black fruits everywhere, well rounded with pleasant tannines. A bit colder is better.

Deep crimson in color with a Ruby and purple rim. Inky color and made in the traditional foot stomping method. Aged in French oak barrels for 9 months that have a slight toast to them. Smokey, black cherry, black berry and boysenberry nose. Hints of oak, vanilla, and toast. Medium plus to high acidity high tannins. Tart cranberry, black cherry, dark plum and black currant on the body. The finish showcases lots of tannins, oak, and tobacco notes.

Születésnapomra I.

What an elegant Red.
Fine attractive elaborate contents in a bright deep red asset, somewhat purplish gem, every now and then.
Self contained perfected dark berry flavours, fresh local herbs, all displayed in a fully balanced lingering intensity.
Yeah, it's Wine. 
Blindly picked from a hand of five, fortunate draw of an elegantly flavourful true Douro, brought up for all seasons.
I got lucky.
It is sometimes out of luck a classic is born.
And we sure do need classics.
In one word: Chic.

A bit Smoky and dusty on the nose, you know it’s going to be a serious red when the alcohol vapours work their way up. Sharp and focussed, lots of almond, leather & red fruit. More than enough acid to cut through whatever you’re having for dinner. Great value as always from Portugal.

Deep violet colour. Medium (-) nose with black cherry, blackberry and black plum. Medium taste of black cherry, blackberry and oak. Medium long and dry finish. Medium acidity. Medium (-) tannins. Medium body. A very good Douro Red that drinks well now. Goes well with beef, lamb or pork.

More and more I start to learn why Douro is one of the classic wine regions. Distinct aromas and flavours of deep dark blackberry, black currant, laurel, licorice, cocoa and pepper. Good acidity. Inky texture. Lovely slightly rough tannins. Good on its own but maybe even better paired to a traditional "zoervleis" stew tomorrow.

Full bodied violet red.  Warm and alcoholic on the nose.  Deep purple red colour.  Excellent fruit flavours .  Dark fruits and black cherry baked strawberry.  Spice cloves maybe nutmeg. Some schist influences.  Med acidity .  Still feeling my tannins under the upper lip.  
Would be awesome with a steak to balance this

Purple-red colour. Cranberries and raspberries on nose. Black cherry, blackcurrant, cranberry, vanilla and red cherry on palate. Full to medium body. High acidity. Ripe tannins. Long finish. With some sediments.

I really liked this one, especially for the price. I'm just now beginning to discover Portuguese wines, and I'm becoming a big fan. This one had a wonderful nose, full body, ample structure, and most importantly, character. It's not too often that can be said for a wine that costs only $15. Perhaps it was that 2011 was an excellent year for Douro. I also realize this isn't the most complex Douro out there, so I'm looking forward to trying the others that I've been picking up.

This pitch-black colored blend from Portugal opens with a pleasant ripe blackberry bouquet with a hint of balsamic. On the palate, this wine is full bodied, balanced and rich. The flavor profile is a blackberry jam and stewed plum blend with notes of minerality. I also detected some hints of boysenberry, black licorice and smoky oak mixed in. The finish is dry and its fruit and moderate tannins are nicely extended. Sip it with sharp cheddar and cured salamis and salumis. 90 pts

Considerably deep red color with a very slight purple hues. On the palate, spicy fruit flavors with a hint of mint and oak spice. He presents himself in the mouth with flavors of ripe blackberries, with its well-integrated acidity and tannin it works beautifully balanced, long and dry in his departure. A wonderful wine. Still a bit young. Wait to enjoy this wine for the next three years!

Nice blend! Almost purple in color. Nose has a bit of blueberry and blackberry. Finishing with some red fruits, almost a strawberry flavor, just a little earth. Very interesting wine and pleasant on the palate.
Beautiful ruby red colour. Lots of dark red fruit. Medium body and nice balance. Perfect for my roast beef without breaking the bank.
A delicious wine - pretty fruit perfume on the nose with raspberry & blackberry on the palate bolstered with fresh acidity and mild tannins.  Rather more earthy on the aftertaste.

Quinta de la Rosa, in the same family since 1815, started bottling its own wines when Sophia took over in 1988. Wine details in comments. Deep purple, with a lovely porty nose of rich black fruits, earth, leather and spice. Vibrant and approachable medium-bodied palate, herbal, soft tannins, high acidity. Yum. 3.5*+.

Wine trivia: Quinta de la Rosa's Vale do Inferno climbs 500m base to apex, the greatest ascent of any European vineyard. They harvest the top vines almost a month later than the bottom ones.
Smooth and rich. Absolutely great. Wish I was back in Portugal 🇵🇹
Just lovely. A real smack to the lips and as warm to the cheeks. The colour, a Scandinavian sediment river flowing over the fresh salmon of the season. Overall. 1 out of the 10. Could do better.
2015. Purple pleasure. Full bodied. Cherries and dark fruits come to the fore. Smooth rounded soft tannins. Easy to drink and good value. Hidden gem?
Soft, rounded taste. Medium bodied. Blueberry, blackberry, hint of cedar and vanilla. Complex taste. Fairly long aftertaste. Quite delicious portugese wine. Good value.
Definitely oaky black fruits.  A slightly sweet finish that dries out at the end preps the palate for your next sip.
Dark chocolate, cherries, raspberries, thyme, oregano, tar, vanilla, green tannins, medium acidity. Lingering.

Big ripe Black fruit wood 
Full body
Fine grained high tannins
Me + intensity 
M + finish 

Very good lack of complexity
Cheating Portuguese white with Portuguese red, good choice! Aged in French barriques, deep taste of berries, light tannins.

Black fruits, Blueberries & Leather.
Medium+ acidity with Medium tannins.
Classic Douro balanced wine.
Good wine!
Well done
Very good

I love Douro Reds, they are so big you get the aromas a mile away, flavors are big and alive... Round flavours of black and red fruit, soft oak and some wet wood, really nice easy touch on the tongue and the value is of the charts....

Really enjoyed at home with M and L.  The DIC did its job- this wine was really wonderful!  It had enough body to stand up to a steak and fish both.  I liked the soft celebrity finish, and the wonderful rich flavor with very balanced tannins. 

From Portugal- grapes were 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinta Roriz, 30% Touriga Franca.   

Really excellent!

Had this with my father inlaw's classic spaghetti and meat balls. This is good stuff! Big and bold on the nose with notes of oak and chocolate. Smooth and with a med to long finish with notes of plum, vanilla and pepper on the palate. It's still young so give it a 2-3 hours decant.

This is a delicious red that will compliment your food. Not as heavy as a new world  Shiraz but still rather punchy. Very dry, acidic with distinct tannins. Vibrant and lighter flavours with deep colour. Black olive, black current with pomegranate and slight clove in the background.
3,7/5 Black fruit, red fruit and baking spices on the nose. Taste wise a full basket of blackberries and spices. Medium body, elegant tannins but high acidity. Nice finish.
Dark red fruit and jammy which is quite delicious.

Dark fruit on nose and pallet 

Fruit forward and sun soles dark cherry on palate, med acidity and med finish 

Well balanced
Aged well. Slow to open. Very tight tannins that balanced out after an hour or so. Ripe fruit jam light with some retained acidity.  Shirt finish.
Excellent for the price!!! Very palatable... European nose with dark fruit- cedar wood and slate.  Pleasant lingering aftertaste-
Portugese red varietals. Red fruit,mocha and chocolate. Lovely palette of cassis and fruitcake. Wife's birthday. Raining in Western Cape. Smooth ripe tannins. Nice finish.
Beetroot red colour. Aroma is vanilla, wood, some red berries and quite oaky too. Flavour has spiciness, wood, mild earth and a wee bit of stinging alcohol. Nicely dry palate.
Rich and round and velvety blackberries, plum, cherry, vanilla, butter, and nice nose
Birthday wine before visiting Portugal 8/13/21
Bramble and dark berry, tastes of cedar berry with a lovely tannic fish!! Great table wine! Love!
I love this wine.  It’s bold but easy to drink.  A bit of sweetness.
solid wine, great value
Deep purple bold tannins good length. Dark fruits.

4,0 very good 🇵🇹
Discover Vino World 🗺 Sofia 🇧🇬
Rich, bold Portuguese red. Oaky with cherry and blackberry notes
Good for price
Tart cherries, prunes, and spice on the nose. Drinkable basic port. Flavors of dried cherries, prunes, spice.  Finish of prunes, and cooking spice.
Very strong, deep, rich red. Very smooth.

Definitely bold one. Smoky and oaky notes. 
Well balanced.
Great value red. Full bodied red with medium acid and tannins.Good alone or with food.
A bit bold with a grape, plum, and trace of earthiness and a slightly tart finish. Fully adequate as a friend used to say but not a show stopper.
Enjoyed this - purple & clean (@ Sintra)
Deep ruby color with cherry raspberry strawberry red fruit on the nose. Pretty bold
Tannins and dark plums round out this very young approachable wine.
Very good. Got at Costco for around $15. Love the color and body. Nice flavor. Very smooth but flavorful.
3.8 dark berries, raspberries, spicy, herbs. Medium bodied, Good acidity. Approachable and brings a lighter Douro
Blackberry, blueberry, a bit of tobacco and leather, a very strong bouquet yet extremely soft on the tongue. A smooth aftertaste. Applause!

This is a excellent wine with any dark meat. Especially good with barbecue steak. It just slips down. Very smooth. Lots of fruit. Just loved it. Excellent vineyard to visit too with a great restaurant.

Really enjoyed this wine. 
Dark ruby. Medium-bodied. Spices and to my surprise: celery!! Hints of vanilla and coconut. Medium tannins. Low acidity. Soft finish.
Bright and shiny on first opening, but an hour's air really opens it up. Tannins have a light touch, but makes themselves known.  Overall a great alterna red.

Medium purple color. Medium intensity on nose with jammy black fruit, blackberry, cherry, and a touch of oak. Dry, high acid, medium+ tannin, high alcohol, medium bodied. Medium flavor intensity with jammy black fruit and red fruit, dried herbs, and some smoke. Short finish.

Dense purple/red.  Bright forward berry fruit with oaky notes in background. Light bodied with excellent balance.  Long flavorful aftertaste. Dry and defined.  Light meat dishes and pasta. Good foil for flavorful cheeses. RB

An amazing red wine from Douro, very well balanced in nose, palate and finish. We had it with a rabit dish and was just perfect. A nose of red summer fruits like cherry and figs, with dark chocolate, tobacco and caramel and herbs. The palate is equally strong with dark berries, plum and a soft tannins. The finish is smooth and long.

Deep purple red, bright edge. Nose sweet dark cherries, ripe berries, sweet spices, herbal character. Palate medium bodied, beautiful fruity style with good complexity and finish. Refined tannins. A beautiful Duoro red blend, good value.
Very nice!
Very good for this price. Fruitful and nice
I really can’t believe how good this was. It had not only lasted but had improved immeasurably. The later vintages are good but the 2008 was superb. I think that was my last bottle unfortunately.
Oak and chocolate, well balanced Douro. Quite dry and bold
92 Pretty impressed with this, glad I kept my hands off until now. At its peak. Boysenberry, plum, earthy, tree bark, lingering rich raspberry-tinged tannins stretch out on a long but lifted finish.
Sharp, vibrant, like a spatula. Fruity, similar to Michael Gove. But in a good way.
Beautiful Portuguese red wine
We love Portuguese wine better than an expensive French wine
Portuguese red blend of touriga Nacional (40%), tinta roriz (30%), and touriga franca (30%). Dark ruby color; red fruit nose; 13.5% ABV. Black cherry, red currant and pepper notes.
This dance partner has a dry sense of humor but has a smooth finish and lots of legs.  Paired well with pesto pizza and me.  Like ZZ top, love legs. Do you know know how to use them?
In comparsion with his big brother the Reserva, is that wine surprisingly great. Cheers 🍷
Beautiful wine , smooth , black currants followed by delicious oak . Even better second day
Dark fruit, Beaujolais style jam.  Medium body, short finish, light acidity.
Rich and smooth. Good with food or alone. Could have used another year in the bottle.
Blueberries, ash, fruity.
Good body good shape good taste that slink away in a trapdoor after an hour or so, great price to pair with literally anything one desire. Had two bottles within a month, consistent quality.
Elegant and solid wine, full of freshness and juicy fruitiness with notes of spices and flowers. Vivid tannins, well-integrated acidity. Notes of wood and leather in the background. ❤️ Coup de cœur.
dark cherry nose but oaky taste
A top red from Douro, had it with Red meat (lombo) and also with sea food. I wish I could take home cases of it. Just fantastic !
Smooth, velvet

Summer in Wisconsin, drinking Portuguese wine.  I’d rather be there but that’s not happening , so as this wine warms from cellar temps I’m picking up medium fruit and some earth on the nose.  This drinks light, some tart cherries, cranberry, minimal finish.  It’s not a rock star but it shines as a distraction to life without travel.  For that, I am thankful this bottle made it all the way to me.
Highly impressed with this wine! Had the 2017 in 2020, the wine was bakanced, fruit forward in the beginning and finished with solid tannins and a long finish. I was wowed for the $22 spent!
Fruity and dry. Has some sweetness to it
smooth notes of chocolate and red fruits
Slightly mild flavor but overall very good.
delicious and giving light feeling (although it seems to be a bold wine ;)

Old world oak, hints of decayed fruit skin, notes of dried dirt, medium tannis, makes me feel like a giddy school girl, well developed nose, a slight overtone of rusted metal lingers throughout, great price point value, brings to mind thoughts of a peppered bulls tongue.

Extra half star for value! It's a graceful wine that walks a tightrope of balance between plum and black fruit and savory spices. It's juicy like most wines from this region but has nice dusty tannins to make it fun!

Robust with pleasant reminder of tannin. Though 5 years old still has purple colour. In the glass slow on developing flavour. But immediately tears appear. Tenderness of oak found. Well balanced and typical Douro character. Medium and balanced after taste.

Douro red blend made from Port varietals Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo) and Touriga Franca.  Quinta means from a single vineyard.  Port-like flavors, such as stewed plum, raisin and fruitcake, with an added fragrance on top like violets.  Also some strawberry jam.  Warm, full-bodied and rustic with low acid.  Shows good concentration and depth of flavor.  The finish is a combination of chocolate and charcoal.  Comforting like a Port.

Appearance-clear, medium in intensity, ruby, distinctive legs. 
Nose-clean, medium+ in aromatic intensity, aromas of plum, blackberry, chocolate, vanilla, kirsch, black cherry, developing. Palate-dry, medium acidity, medium+ tannins, high alcohol, medium+ body, medium+ flavour intensity, flavours of red and black berries, kirsch, pepper, plum, powerful, complex, elegant, medium+ finish. A good wine. Can drink now, but has potential for ageing.

Had to wait years, but it’s finally really-nice stuff now. Went great w/cremini mushroom ravioli w/an exotic-mushroom cream sauce. A few years ago this 2013 needed more time. But now it’s ready. My guess is that it’s nearly-pure Touriga Nacional. Decanted. Now a really pure, expressive & satisfying TN bouquet. A very pure, balanced, TN-fruit palate. 4.0 woofs now. Douro TN is different from Alentejo TN: much harder & more masculine. I’ll wait on my younger Q. de la Rosas. A nice visit here a few years ago.

Very intensive red from my favorite Touriga Nacional also Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca aged in French barriques. Ripe black cherries on the nose, plums and black currant on the palate, long spicy finish.

Dark purple almost black lots of oak and fruit on the nose. Full body and rich, Ripe red plums, blackberries, cherry's a little bit of spice of spice and hints of chocolate and oak. Nice tanning's medium to long finish.

Love the price/quality ratio of dry douro wines. Smooth at first but tannins are still mouth drying on the finish, full bodied and rich. Notes of plum, ripe blackberry, black currant, oolong tea, and a certain minerality. Long finish bright acidity, definitely delicious if you don't mind that dry feeling from the tannins

Appearance: Clear, deep ruby
Nose: clean, med(+) intensity, developing
black cherry, black currant, bramble, herbal, sage brush, smoke, a little oak
Palate:	Dry, med(+) acid,med(+) tannin, high Alcohol, full body, med(+)intensity, long finish.
blackberry, sweet spice, earthy, dried forest floor.
Quality:	Very Good. 
Readiness:	Drink now, suitable for aging

A wine full of tingly flavoursome character, it's real enjoyment, having aged gracefully (in half bottle format). Deep ruby, slight brickish hue, it's pretty but dark and rich underneath, constantly evolving; blooming violet, ripe black plum, rich earthy dark chocolate, licorice and milky leather. Concentrated ripe rich plumy fruit to palate, finely integrated leather, woody spice and chococolate through the core. Lively sandy tannins, a short-mid smoky to finish. There's a few yrs in it, 4.2

Really nice aged blend of portuguese grape varieties. Aromas of prunes, vanilla, blueberries, earth, rosemary (maybe) and chocolate cherries. This wine is some mix between port and some good aged Postup or good Macedonian Vranac. You cannot miss with 2011 vintage. Real rating is somewhere between 3.75 and 4🌟. 👍🍷

2nd wine at Darwins Brasserie @ sky garden in London's iconic Walkie Talkie building. Deep purple in colour and tastes of ripe plums and blackberries with a subtle hint of woody spices. Smooth with a long finish....very good

Deep purple/ruby in color, with light staining and light to medium tears. Big dark fruit, plum, wood, and spice on the nose. Red fruits dominate the palate, alongside baking spice and vanilla toward the end. The wine is medium to full in body, while showing dusty tannins and a medium (+) finish.

90-91 Decent though hoping for better after 9 yrs. But no real benefit from aging, maybe even lost so.e good fruit. Dry, minimal dark fruit,  herbal, gentle tannins, mild acidity. 91 on day 2 stored in fridge with vacuum stopper, maybe better after nice decant.

Solid red, lot going for it, goes well with a lot of different foods and occasions. A touch more secondary flavors or elegance would easily elevate it to an outstanding choice, as it is it's a bit hard to compete in terms of the price.
Bright ruby colored, with mix of bright and dark berry flavors. Some herbal and sweet notes on the palate. Medium body. Medium acid.
Surprisingly good for this price. Strong plum with blackberry and some cherry. Pleasant with spicy food. Nice new acquaintance in a 1/2 bottle.

Medium bodied red from Douro with medium acidity and tannins. 
Oak notes on the nose.
Cherry, blackberry, vanilla and plum on the palate.
Good Douro. Medium body with red fruit and some vanilla on the nose. I've liked the  balance between simplicity and complexity in some aspects.
Blackberry, plum, vanilla, round.
Nice flavour.  Bought in 2019 Q3, taste is vigorous and full bodied.  The 14% alcohol kicked in maybe after one glass later.

3,7⭐️ Nice standard Douro.👍
👁 Dark bluish red. 
👃👅 Medium (+) body, ok acidity, medium tannins. Lots of black and blue berries, notes of oak, plums, 
🍇 Touriga Nacional 60 %, Touriga Franca 12 %, Tinta Roriz 8 %, Sousão 5 %, Fields blend 15 %. Grapes mostly from the Lamelas vy. 
🕰 Matured for 18 months in French oak barrels (225 L). 
Alc: 13,5 %

Medium plus aromas of blackberry, black currant, plum, oak, pepper maybe some cherry as well. Medium finish. 
I don’t get why so many Douro wines have to be put in French oak for this long. In the end the spicy notes from the cask overwhelm and ruin the finer fruit aromas. If your sweater looks nice, why cover it with a jacket?!

Slightly cloudy crimson with thin pink legs ( claimed 14% but probably higher ).  Nose of violet, strawberry and plum. Dry with elevated alcohol, moderate acid and prominent fine grained tannins. Some ageing potential ( say 3-5 years ). Flavours of slightly indistinct red berries with smoke and a hint of tobacco. Medium body and moderate length.

Deep pink with purple undertones in color. Fat tears. Nose says moldy cellar upon pouring, developing into banana peels, peppery vanilla, some sort of yoghurt or sour dough. Not too complex, seems to develop quickly in the glass before stabilization. Taste of minerals, salt, dry tannins,  teeth go dry. Woody aftertaste with butter hints. Nice one.

This was delicious. Classic Douro red notes of oak, black cherry, black fruit, leather, etc. Had it straight from the winery which I would highly recommend visiting if you can! Paired excellently with a lunch of grilled lamb.

Feel that it ripened a good few months in a barrel, in this case French oak. A very elegant wine, full of freshness and juicy fruitiness, wonderfully complemented with notes of spices and flowers. A solid dose of tannin in combination with well-integrated acidity give full wine, which sequentially develops wonderfully in the glass. Recommendable Douro😉🍷
Young but lots of tanins, red fruits (strawberries) and a sweet nose

It worth it 3.9.
The magnum always bring a bit more of quality
Quite nice. Fruity, acidic, with quite a lot of structure.

One of a number of really nice Iberian wines from the recent AAWC pre-sale tasting.  I'll be getting more of this.
Bright nose with black currants, dry hay, sweet oxidization. Sweetish with lots of flavor. A bit too 'cooked' for my taste.
Full body, dry and astringent with good tannins and acidity tones. Dark berries and European oak nose. Very nice Douro.
I like Portuguese wines. This one is great, good body, ripe dark cherry. Medium tannins. Smooth finish.
Like running through a thick forest of tannins with a mouthful of ripe and juicy organic raspberries and blueberries.

Really enjoyed this one.
4.4/5.0
Not bad for the price, but I think there is more to Douro than just cooked dark fruit and high tannins. The search continues.
Jammy black fruits with fairly delicate oak. Sweet spice and a touch of tertiary flavours coming through.
Dark but fruity enough to please. Great with a Gammon pie
Great QPR. Black berries, leather ,oak. High acidity makes wine not so heavy. Paired with hard chesse.
Tarts shallow, perhaps needs time to open up? A bit Fruity. Clove scent. Enomatic at Berry Brothers and Rudd. 3.6

Plum, light herbaceous notes on the nose.

Smooth, young tannins.

I am not a red wine fan. It was ik - but what do i know?

Nice surprise on this wine. Quality tannins and dark fruit. Nose of BlackBerry concentrate, taste of tart cherry, and a light tannish finish on the palette. 

Going to add have to have this the regular stock list.

Medium to deep purple color. This wine has heavy body, high velvety tannins, and medium- acidity. The palate has notes of black cherry, dried currant, and fresh tobacco. Very dark, very bold, very dry.
We had this in norway at the hotel
A bold and powerful wine which smells and tastes old aged. Oaky and has a porty taste about it. Very jammy and full of black fruits. Needs to go with a big steak or heavy stew. 🐺 score 6/10.
Potent, earthy
Dark red berries, rich and well balanced wine. Smooth and complex at the same time.
Dry and jammy on the palate with a long finish. Mocca, sweet fruits and a hint of forrest fire on the nose. Whats missing? A bloody piece of meat.
Solid table wine, suitable for a wide range of foods.
this time to  celebrate the 14th anniversary of my child. still good shape! pleasant wine!
Excellent,dark ripe fruit,rich,with peppery notes strong tannin and well balanced.would recommend.

Esp. Nice with game. Full bodied, noce sweet toucht, lively pepper to finish.
Dusty fruit, cassis, a touch of caramel. Smooth and balanced with a slightly dry finish. More interesting than your typical red blend.
Granate colour with purple borders. Fluid and clear. Smell to berries and wood. Acid taste.
Wood spice, dark cherry. Such rich flavours, as you'd expect with a Douro wine.

wonderful full , rich red, amazing fruit with super finish!!!! loved it!
A limpid dark ruby Douro with its typical red fruits nose. medium bodied with tannins and acidity well integrated. Always a safe choice.
Very rich and succulent blend of ripe fruit in a balanced wine. Big in the mouth and long in the finish. Satisfying and delightful wine.
Awesome, awesome, awesome! Big, bold, dry, heavy... excellent balance of ripe currants/blackberries without being fruit forward!

Pink/purple. Smells of leather, fire. Medium Acidity. Some tannin and light bodied.

Crimson in color. Leather, bramble, black cherry, plum, blackberry, and boysenberry nose. Medium high tannins. Medium high acidity. Medium full body. Bursting black cherry, bramble, plum, blueberry, smoke, and leather. 3.7⭐️ very traditional Douro red. 

9 mo in French oak. 14% abv

3.7 Intense rubin red, aromas of red berry fruit, smooth and juicy wine with lots of tart berry fruit and soft, round tannins. A streak of minerality comes out mid-palate and leads into the dry finish.

Don’t really remember the 2012 I had but I had given it a 3 so clearly wasn’t too impressed! 2017 tastes younger for sure and tastes better for sure as well!

Smoky, vanilla, blackberry and mushroom on the nose. Cherry, licorice, oak and more blackberry on the palate. Medium+ finish. Good.

87 points. Vintage 2017 opened in 2021.
👀The color is medium ruby.
👃The nose is offering vanilla, blackberry and licorice.
👅The palate is offering blackberry, vanilla, black currant and pepper. Slight sweetness.
Medium plus tannins and medium plus acid.

Made predominately with Touriga Nacional & Touriga Franca this is deep ruby with quite a chocolatey nose. Black fruits also present (blackberry & black cherry). Med.+ aroma intensity which also shows vanilla & sweet spice (cinnamon) from the French oak. Dry. Med.+ tannins (fine grained) and high acidity that spoils the wine a little. Too young just now. Very juicy black cherry, blackcurrant. Oak provides structure. High alcohol and a med. finish. Medium intensity. With time this should be much better.
Really great Douro red for the price point.
A solid and balanced red blend. You won't be disappointed. Plenty of complexity on the nose, delightful dark fruits, good finish.
Like it

Dark
Chocolaty  , full body
Very nice full bodied Douro. Only €9 in Portugal.
Very nice wine not to heavy made from Port grapes
Good color although a little bit lighter than expected. Nice fresh fruit and a balanced structure, with good clean finish. Some doubts about its agent potential
Red fruit and oak on the nose, with cherry and red fruits coming through on the palate. The oak is subtle, a drier red with chewy tannins. Nice red wine on a colder summers evening.
3.75 for me, was not quite as enjoyable as some other duoro reds I’ve had great luck with in the past. Enjoyed it more as it opened up, wished I would have decanted longer!

Dark, ripe, red berries, slight slate, slight vanilla nose.  Very balanced, medium dry, medium bodied taste, high acidity.  Same notes in the nose translate similarly on the tongue.  Delicious.  I'm going back tomorrow to buy more!!

Inky purple. Opaque. Cloudy just outside of wine frig, tiny particles hanging on the glass. 14% alc. nose: French oak of vanilla, ripe strawberry, violet very pleasant fragrance. On the palate, lush black fruits, bold tannin, medium acidity, dry, not spicy, linger gravel tannin in the finish.  Beautiful wine!!

Strong, dark choclate, small bite.

Easy drinking
Martin & Joanna

Color is clear, med, purple with a nose of red currant, bramble, cranberry, red plum, softness, and med+ intensity.  The palate is 13.5% ABV, high tannin (soft, but big), same flavors as the nose, high acid, smooth, not super fruit forward – I had to dig a bit.  It needs to age and also open up a bit to become more pleasant

A young Douro with 13.5% abv. composed of 60/12/8/15 Touriga Nacional/Franca/Tinta Roriz/Sousão/misc., matured in aged French oak for 10 m.

Dark purple colour with violet hues, revealing its youth.

First scents includes cloves, liquorice, toast and tobacco, followed by plums, red berries and a whiff of violets.

On the palate it's cool, tart sombre with berries and herbs, but also a quite edgy note.

Solid and muscular structure. High tannins and a crisp acidity, long and bone-dry finish. Needs more time.

This was the third bottle of red wine during my stay in Lisbon. Required to breathe at least half an hour to reach good enough smell on nose. Definitely black fruits of blackberry and plum with hints of cherry. Soft tannins. On the tongue still fruits with vanilla and oak. The colour in glass ruby red. Final score for this wine is not excellent but with food can be assumed as acceptable.

Wanted to adore this vino whilst sitting here in the valley itself but finding it a little bitter, dry and tannic whilst lacking the oak characteristics mentioned in other reviews. Farely non descrip for me

Disappointed in this one and I'd say it is quite overpriced. Smoky, cherry and vanilla on the nose are so promising, but the palate falls short — it has tannins, and spiciness, and blueberry with nutmeg, but the finish is very short and full of black currant (if you know what I mean).
Elegant, medium bodied and smooth. Bright acidity with notes of sweet spices and ripe, dark fruits.
Young.  Rest and drink around 2021 and beyond.

Lars and I in May 2017 and my lovely wife Linda and I in July 2017 at butchers in Lisbon Portugal. Wonderful deep ruby red colour, luscious bouquet of dark red fruits and spice. Smooth over the tongue with a pleasant, lingering, smooth finish of current, black raspberry and hints of anise. Lovely choice.
TB
Deep ruby red colour with violent rim. Fruity and floral. Dry to off-dry with black fruits intense aroma. Medium body with medium finish.

nose reminiscent of the port grape varieties it is made from. rich with dark berry fruit with an appealing herbal note and the palate reveals a great concentration of blackberry and blueberry fruit followed by violets, wood smoke and bitter chocolate.

Decent Douro. Tinta roriz, touriga franca & nacional, 8-10 m in FR/US oak & 30% new. C: dark cherry, ruby rim. N: med-high intensity, berries jam, black fruit, varnish, fresh, floral, then acid berries (red currant). P: light, high acidity & mature tannins, long warm finish of hibiscus with a bitter touch. Later had a 2012 which I liked better, felt more mellow.
/
Buen Douro de tinta roriz, touriga franca y nacional, 8-10 m en barricas fr y am, 30% nuevas. C: picota con ribete rubi. N: int media alta, >>>

A tinta roriz (Tempranillo), touriga nacional, and touriga franca. Hand picked grapes aged in French barriques. At 14% alcohol, a fresh tasting wine due to its high, but fine acidity. A good wine - still, their Reserva wine (reviewed earlier: 4.5/5) expresses much more complexity

You can tell on the nose this is a good wine,  dark opaque and with a strong woody nose.  Between appreciating the sense and trying the wine it gives a rich transition to a full sweet, woody and fruity mouth that I my opinion makes this 2014 truly one of the best wines for the price even compared with other wines above the 8,49€ this bottle cost. Comparing to Vale Meão 2014, sorry, this wine wins buy far by having The sweet and lack of bitter taste, allowing the finish to be... Delicious!! Thank you

What a pleasant surprise? Opens up nicely with a nice smooth finish. This is a Bordeaux style wine made with the same grapes that are usually used in Port wines. Not sweet like you might think but really enjoyable and different.

100% Douro! Strength, rich, structured red wine that shows the power of Portuguese fruits. There is structure enough to support many more years of aging. Paired pleasantly with "filet mignon" (in Brazil; "ojo de bife", in Argentina).

Dark cherry liquor, rosemary, and a floral component on the nose, and a attention-grabbing palate. Blackberries, dark cherries, spicy oak, and herbs on the palate. Fills the mouth nicely and has nice complexity.
Dry at first but well balanced with fruity dark chocolate spicy finish

I've been hearing about all the great wine coming out of Portugal for a while now, but this is the first I've had that really suggests that it exists. Lovely deep garnet in the glass with just a touch of limpidity, and a nose of cherries, earthy loam, dried herbs, and sandalwood. Beautifully balanced on palate with ample tart red fruits, bay leaf, faint wood and smoke notes, and a gentle tug of complementary tannins and acidity. Allow some decanting time; it improves much, though the finish remains simple.

Notes from a Portuguese tasting a while back: nice appealing, perfumed floral, earthy spicy nose. On the palate first of all a really nice concentration and balance here. Lots of juicy ripe plummy and red fruit, deep and pure, spicy sweet with leather, chocolate and rounded tannins. 4++

Strange wine. It is very impressive in nose,  but in the same time absolutely usual when you drink. Taste is pretty balanced, red fruits and some canella. But aroma is one of the best you can find for such price.

To my friends José & Darko for their beautifully written tasting notes & inspiration to try my 1st Douro!
🎨Amaranthine unrestricted 
👃Pomegranate & plum compote, alcohol, & white pepper spice
👄Mid bodied, velvety, complex layers of dense plum, strawberry preserves, a little fig & earth, & undertones of sweet baking spices. Brightly balanced acidity w bold ripe tannins.
This is young & lovely, & will most definitively improve w age. 
🍴artichoke & spinach stuffed portobello mushrooms 
🎶U2-Beautiful Day
oak blackberry pepper

Nice tannins give a finish with strong notes of earl grey tea. Notes of plum and chocolate, very nice, bold.

Although I don't make this claim often, this Douro is the kind of wine you want to drink the first day. There was a noticeable decline in taste and approachability even on day 2. 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinta Roriz, and 30% Touriga Franca. First day had loads of luscious black fruits (black plum, black currant), anise, and black pepper.

Lovely for the price, which was $10-15 at Costco, if I recall. Medium-bodied and juicy, and an excellent weeknight red. Deeper ruby color, intense aromas of blackberry, ripe cherry, raspberry jam, bay, mint and vanilla. Dry, medium-plus chewy tannins, medium-plus acidity, with fairly intense flavors of ripe blackberry and ripe red fruit. Alcohol is evident.

On the nose, wild herbal, shrub-like flavours of the Douro are evident. The ripeness of the La Rosa 2015 is almost perfect, giving good aromatic complexity but maintaining all the freshness and elegance that the excessive summer heat sometimes gives to Douro wines. Quite full bodied with lively tannins highlighting the flavours and giving the wine life. Long and versatile, it is a wine for almost all food and all occasions.

A nice dark red/purple coloured tinto from the Douro. Good aromatics: dark red ripe fruits and spices (pepper and hints of wet wood). 
Taste is fresher than expected, spicy (again pepper) but easy to drink. Medium tannins and aftertaste is even an it dry with medium intensity. 

Nice to enjoy in a summer evening when there is a fresh breeze outside (shorts and sweater weather).

Picked this up from Costco, my first experience with wine from the Douro Valley. This did not disappoint! Not much on the nose, but the wine was medium to full bodied with subtle hints of earth, cherry, and a little vanilla. Smooth enough to go with a meal yet elegant enough to have on its own. I will have to start exploring more wines from Douro!

60% Touriga Nacional, 12% Touriga Franca, 8% Tinta Roriz,  5% Sousão, 5% old vine field blend. This is a young wine, and not one for the aging. Drink now. Serve at slightly below room temperature. Pair with meat dishes and hard cheeses. Lifting tannins and oak, this lets the fruit show through. Medium-full bodied, moderate acidity, rich yet fresh. Flavors of strawberries, blackberries, violets. This winery produces sustainably. Bought and drank with many refrains of "Put a bird on it!" by all at dinner.
When you love Reservas then this one is not for you. Although really nice and easy to drink, good value for money
Very smooth with nice body. Can be consumed with food or just stand alone
Big impression, but undistinguished. 2011 Douro red table wines can be amazing, but this one missed the mark.
Very nice candied plum and dark berry Portuguese douro! Lacking a little structure but worthwhile nonetheless
Second wine with Michiel Goosen at Kaatjes. Bit too 'cold'in its complexity. But great at the dark meat.
Good sound wine. Almost like a Bordeaux, deep dark fruit, full mouth and nice tannin. Doesn't have as much funkiness as other Duero reds.
Medium-full body. Rich in flavour. Alcohol on the nose. Smooth with little tannins
Smooth, solid fruit, not jammy

Portuguese mixed varieties. Fruity red wine, well balanced with hints of blackberries, chocolate, oak and with smooth tannins. Quite long pleasant finish. Perfect to our Sunday dinner with beef steak. Douro reds are always great.👍😁

Great Portuguese wine. On the nose there is a soft smell of seaweed. While you take your first sip, there is a rush of dark berries mixed with vanilla extract. Once swallowed, there is an aftertaste of nice fresh buttered bread. Ypa fam!
Starts out smooth but if you have something sweet after you’ve been drinking it - it tastes slightly bitter. We will definitely pair it with a meal again - just not with dessert.

Delicious Spanish Shiraz from Campo de Borja by Borsao winery.  Aged in American oak barrels for 12 months, 15%ABV. Dark ruby with crimson purple hues. Blackberry, dark chocolate, pepper, plum, vanilla with oaky notes. Full bodied, round, well structured an integrated silky tannins. Long finish with dark berries and espresso. Good to pair with light spicy casseroles, roasted lamb or tapas.

Thrilling Spanish Syrah (out of clones imported from Australia) jointly developed by Aussie winemaker Chris Ringland and J.L. Chueca. Bold at 15% ABV and rich like the fanciest Barossa with lots of cocoa and blackcurrant, this is a must-try @[1|32602029|Jeff]. WS93, JS91.

So happy to have found this Chris Ringland collaboration, which exemplifies the rich character of this iconic Australian maker, with the tradition of Borsao. The dark inky violet hue of the wine immediately suggested a large brew, and just a short decant brought out delicious fragrances of vanilla, chocolate-covered cherries and oak. The 15% ABV palate is not for the faint-of-heart – jammy, blueberry pie, balanced fruit and soft tannin build up to a satisfying finish

Vanilla , chocolate , black cherry. Floral notes as well. Oak and leather added in on the palate. This is big wine with loads of character. Someone else mentioned pairing with bbq and I couldn't agree more. Fantastic wine that should get better with a little time in the cellar.

Zarihs of its Shiraz ? First vintage made of this single Syrah. Without any doubt 100 % Syrah on 600 m altitude. Red to purple color with a powerful expression of blackberries, ceder, dark chocolat and some vanilla. However a soft palate dried plums and notes of cofee. A balanced acidity and minerality makes it complete. The wine is a collaboration of Australian and Spanish winemakers where the want to show that you can make an exellent Syrah in the Iberian Penisula.

This is seriously good for the price. 

Before opening I thought: "Shiraz from Spain = new oak and little primary fruit (like Rioja and often with Ribera)

I was wrong. There is oak but it's rather a complement to a full bodied, intense mix black fruits, pepper, geranium. Black fruit shown mostly as ripe blueberry; brilliant! 

My advice, open it and let it breath for 45/60 min as the high alcohol will stick out for a while, before integrating nicely.

First Campo de Borja.  Joint venture with Australian winemaker Chris Ringland

Excellent QPR 

med+ nose pushing on pronounced, precise, classic Shiraz, violet, ripe blackberry, bramble, dark plum, black currant, damp leather, wisp of brett, cigar box, chewing tobacco

Med+ palate, more savory but also black fruit, Hi acid, med+ velvety ripe tannins, hi alcohol, full body, med+ finish

Rich black fruit forward, black plums, blackberries, black raspberries, black fruit compote. Notes of blackberry balsamic vinegar, loamy earthy notes, oak. There is a pleasant floral, perfumed nose that's hard to identify. Full bodied, long finish. Well balanced 15% ABV. Plush tannins.

Rich and intense Spanish Syrah. Blackberries, plum, black pepper, tobacco, licorice, baking spices and vanilla. Easy to like and nice on its own. With food, the fruit and vanilla explode. M+ acid, M tannins, H alcohol, full bodied and M+ finish.

4.3/5.
Excellent acidity. Mint, oriental spice, nut on the nose. Plum, chocolate, vanilla on the palate. Full bodied and tough tannin. Wonderful balance despite of strong characters. Feels like an Australian shiraz as expected.

A campfire of smoking cedar wood and charcoal! Big and boozy (15pc). Oak, vanilla, dark chocoate and cola compliment cassis, dark cherry, raisin and bay. Full bodied with high acidity and dryness. The tannins are tamed even at this young age, present and grippy, but not lingering. 

Very well made. A tertiary treat for those who like these kind of wines and also a ✔for Spanish Syrah.

Great Shiraz from Spanish Borja. New idea of famous producer. Result of cooperation with Australian winemaker Chris Ringland. Dark red color. Aroma of cassis, tobacco, vanilla and violet flowers 🌸. On the palate black currants and spices. Pleasant and long finish. Balanced tannins. Perfect for spiced pork loin steaks with leek.

Aromas: dark chocolate, roasted oak, black fruit. Dense structure. Surprisingly smooth with soft tannins and well-marked acidity. On the palate there are flavors of dark plum, black cherry, raisins and oak and black pepper. All in all, very enjoyable. Long finish.

Super smooth Shiraz! Even better a bit child. Crisp, earthy and nicely balanced. Even better for a warm evening in Granada, Spain paired with octopus, cheeses and tapas oak vanilla leather pepper smoke cherry raspberry

This wine is awesome! Dried red fruit, smoke and pork fat on the nose. Full bodied, chalky, banana skin, green pepper and  chocolate. Finish is mineral and citrus.  It’s a great bottle I will buy many more of. Age it if you want to.

Nice, intensive aroma of blackberry, smoke, leather and sweet vanilla hints. In the mouth very fruity, bold and intensive. Creamy consistance. Higher acidity and round, pleasant tannins. Spicy, peppery finish. So good as a few years ago.
This Spanish Syrah is getting better every time I taste it. Chris Ringland made and a really power juice

En interesting collaboration of Australian and Spanish winemakers. Rich and silky wine from hot climate of Aragon. Largest producer in DO.

Full of black fruit and vanilla aromas, touch of tobacco. Developing wine.

Fantastic example of hot climate Spanish Shiraz. Also good PQR. Maybe lacking just a bit of French fines, famous for Northern Rhone Syrah.
