But this wine, made with the help if an australian wine maker, is really balanced, smooth, soft and powerful at a time.

#28 of WS Top 100 2020

Dark ruby. Slight smoky, musty barnyard, astringent , dark fruit on the nose. Dry, full body, medium acid, full tannins. The earthy musty quality is on the palate. Mushroom umami, dark medicinal cherry, plum, burnt wood, cigar box, white pepper. Good but not life changing. 3.8/5

Absolute steal at 🇨🇦$20 from the highly respected Spanish producer, I must look for more of these Syrahs from the Aragon region.

Dark ruby red with dark fruit and pepper on the nose.

Bold juicy flavours of blackberries, black cherries, raspberries with oak and smoke undertones.

Well enough balanced that even at 15% ABV it still drinks elegantly with a long smooth finish (and nary a hint of burn).

Sweetish but not jammy and actually quite dry at 3 g/L residual sugar.

#28 on WS Top 100 of 2020.

93/100. Needs a bit more time in the bottle. The nose leans more toward cab than Syrah. Aromas of Black fruit, ink, and dried herbs take their time to lift from the glass. The wine is tight and structured, hitting the palate in a streamlined manner. Black current and blackberry fruit dominate the taste at first, eventually joined by ink, flint, tar, licorice, dried herbs, and sweet balsamic. Lovely tannins that are starting to become refined. Will be interesting to see how this continues to evolve.

91/100. deep ruby color. juicy red cherry to black cherry. red plum. chocolate & espresso coffee. red flower. smoky bacon. palate was correspondent with nose, but more intense. closer to full body with high alcohol from stomach (15.0%). milky texture from American oak use. medium round tannins. acidity was higher than average. dry. well-balanced. this Spanish syrah by Christ Ringland persued Australian style, but was with more value considering the price. pairing with lamb BBQ was good.

Still a cracker. This collaboration between legendary NZ/Aussie winemaker Chris Ringland and Spanish winemaker José Luis Chueca really does justice to the bold, rich profile of a new world shiraz style (Eden Valley ~Barossa especially). There's pepper, plum, sweaty saddle, leather and mint/ eucalyptus notes and it just swells in your mouth like a spinnaker in a Bass Straight yatch race. Tannins are fine, tight and not too long. Ends with a little sourness/ tang.

Pre-Christmas Gathering with Friends #4
This Borsao Syrah is so reliable. Another vintage and another excellent Result. It definitely needs time to open up (hour and a half will be a good choice). As always high alcohol but not noticeable. Dark red colour and fruit character, medium body. Lots of smoke and chocolate. Light spice, more like a dried paprika but with something sweet. Great QPR.3.8-3.9⭐️

This wine does not shy away! Inky dark with loads going on, red currant, plum, cherry, smoke, some pepper spice, mushroom, game forest floor, violet and rose petal and dark chocolate. It’s a bit like Haribo Cherries have been melted into chocolate. Very smooth tannins and full body. 
This still has a great tartness to it - possibly needs another couple of years to really come into its own.

Very friendly and satisfying vino. 
Color: rich purple and clear, no haze, in the light. Legs sturdy and viscous. 
Aroma: rich and deep. Dark fruit, jam, fig, chocolate. 
Taste: blackberry, ripe cherry, red raspberry, raisin, and a light vanilla, leather and cream flavor. 
A delicate drink that was medium in body and had a smooth finish. The tannins were not abrasive and there was plenty of fruit to allow the drink to mature well over time. This is a drink that you can serve to folks new to red wine.

3.9 - Nice 100% Syrah from plots in the foothills of the Sierra de Moncayo, represents an outstanding vintage aged 12 months in 40% American oak barrels and 60% stainless steel tanks. The nose exudes aromas of ripe blackberry, plum and dark chocolate. A polished and gentle texture supported by well-integrated tannins offering flavours of plum, blackberry, black pepper, smoky wood and balsamic notes.

Spanish Shiraz. Really ripe fruit and a lighter body, and much better than I expected. In the bottle overnight decant did the trick. Ruby color w/ dark berry,  espresso and light spice aromas. Ripe red plum, blackberry, sweet cure tobacco, pepper spice and prune. Very smooth w/ med + acidity, med tannins. Long spicy finish with plum on the end. 3.8⭐️ A very nice wine with good complexity, very enjoyable!

Christmas party with friends and wine bottle 3. Amazing juicy shiraz by borsao winey, its like a fresh sweet cherry and raspberry syrup. Medium tannins and acidity, ruby red color, astonishing finish of sweat chocolate. Well deserved 4⭐️

Like 52 of the 54 cards in a pack… not a joker…

Spanish Syrah has long been considered a basic table wine. This is not!

Nose: black cherry, blackberry and roasted plum lead with tobacco, smoke and cracked pepper and silky chocolate, vanilla and new oak barrique.
Attack: Good complexity starts with blackberry jam and cassis over firm acidity
Mid Palate: still black fruit lingers, soft round palate adds raisin to cocoa, coffee and licorice
Finish: long smooth dark chocolate, cedar and vanilla.

Lovely!

One year after the previous review was written... the wine became a m a z I n g.

Just wish I had more than 4 bottles.


Nice but not great. Very nice clear bright ruby color. Full body, low tanines and low+ acidity. Aromatic, mainly fruits and spices, same on the palate, smoke, cinnamon, licorice, pepper, then blackberries, plum, strawberries, raspberries and underneath some leather, mushrooms, raisin, jam. A little too much jam for me. Good VFM, despite the high price in Israel.

4.1* Deep, opaque ruby to purple w/ a magenta rim. M+ to F body, M to M+ acidity and tannins.

Great QPR and nice balance, blind you would nvr guess new world… ripe Spanish fruit, made in a big (but not jammy) Aussie style.

Nose: Dried fig, ripe blackberry, plum, spices, vanilla and a little smoke.

Palate: Ripe blackberry, black cherry and plum front. Mid shows clove, tobacco and soft leather. Finishes long w/ gentle acidity, black pepper and dark chocolate.

I had this a little while ago and rated it 4.5, but I was overly enthusiastic. I’m drinking it chilled to 57F in Reidel glass. It is blackberry, blueberry, moss, and red licorice on nose.  On palate, the same, but also a little spicy and some cranberry and strawberry, especially on second note (give it about 30 min to open up). I think the 15% abv prob overwhelms it at first, and so it needs a little time to mellow out. I’m having it with chx pot pie—not the best pairing for this wine!

This one needed a while to open up. Even after 45 min it was still all darkness... dirty, earthy, mushrooms, wood, leather, and a touch of smoke. After a while some more astringent notes punched through like starfuit and green tomato, and eventually those mellowed into black licorice and lilacs... maybe a little bit of dark fruit, but a little lost in the mix. Unusual and intriguing.

Silky mouthfeel, delicious. Stiff tannins without being overly acidic -- a lovely, structured backbone. Long finish, too.

100% Shiraz from Moncayo, Aragón, Spain. Delivers flavours of plum, blackberry, fig, prune, clove, licorice, pepper, dark chocolate and lavender. Classic and elegant, full bodied, fruit-driven, with good complexity, plush tannins and long spicy finish, it's just awesome.
Bodegas Borsao is an internationally recognized wine producer and one of the world´s leading Garnacha producers who has been the origin and engine of the D.O. “Campo de Borja”.

100% Syrah from 16 year old vines from the slopes of the Moncayo vineyards (350-600m) with limestone soils. Aged in new American oak barrels for 12 months and other 12 months in stainless steel tanks.

Dark ruby red colour with violet reflexes and thick tears. Juicy dark cherries, blackberries, cooked plums, tones of cedar wood and dried coffee beans, hints of vanilla, well integrated tannins, round acidity and some dark chocolate in the long mouthfilling finish.

Pairs well with slow cooked duck.

On the nose, I get wet slate, a bit of olive brine, and oak. To the palate, I get plum, blackberries, oak, coffee, and a pepper finish. Interestingly complex and great with pizza. A great color but a bit tannic.

3.8 - Borsao, one of the key names in the D.O. CAMPO DE BORJA, known as the empire of Garnacha, their "Tres Picos" wines has featured at the top in Parker's guide in its last 3 vintages: 2012, 13&14.  With that pedigree, here's my review of their 100% Syrah.  Red-black with crimson purple rim. Powerful aromas of blackberries with hint of wood smoke, developing some notes of dark chocolate. Full bodied, well balanced with a dominance of dark berries flavours and dried plum. Very nice indeed!

A more jammy expression of Syrah with dried black fruit aromas, quite some oak, vanilla, chocolate, liquorice. Luckily there is quite some acidity to fight against the alcohol (15%!) and ripeness. The tannins are clearly present but very ripe too. It's intense and long but a bit too "showy" and focused on power rather than refinement.

3.7🌟 Interesting name used here-SHIRAZ from other side. Comes from fashionable Campo de Borja region.12M partly aged in new American oak barrels. 
Deep violet, F body.
N:Raspberry, plums, blackberry, rowan, hawthorn.Ground peppers, charcuterie, vanilla, chocolate, coconut, cacao, mocha, eucalyptus. 
T:Blackberries, dark cherry, blackcurrant, raspberry, plum,black olives.Anise, pepper, nutmeg, cinnamon, cacao, vanilla, cocos,dark chocolate. 
Warming M+ long finish w.lifted M+alco, M+acid and joyful tannins.

Very good indeed. Exotic as hell. Really dark color. Intense nose of dates and sugar cane candy. Cofee and dates on the medium-bodied, silky palate. Ends with a welcome burst of acidity. Lovely stuff really.
Smoky on the nose, like the dark fruit, smooth, with higher alcohol. Good length. But not nearly so good as garnacha
Fruit forward and mellow soft tannins. Earthy and minerality on the palate. Big, powerful with good length. Drinking well
Yep. Spanish Shiraz is dope!!
Went well with richely seasoned beef
4.0 ⭐️ Cherry, blackberry, oak, vanilla, tobacco, licorice! Full body, well balanced, fine tannins, good nose!
Nice minerality on the long finish. Very nice wine for the price. Wifey also liked the smokiness on the nose.

Little spicy, pepper beggining
Still tannic and many dark fruit flavor
Another good combination with meat
4.0
Enjoyable nose , ruby red colour purple reflex in the glass. Easy going taste as smooth and balanced. Value for money
Smooth, slightly dry with plum and raisin notes. Bolder than most Syrah
Bold and smoky. Flavor hits very hard with great tannin, but creamy on the back end. Amazing wine from Ringland.
Delightful Shiraz, great price value.
We love Syrah, however I forgot to record my tasting notes and it’s been too long now to give this an honest review.
medium-full bodied syrah. low acidity medium tannin, well balanced one
3.8 just about a 4 on here. Very good QPR and great second wine, decent flavour but could be smoother
So nice cherry and so much fruit that stood with  instapot made pork ribs with green tomatillo sauce and rice enjoy
Bouquet reminds of fruity italian. Taste of red fruit, thyme twigs (bitterness). Decent value, interesting mosdef
Got in spain

A deep crimson purple out of the bottle with notes of oak, toasted biscuits, lots of candied ripe red fruit and just a hint of chocolate. This is a full bodied, yet smooth wine with the right balance of acidity that leaves a lasting spicy impression on the palate. Highly recommend this wine at this price point.

Velvety smooth, a touch dry, soft tannins, but a pleasure to drink right out of the bottle. Raisin, chocolate, plum. Not overly sweet or spicy even with high alcohol. 
Lives up to the hype as noted by wine spectator. Great buy, wish I’d bought more!

This is lots of Earth and leather and tobacco and some spice and on the finish there is a nice little hint of cherry.

It is much better with food than as a sipping wine.Just quite enjoyable.
Tastes like American Oak! Wood, vanilla, root beer. Tastes like a california wine, but not my fav with such intense oakiness. Probably too bold for food unless it were a juicy rare steak.
Notes of cranberries, chocolate & vanilla in equal portions and intensity. Not a lot of pepper (if that's what you're looking for). Easily repeatable and totally enjoyable.
Deep purple. Rich aromas of blackberry, plum and cassis. Evident use of oak — vanilla, cedar and coffee aromas. Juicy and structured palate. Prominent vanilla and coffee on the palate. Good finish.
Good Spanish Syrah with bold and balanced body. It was my first Spanish Syrah a little bit different from Australian and French ones. Sort of berries were tasted, oak flavored was good.

4.5 91-92p. Backlog from Laudrup 25 Year Anniversary Tasting 2 June 2018: 

Nice Syrah with slightly burnt oak, lots of fruit and a high acidity. Very good QPR. 
10+-11-
Spanish Syrah from Borja.  Blackberry and oak with pleasant tannins.  We paired with paella de mariscos, of course!
Still 4 stars. Good price/value ratio.
Bold, jammy and intense, black cherry, blackberry, black currant, raspberry, prunes, malt, chocolate fudge, vanilla, burnt toast
Spicy, dry Spanish Shiraz
Leathery chocolate black cherry very strong in alcohol and punch.
Complex, leather on the nose.
Excellent. Complex with nice acidity.
Oak, leather chocolate blackberry
Full body with black fruit, oaky and leather. Not strong tannins and acidic.
Good Shirah, deep red, chocolate , smooth
Black fruit, oak, chocolate, hazelnut finish, rounded, smooth, jammy, full bodied.
A decent every day red wine
Dark fruit, smoked, spices (pepper). Our first Spanish Syrah, Recommandable.
blackberry oak plum

Very good.
Fruity and tasty.
Black fruit oaky soft and smooth tannin, good lightness and long finish
Dry, acidic, nold, vanilla, oak, leather
blackberry vanilla oak plum smoke pepper
Rich, good depth, chocolate and red berries. Very drinkable
Fruity with some leather and pepper on the nose. Nice Syrah...
Big smooth black cherries
Nicely spiced, good oak and fruit, starting to show some age but still pleasant.
Surprisingly good Syrah from Spain. Excellent price performance. Highly recommended indeed.
Leather, mineral, blackcurrant, cherry
Great value. Blackberry bramble, some raspberry, black cherry, hints of pepper and black olive
oak vanilla chocolate plum pepper  great value nice tannin
Tasteful, balanced, good shiraz. 15% but still elegant and delicate 🇪🇸👌🏼
Dark blackberry bright fruit on first taste still a bit of bite with the tannins nice long finish
Inky color.  Dark fruit.  Very enjoyable.  Buy if you can get under $20
Very smooth with a dry, clean finish
Yummy red; good body, flavor; wee bit of fruit but did great with steaks; bought from Elina
Good but too oaky
A fruity nose, Sweet finish, plums.
oak vanilla blackberry leather plum chocolate earth
3.9, wine #3 for the evening and I have tried this syrah before. Fresh, powerful, deep red color!
Chocolate plum leather
Good matched with grilled lamb.
Well balanced, subtle even if decent amount of alcohol
Big Jam long finish. Nice with our BBQ’d steak at the cottage.
Fill body, fruit forward, smooth tannins and absolutely delicious!
Raisin. Oak. Earth.
Smooth begging slightly tart ending very tobacco / leather tail
A wellmade wine with good fruity notes of blackberries, chocolate and red fruits.
vanilla oak blackberry pepper plum
Dry but very slightly sweet finish
Nice Spanish Syrah. Relatively full bodied with moderate plus tannins.
Strong, leathery with plum and chocolate on the pallet. Very dark color and perfect acidity.
Pepper, graphite, dry

Auckland’s Chris Ringland’s
Inverse retrograde project
Depth outside The Nest
blackberry leather vanilla oak
Black cherry, black plum, walnut, vanilla, cotton candy, smoked meats
Good Syrah red cherries leather and an interesting finish
Ripe plum, chocolate and tobacco. A bit of pepper.

3.4⭐️ Big, bold, tannic and punchy. This is a typically dark fruit forward peppery bottle from Chris Ringwald with plenty of oak, mocha, dark chocolate and blackberry to last the night. It needs at least 2 hours aeration to unwind and arguably longer. Slight dry for me, I prefer the region’s Grenache, but interesting nonetheless.

Dense, bold, dark 100% Syrah. Opaque ruby, oily swirl.

Vibrant nose delivers ripe dark fruit, burnt oak&licorice. Notes of dried herbs, coffee beans, vanilla, caramel, forest floor. Returning raspberry, cherry. Love it here - firm 4. 

Full bodied, ripe tannins&soft acidity on the palate.  Chocolate, vanilla&black licorice creates a sweet, primitiv-ish impression at a backbone. Less bright in this part (RS!) though a nice late night sipper overall - 3,7 total.

👁: dense and dark ruby red
👃: a lot is going on here, intense, cassis, smoke, dark chocolate, Marens cherry, tobacco, espresso, vanilla, currant 
👅: off-dry, well balanced acidity, medium tannins, full body, high alcohol, intense aromatic of chocolate and espresso, a long and slightly herbal and spicy finish

Wine 4 of an online blind tasting. I never would have thought that this is Shiraz. Explosion of intensity would be another name for it.

Mid ruby with garnish rim, mid nose intensity of black currant, blackberries, creme de cassis, pepper, oak. Dry, mid acidity, full body, mid tannins, mid palate of cassis, blackberry, dark cherry, tobacco, pepper, cacao.  Mid lenght

Deep ruby color with moderate aromatic intensity showing wild blackberry, ripe plum, raisin, red cherry, vanilla, freshly laid tar and earthy notes. Dry, full bodied and high alcohol with moderate plus, fine tannins. Decent value, but a bit too ripe and some unexpected tartness. 3.6

Palindrome in the Australian 🇦🇺 tradition. Nice mix of styles. Sweet aromas of sweet tobacco, chocolate, blackberry and olive. On the front of the palate it’s intense and much more savory with a fistful of black pepper (too much?), leather, fresh bell pepper and a little plum. Decent length. Definitely notice the Syrah’s 15% heat with a burn on the swallow. A bit pricey for the quality for Spain at $26 but on the whole I enjoyed and would drink again but probably not purchase.
☑️ 🇪🇸 Syrah at style #229.

Yum! I've long been a fan of Australian Shiraz, and this Spanish Sirah comes very close to matching my favorite one. Definite cherry, blueberry and some nuances that I frankly can't describe. In other words, this wine isn't just cherry juice sporting alcohol, but has a complexity of taste like a mysterious person that you sense but can't quite fathom. Highly recommended! Note, this is the 2015 vintage.
3.8 stars for this, my first Spanish Syrah ✅, or Shiraz spelled backwards.   Enjoyable and smooth,  not as big and bold as Australian Shiraz.  black fruit, cedar,  licorice predominate on the palate.

A bottle of full packed plummy jam in a bottle with a mild spicy fresh finish. 
Repeatable and tastes better after time, thickens up to a silky round juice. 
Much better than expected and one of my favourite Syrah wines.

Ooo this is a great wine for the price, an oz winemaker's shiraz  made in syrah style in Spain - everything in reverse (hence the name?). This has ripe black fruits plum blackberry a light lederhosen length leather and spiced oak and sweet tobacco. Again fantastic with our herbed roast lamb dish

Spain 🇪🇸 & Aussie 🇦🇺 join forces here, trusted producer Borsao; ✔off Spanish Syrah💃. Spain 🇪🇸 brings the value ($24), Aussies 🇦🇺 bring the quality (3.9🌟). Med purple pour, 7.5 min🌀brings👃of plum sauce, tobacco leaf🍂, sassafras, green peppercorn & anise. Dry, full bodied bruiser👊 @ 15%ABV. Fully balanced⛹. Med fresh & appropriate acidity, med grainy tannins. Fruit forward but not jammy👅of blackberry, dried blueberry, tart dried cranberry; mid👅of black cardamom & licorice thru the long 🏁; 253

Black plum, blackberry vanilla bean ice cream, grilled meat. 

It later opens up to umami flavors of teriyaki sauce and soy sauce. Ginger snap and smoked meat. 

Vibrant acidity and soft tannin. 

What an interesting wine from Borsao. Their Tres Picos is a benchmark for Spanish Grenache but who would have know they would do Shiraz so well.

4,1/5 Impressive Syrah from Zaragoza

Deep ruby color

Med+ nose, developing, ripe plum, blackberry, black currant, thyme, mint, black pepper, licorice, minerals, crushed gravel, leather, smoke, chocolate, vanilla, tobacco and cedar

Palate dry, full body, med tannins, med+ acid, high alcohol, dusty texture, med+ flavors intensity and med+ spicy aftertaste

Great VFMoney warm climate Syrah with great structure, power, fruit forward style, tangling spice and really good balance.

a warming syrah, perfect for this rainy day (15% vol).
deep, dark ruby color.
full of ripe dark fruits, accents of oak, cocoa and leather.
full bodied, nice balance, strong chalky tannins, and a spicy, sweet finish.
long.

Deep ruby in color. Nose of medium (+) intensity with blackberries, black cherry, cocoa, tobacco, cured meat, vanilla, cinnamon. On the palate it’s dry, high acidity, high tannins, high alcohol, full body, pronounced flavour intensity, long finish. Outstanding wine, great complexity and body. Very pleasant and easy to drink.

🔠💲aturday ⚡️💲🏄🏻‍♂️panish 🇪🇸 🏄🏻‍♂️yrah or 🏄🏻‍♂️hiraz! The name ZARIHS is even 🏄🏻‍♂️hiraz spelt backwards! 🍇 🏄🏻‍♂️yrah. The vineyard´s altitude is from 350 to 600 meters above 🏄🏻‍♂️ea level, in limestone 🏄🏻‍♂️oil, giving the 🏄🏻‍♂️yrah a pleasant acidity.
The maceration is between 4-5 days and the total fermentation takes 15-20 days in 🏄🏻‍♂️tainless 🏄🏻‍♂️teel tanks then  in new American oak barrels for 12 months. More below ⬇️

One of the greatest Spanish wines, definitely. Deep dark purplish-ruby colour, quite clear. Rich and developing nose of ripe plum, cinnamon, cocoa, smoky notes, nutmeg and toasted nuts. Full bodied, medium acidity, medium alcohol, soft integrated tannins. Aftertaste with plenty of tobacco, condensed milk and chocolate.

Big bold robust Syrah from Aragon. This is definitely a cocktail wine, with tons of heft and high alcohol to boot. Notes of cola, blackberries, vanilla, licorice. A good amount of acid on the tail so this could pair with bold flavors.  Very well done, demonstrating some of great wines currently coming out of lesser known Spanish appellations.

First time trying a Syrah from Spain. Ordered this bottle after trying the ‘Tres Picos Garnacha’ from Borsao. This is pretty similar in feel. Big, bold, juicy and spicy. Gorgeous deep purple colour with leather, smokey cedar and black fruits on the nose. On the palate cassis, cherries, plums, chocolate, pepper and mocha. Dry and full bodied.

My first Shiraz/Syrah from Spain and this is a collaboration between an Aussie and a Spaniard which is not a surprise. Deep blackcurrant colour. Certainly has some legs at 15% abv but not overpowering. Good aromas and flavours of blackcurrant, thyme, earthy, blackberry, chocolate, cinnamon and tobacco. High acidity and smooth ripe tannins. Finish is relatively long.

4.2⭐️ Bam! That’s a treat! Perfectly balanced!

Claret on the eye. 

Nose of ripe black fruits, plum, vanilla and some spices. Tongue follows beautifully with blackberry and blueberry. Nice alcohol kick and pepper towards the finish. Full bodied, high- acidity, delicate, round and soft tannins and medium finish.

Dark sweet plums infused Spanish Syrah. Literally oozing stone fruit sweetness. Dark chocolate, leather white pepper and vanilla all compose the bouquet. Tannins are well managed meaning this could still age well and retain complexity. Drink now and drink in a few years, it’s all good!!!
First Spanish Syrah and I’m impressed.

Popping this open in the middle of my Hobbit film marathon. Dark berry, jerky and cedar on the nose, smoothly textured and integrated spice on the palate. Wine and Tolkien go together fantastically, in my opinion. Syrah and dragons especially so. Bring on Smaug! 🔥

A very bold Syrah with powerful blackberry notes. Woody, smoky, sweet vanilla and chocolate. Full body with sweet tanins. Dry plums and hints of coffee on the palate. Very solid and powerful Syrah but I would prefer a more gentle character.

4,25⭐️ Qatar Business. Deep ruby colur. Wild blackberries, dark plums, dark chocolate, leather, some oak spice and vanilla. Medium+ intensity and mouthfeel. Medium(+) acidity and silky tannins. Complex. Medium+ fruity finish.
Chris Ringland's wine 🇦🇺. Dark red ink, coffee, toasted coco, chunky and creamy cherry
Excellent
Amazing
Fresh and fruity. Very smooth and nice for lunch. One thing is it's a strong one

So good performance...
Unique design naming...
Syrah notable.
Tinto
Meaty, smoky, perhaps fennel aroma.  Darn plum on palate, good tannins and long finish.
Still great value for money

Nose: wet slate, oak
Tastes: BlackBerry, plum, hint of vanilla, coffee, spice/pepper
Wow, Should've known that the makers of Tres Picos would knock this out of the ballpark
Very much ok wine, doesn't really improve with age. See former notes
Lovely. Full bodied.
Earthy, bold, dark fruit

Unripe blackberry. Bitter cocoa. Deep and rich with tons of slatey grey minerality.
A touch of Dill from American oak.

The oaky aroma dominated when I opened the bottle.

After airing our for around an hour, I got a nose and taste of blackberry and plum.

 blackberry black fruit plum oak
Deep bold red full of flavour. A bit of tobacco and earthy tones. Ideal with a good piece of steak and peppercorn sauce. Try it, you might be less sniffy about Spanish wines - I am 😉

Pour: Rich and dark ruby

Nose: oak, vanilla, leather

W/O decanted Palate: cherry, plum, honey, chocolate, pepper, jam

Drink now till 2026

Exceptional value for the money
Is there anything that this winery doesn’t do well?
Very smooth syrah; predominantly blackberry and oak with hints of vanilla.

Ancient notes from the archive, typing up for personal reference. From 350-600m asl, this DO Campo de Borja is aged 12m in American oak.

Med ruby. Lots of chunky rich new oak character supported by ripe black cherry, blackberry, cassis & violet. Damson w. faint cured meat & m+ aroma intensity.

Dry. Good m+ acidity balances the richness w. m+ fine-grained tannins. Dark chocolate, blackberry, black cherry & cassis w. m+ body. Good spice notes & vanillin to a m+ finish. Just a tad too oaked.

Big, bold an fruity this well named red offers a nice drinking session. We needed something bigger and fruited after a few other bottles and this did the trick. Very well priced and offers notes of cherries, blackberry and some spices. Deep purple red with clear chewy tannins and low acidity. Medium finish

A big, bold, powerful shiraz with a lot of black fruits on the nose. 
Smooth tannin with a balance structure. A special Spanish shiraz.
Oaky, dry, really flavorful! I absolutely love it. Smells like pepper. I will absolutely order this for daily use wow! Love it
Bold and spicy with low tannins and moderate acidity. Very enjoyable with bbq ribs.
A competent Syrah, discreet on the nose but shows its character in mouth. Tasty and well balanced, can hardly tell its 15% vol. Good value for money.
I understand the wonderful score that this wine got. Unique taste, strong and dominant but personally I less liked it.
Very alcoholic Spanish syrah. Lacking in complexity. Too much fruit, not enough back end or pepper. Unbalanced.
Sweet aromas, leather, smoke, dark fruits, chocolate, espresso, rape fruit, cherry in chocolate, liqueur, perceptible alcohol, no acidity
Fruity, dark berry, vanilla, blackberry, plum. Smooth tannins, a bit jammy, but well balanced. Med+ finish.
Bold, chocolate and oak, high octane fuel that doesn’t disappoint.  After a few sips dark plum started to arise…
Light colour. Smell has some pepper. Taste is light at first with some oak but intensifies and stay - maybe some spices.
First spanish shira. Huge price value vin. Tangy pepper, leather, Black fruit. My wife love it. 3.9 / 5.0
Ripe black fruit. Hint of red also. Smoke. Dusty earthy. Vanilla. Jasmine. Cinnamon. Acidity M+. Tannin MM+. Yummy wine 🍷
Color see through on rims, on nose oak leather . On palate pepper blackberry smoke cinnamon cedar blackcurrant.
Interesting and complex, really enjoyable on its own or with something cheesy, leather oak and berries, delicious
Big punchy shiraz. Very smooth, wonderful long finish of earthy notes, after blackberries, smoke, and plum. Loved it!
Very good, as always. Somewhat uncharacteristic for a Shiraz, as far as I can tell. But a really nice red nonetheless!
Full-bodied and very pleasant red wine with tobacco/plum/oak notes and slight vanilla notes. Super wine for heavy meals.
Perfect
Full, bold, Syrah.
Ok
Rating only
Good wine
Mmmm 😋
Brilliant flavours.
Super RQP

Really enjoyed this. We have done a few Shiraz recently. In order of preference: 
1. zarish (Spain)
2. The black craft (Australia)
3. Premier regard crozes hermitage (France)
4. The scoundrel (Australia) 
5. The sack (Australia)

The only one I would not recommend is the sack. 2 - 4 came across as uncomplicated, enjoyable wines. #1 has more to it...

Lovely open nose, underpinned by full bodied, ripe fruit flavour.
Worth decanting and enough tannic structure to keep and improve for a further 10 years.

Taste bomb! Oak, cedar sigar box (pleonasm, no?), vanilla, chocolate, black fruit, blackberry, plum, ink, smoked bacon (insofar I remember it), leather, notes of pepper and smoke. Slightly tannic, high acidity and quite a bit of body.

Great Syrah from Borsao. Dark but bright red. Leather and soil scent, mixed with black fruits. Very smooth in mouth, very balanced, acidity and alcohol perfectly integrated. Couldn't stop drinking it until finished.

Bold,  extractive and spicy spanish syrah.  Dark ruby red on eye with garnet rim. Aromas of ripe black cherry, blackberry, blueberry,  forest floor  with notes of pepper,  cigar box,  leather, eucaliptus and ceddar wood. Also notes of smoky bacon,  black cherry compote and blackberry jam.  Juicy,  spicy and fruity on the palate. Long bittery finish. Full bodied and well ballanced wine.  Very  very good syrah !   Viva Campo de Borja!  Viva Espana!!!
3.7 Full, oily, velvety. Sour cherries, black cherries, blackberries. Cinnamon, vanilla, smoked fish, and licorice. Would be good wine but too much licorice which overshadows everything else.

2015 Borsao Zarihs Syrah. It's a syrah from Campo de Borja, the southside from Rioja, Spain. Very similiar with aussie shiraz because it was made by aussie shiraz grape clone and cooperative collaboration with Chris Ringland. Deep and sweet. Met this again after 3 years. Tasted in 2020 May.

We paired this dark red inky medium bodied wine with pasta alla Norma. A Spanish Syrah in an Australian style that has cigar box, green pepper, and spice on the nose with licorice, herbs, plum, cherry, and more spice on the palate with a long smooth finish. Love the reverse font on the label!

Zarihs (Shiraz in reverse) comes from s less known region of Campo de Borja (Aragón). It's a collaboration between Australian and Spanish winemaker (Shiraz in .au is Syrah in .es) I expected my yammy Australian vibes. Well, they are there but only as a decoration. Smoke, honey, pine resin. Quite thin, high in alcohol. An interesting find, In highly recommend for wine explorers.

Tried to pair it with Manchego cheese. Both got better, but not match made in a heaven.

Look: very deep purple, almost black

Smell: ripe plum and blackberry smell, very fruity expression. Almost like an alcoholic dark fruit distillate. Also aromatic with thyme, cinnamon and cloves. Smoky character. 

Taste: overwhelmingly alcoholic, followed by what is Shiraz to me (plum and pepper), very bitter finish of fresh black olives. Fine grained tannin on the gum. 

Shiraz is not me. This one is no exception, especially because it’s an extraordinarily aggressive specimen.

Aster Crianza in its 7th year. Well matured Ribera. Shows elegance and absolutely ready for drinking. Deep red transparent colour. Medium to full body, medium acidity. Blue berries are pretty dominant in the overall taste. Notes of light violets. Tannins are firm and touchy-feely. At the finale the taste evolves to a dark fruit and light meat touch. Simply excellent in 2022. 92JS, solid 4⭐️🍷

Interesting stuff here: a Tempranillo with a Crianza label..., but it matured for 24 months on American oak casks. Here you get a nose of red fruit and black fruit, with some plum and on top some vanilla. There are lot of exotic aroma’s on the side after the first sip and that’s tx to the American oak. 

Full body with nicely polished tannins. I expected more “bull power” from the Tempranillo, but it has a bit of reservations. It takes a few hours before the real beauty awakens. Just wait and see 🤩👌

Spanish September. A very tasty Ribera del Duero Crianza from a great vintage. 100% Tinta del Pais (Tempranillo) from vineyards @ 780m asl. Aged 22m in 70% new French oak.

Med ruby. Rich m+ aroma intensity w. big blackberry, strawberry, violet, blackcurrant & sweet vanilla oak. Complex w. toasty black cherry & a touch of caramel. Developing.

Dry. M+ alc, high ripe tannins, concentrated black cherry, blackcurrant, blackberry, high acidity & well-integrated vanilla, liquorice, clove & coffee to a m+ finish.

Clear, medium ruby. Clean, medium intensity aroma of cherry, plum, earth, chocolate, tobacco, leather. Dry, medium plus acidity, medium plus tannins, medium body and medium finish. Palate confirms the nose. Decanter FWE.

3.8 ⭐️ Deep ruby red, light sediment. Oak, spices & dark fruit on nose.  Young in glass but alcohol is well disguised.  Abundance of cherries with an approachable well structured body of firm tannins gripping palate. Pleasant acidity that lingers modestly long with notes of oak and vanilla.  Best with food.  Perhaps one more year for a full 4.0 ⭐️. Nice!

The wine is deep ruby.

It has pronounced aromas including primary aromas of black cherry and black plum, secondary aromas of chocolate, and tertiary aromas of leather.

The wine is dry with medium body. It has high acidity, medium tannin, and high alcohol with medium intensity of flavors including primary flavors of black cherry, dried herbs, and licorice, secondary flavors of chocolate, coffee, and smoke, and tertiary flavors of leather. Medium finish. Very good quality.

Deep red colour.  Intense cherry and blackberries on the nose. A complex palate of cedar, tobacco, oak, leather and cocoa powder. Great structure and balance with a pleasant acidity and tannins providing a gripping mouthfeel.

At “La Taberna” Corralejo 
Made from 100% Tinta del Pais old vines .
Lovely nose with cherry, blackberry, some plum, iron, develloped layers of flavours ..... Ripe fruits, different spices, the carefull use of cedar wood, silky tannins and acids, earth, leather, good balance, verry nice Ribera del Duero ! 92DSP

Still solid and has a few years left. Perfumed aromas of cedar, aged oak, wet earth, plums, spices and tons of tobacco and smoke. The palate is grippy with dark fruits; dates, plums, blueberry reduction, spicebox. Lingering gritty finish. This is just lovely, no need to wait - this is as good as it gets!

Medium garnet. Pronounced intensity of red cherry plum liquorice herbal spice oak chocolate. Dry m+ acidity and tannin. During a blind tasting I mistakenly thought this was a Rioja but in fact tannin in this wine was higher than Rioja and it didn’t have the crabapple flavor

Really dark color to this wine. Dark fruit like black currant, black berries and a little plum. There is also hints of soft, spicy and woody notes - not unlike what you find in black tea. The taste is  powerful and with lots of fruit. This is a 2014 vintage uncorked in 2019 - not quite youthful. Still, it has a nice tannin structure that makes me believe this wine will also be delicious to drink with all the fruity characters intact another five years from now. Definitely a wine I can recommend seeking out
Very dark, with black cherries, mocha, cinnamon, graphite, cedar. Full bodied, harsh tannins, moderately astringent, acid. On the palate the fruit is jammy, with oak and chocolate. Con Toron

Deep, dark, opaque red, dark fruit, baking spices on the nose, jammy grape and blackberry flavor with a dry, oaky finish.  Would buy again.
Very flavoursome. Lightly acidic, with oak and vanilla and leather. Seriously yummy.
Smooth as you like... great on its on own
Very nice. Oak and chocolate on the palate.
Very nice; rich, fruity upfront with lots of tannins yet good finish, long
Plenty of Oak on the nose. Deep berry and licorice flavors soft finish but good legs.
3.8-3.9 Very shape for RDD. Mix of red berries and tannins. Round and cherry! Young and power!

From the La Rioja Alta stable, this is 100% Tinta del Pais.

Tasted at the Decanter Fine Wine Encounter in November 2017.

Carmín color, opaque, plenty of legs, cocoa powder, leather, some vanilla on the nose, acidity medium, tannins are subtle, round, well balanced wine, some ripe BlackBerry, pepper, black cherry, dark chocolate, dry, long finish

Deep purple in the glass 

Nose has black cherry and predominantly darker fruits. 

Good amount of oak as well. 

Just lovely to drink. Tiny bit of sweetness but feels quite full bodied and smooth. Good tannin and acidity so it doesn’t feel flabby.

Nothing too complex but very well made without flaws.

The La Rioja Alta Group's Aster 2015 Crianza Ribera del Duero
100% Tinta del País 🇪🇦

Color's deep inky ruby
Aromas of licorice, mocha, blueberry & fig
Palate of dark plum, gritty tannins, astringent & full bodied. M(+) acidity, balsamic, hard tack leather & soft blueberry w/ a very dry body from entry to the finish. Mocha, oak & cherry w/ vanilla
& licorice. Dark and red fruit collide to provide a rich, juicy moderate finish
3.8🌟
Delicious, slightly rustic style from La Rioja Alta stable. Dark, forest fruit flavors and tobacco on the finish. A bit tight, needs more time.
Dark bright ruby red, elegant woody aromas and red berries, medium tannins and low acidity, smooth and velvety, very well balanced from beginning to end...
This wine is amazing for the price, dark robust fruit, smooth vanilla palate and sweet velvety finish.  Definitely going to buy some more!
Dry, dark tannins and a hint of tobacco
Dark cherry red. Nose - cherry again & old furniture, minerals. Balsamic acidity, medium-bodied. Fine tannins, silky structure, long finish. May be a little better than 4 - 4,2-4,3/5.
Easy drinking tempranillo. Fig presence. Fruit preserve character. Fried okra notes. Many layers. Minimal tannins. Moderate alcohol. Very complex for a tempranillo. Long finish. Crowd pleaser!

lite burnt cigar box nose 
licorice , green pepper, blood orange nose

great barbecue wine!!

Already a decline wine. Should drink it now 
A bit Choco, cherry
Darker, richer, inky-er than Riojas.  Black fruits and strong muscular tannins
Starts with a blast from the spice weasel. Rolling back into chocolate and rockets into a smooth finish. Lingering complexity on the breath transitions through a space journey of flavors.
Aromas of dark fruits and blackberry jam, anise and hints of oak. Palate is well structred, long and smooth. Medium tannins with character. Very enjoyable finish. Excellent PQR!
Very nice for crianza. Beautful colour and aroma, we had with bréf and it tasted nice,bút not quite full bodied, lacked á little bút was splendid.
Exemplifies the region.  Nice subtle spice flavor with hint of chalk
Lots of berrries. Very nice.

Good value; good quality wine. It's young but so well structured, you can enjoy plentiful. Animal notes, slight vegetable essence. Brightfull and balanced.
For me the best of the 3. Excellent ruby, fruitiness. Same earthy flavor we have had from all these riberas but the nicest.
We like this almost as well as the Dehesa La Granja. Not the amazing deal as the old alidis... but very nice.
Good balance of nose and finish. Seemed better the second night after opening and storing properly.
A very bold and dry Crianza indeed. Punnets of mushroom on the nose, with hints of blackberry and vanilla. Medium to large tanning. A middle of the road drop from RDD region.
Wow, this is a bit of a sleeper. Wonderful baked red fruit with nice vegetal notes, but then a wave of caramel, sea salt, and cinnamon come barreling in on the finish. Well-structured and lively.
Leather and earth tones. Excellent aftertaste of chocolat. Very rounded and smooth. Pear and raspberries tone. Tobacco and oak. Very nice for winter evening.
Absolutely rock solid for the price. Big, bold, prominent tannins and oak for days perfectly balanced with notes of vanilla, dark fruits, and even a little mocha.

Aged for 22 months in 70/30 new/old French oak this crianza is from La Rioja Alta's Bodegas Aster in RDD. 

Deep deep cherry red not showing much aging at the rim. Some crystals in the bottle. 

Blackberry, with some earthy savoury notes on the nose is reflected in the taste as well as some mocha, hints of vanilla and perhaps some aniseed. 

Very good concentration and mouthfeel, sweet, very fine tannins lead to a good length of finish.

Very nice Ribera del Duero,
a very dark cherry color 
with violet rim.
Nose: intense black fruit, spice, star anise, vanilla, cinnamon, coffee, cherry wood.
In the mouth: ripe cherries, black currants, berries, jam, mocha, spice.
Wine fresh, soft, juicy, medium light, fruity young tannins and acidity.
Finish, long, very fresh, fruity.

Deep ruby to garnet. Pronounced nose ripe black fruits such as blackcurrant , bramble, black cherry, black plum, liquorice, cedar, dill, coconut , butterscotch.  Dry, high acidity, high tannins, full body, high in alcohol, same notes as nose, plus some kirsch, chocolate, leather, tobacco. Med (+) finish. A very good wine, with some potential to age (5 years). Great value for money, highly recommended.

Amazing baking spice on nose with touch of vanilla immediately upon opening.  Well balanced sweet tannins. Palate adds fruits with spice and the finish that never ends, and this is a great find for me.

Well made, 2008 consumed 4/17. Purple-black color. Nose is high on alcohol, moderate plus French oak, black currants, tar, moderate intensity.   Fine, well rested tannins yet still persistent. Mid palate is a bit boring with some decent Balck fruit. Finish is very long, less fruit and more focused around oaky spice.  Paired with fine tannins, it's very dry, and more of a fatty ribeye type wine.  Oak is not as intrusive as Californian style, still a bit much for my liking.  Recommended for Cab fans. 90pts

Fabulous old Aster - expected to be near the end or halfway dead but it did perform fantastic. Still little tannins and acid but enough to make it perfect. Fine balance still some bite and a great experience

On the nose, blackcurrent, black cherry, vanilla, smoke and slightly herbaceous. Overall a great wine with full blast acidity and a long finish. I am a great ribera del duero fan for the pure reason that the wines are just incredible!

Clear, medium + ruby with pronounced legs. Clean in nose, medium + intensity, youthful, aromas of black fruits, oak, butter, spices. Dry in mouth, pronounced intensity, medium acidity, medium + tannins, medium + alcohol and body. Flavors of oak, black fruits, spices, butter. Long finish. Excelent quality wine to drink now but has potential for aging.

Ribera at its best... all the flavor of the Tempranillo and the feeling of Spain...
High tannins that give it a long lasting taste, strong flavors of wood, spices...   but a smooth ending that makes you want more...
A great recommendation from a wine seller...

critics said the Aster 2001 has a drinking window through 2020, I would say is still hanging in there nicely, displaying a brownish red with orange hue offers an expressive nose of blackberry, prunes, licorice and cedar..... this is followed by a mid-full bodied juice with rounded and pleasant berry notes, balanced acidity, sweetness and mellowed tannins that linger long, very pleased with the outcome
Mineral, herb and tobacco flavors mingle with cherry fruit in this firm, sinewy red. Shows some nice spicy notes, with fresh acidity.

Aster is a relatively new winery in the heart of Ribera del Duero with a huge wine tradition in other regions such as Rioja. They are part of Rioja Alta Group and gave 125 years of history making amazing wines. This is a Crianza but could easily be a Reserva because spends 24 months in barrel.

On the second day even better. 92 WS deservedly. Could age nicely I think. Why did I only buy one...

First encounter with La Spinetta.

Seriously structured for a Barbera d'Asti!
Wouldn't say bold but the softened tannins are upfront. 
The fruit is ripe, cherry and blackberries. Clear barrique influence, but well integrated and matching the power of the fruit and lively acid. Cocoa, tobacco spices. Good intensity. Needs time in the decanter, but preferably at least another 2 years in the cellar, maybe more.

Ragú Bolognese, lasagna or braised oxtail would be nice on the side.

Wine tasting at La Spinetta in Piemonte 🇮🇹 For all wines tasted it was really high quality but very pricey as well 🍷Quality Barbera with blackberries, black cherries, red fruit, leather, cinnamon, pepper, smoke, licorice, oak and vanilla 🍷 medium body, light tannins and medium plus acidity 🍷🍷

Deep reddish-purple, with almost no clearing along the rim. Smell is spicy with slight alcohol, blackberry, oak, black pepper, tar and chiles. Taste is surprisingly mellow at the start of the palate, with flavors of blackberry, plum, leather, graphite, some herbaceousness, and lots of black pepper for a long finish. A great expression of barbera from Spinetta, definitely a good buy

Serious, good body, good aftertaste.  Dark red, a little bit too high in alcohol,  but likely it was served warmer than what it should.

Clear, deep ruby. Clean, medium intensity aroma of cherry, blackberry, earth, herbs, pepper. Dry, high acidity, medium plus tannins, full body and medium finish. Palate confirms the nose. Well balanced and very complex, excellent quality.

Beautiful red blend from the Piedmont region.  Great value for the quality.  Hints of plums, blueberries and blackberries.  Well balanced with mild tannins.  Not overpowering and pairs well with meat and with hardy fish such as swordfish.  Definitely will be buying again.  However, careful with the pricing at restaurants, the markup can sometimes be offputting.

The full-bodied taste of wine has a bright acidity and a silky texture. Beautiful tones of blackcurrant, plums, Indian tea and ripe fruit combine richness and grace. A complex, refreshing finish captivates with the softness of tannins.
Nose:
The extremely rich aroma of the wine demonstrates the rich tones of violets, raspberries, blackberries and cherries, wrapped in light airy notes of orange zest, spices and more dense velvety nuances of moist earth and balsamic.

The wine has pronounced intensity on the nose with aromas of blackberry purée, raspberry jam, tar, strawberry, black currant, violet, black cherry. The wine is dry with medium acidity, medium+ tannins, high alcohol, and fuller body. The wine has medium intensity on the palate with flavors of blackberry, raspberry, strawberry jam, chocolate, vanilla, tobacco, violet. Very jammy and elegant.

La Spinetta Barbera d'Asti Ca di Pian is the classic from La Spinetta. It has a dark ruby ​​color and the nose elegant cherry and plum flavors. In the mouth Barbera d'Asti Ca di Pian is dense and full of perfect structure. The Ca di Pian from the winery La Spinetta shows his great personality with mild and finely balanced tannins and an excellent fruit richness. The finish is soft and mild to leave without missing an excellent length.

First night in Italy and aged wine on the list! Heavily perfumed nose, plum, dried plum, cigarbox, sandalwood, well made (not sweetened) raspberry mermelade, soft cinnamon, ripe canned cherry, licorice, hints of dark chocolate. 
Silky soft corny tannins, perfect acidity and sweet spot. Full bodied at 14 abv.
Don't expect me to be too objective, as this matched fantastic with the white pizza with truffle, funghi porcini and speck plus a great decanting show from the waiter.

The Grande Partenza of il Giro d’Italia today in Torino calls for a Piemonte wine!

Sneaked a glass while cooking, started off a bit bland, a bit uninspiring but came into its own with the risotto! 
Though barbera isn’t really a variety that exites me terribly, this sure is one of the better I’ve tried! 

Intense aromas of red fruit, vanilla and tobacco. In the mouth, dry tannins, quiet acidic, flavors of red cherry, raspberries, vanilla, leather and some black pepper  emerges as other flavors pull back! 🦈

One of my favourite barbera from one of my favourite wineries. The later may be because La Spinetta was the first Italian winery I visited...

Blackberry and cherry At first. Maybe also some pepper. Later I find oak and leather. Full bodied with nice acidity. We had it to a creamy pasta dish and it was perfect.

Piedmonte monday. La Spinetta is up for a challange and on the job

#MayIdrinkItalian #9

Barbera d'Asti. 100% Barbera. 

Medium bodied. Medium tannins. Medium high acidity. Dry

Earth on the nose. Blueberry, cherry, liquorice, tobacco, blackberry and florals. Leather. On palate oak, cherry, vanilla, pepper, blackberry, liquorice and herbs

Only one month since the last time I had this one, but was in the mood for a La Spinetta monday. Third rating this year so kind of barbera of the house. 4,0 stars

More like 4.25. This is a great Barbera.  Crisp but balanced acidity almost like a fruit drop supported by smooth tannins. Very easy drinking and it offers a very long well balanced finish. Not the most complex wine but what’s there is perfect. Fantastic value.

4,1 deep red with hint of blue.
Nose: rich fruity with dark cherry, blueberry, and some oak
Palate: round mouthful and balanced with dark fruits. Firm tannins and good acidic in the back with a decent finish.

🏆88

Good Barbera from 32 yrs old vines from the Canelli vineyard. Cherry tones and pleasant mouthfeel. Output about 80000 bottles a year. 14 percent alcohol is a well controlled level and provided a balanced integrated palate.

A red wine from Piemonte in northern Italy. 100% Barbera grapes. Burgundy red color, dry and high acidity. Notes of violet, cherry, blackberry, earthy, oak and vanilla. We enjoyed it with spicy pizza. Cin cin 🇮🇹 🍷 😀 #3.91

Yet again astonished! Reason number one: it’s a “La Spinetta” (otherwise ruined by oak). Number two: it’s a Barbera (not a Piedmont favorite). Number three: the price (it’s a give away!!). Spinetta is otherwise always overpriced (from my perspective) but this Barbera keeps on delivering vintage after vintage for a “few dollars”, 15€ that is😜 Inky, blueberries, blackberries almost black currant and a great acidity and the “de facto” involved barriques are kept in a leash, or in harmony if you like.

Stunning Barbera! Needs some time to open up and show its true colors. Ruby red, notes of blackberry, tobacco, leather and forest fruit. 
Structured, full bodied and rich on the palate, with grippy tannins and a fruity finish. A keeper.

Hello from Denver Colorado ⛰!!
First wine of the tour, a tasty Barbera D’Asti

La Spinetta is one of those wineries where I see it, I buy it

Love reliable producers like that

Enjoyed this backstage (after a much needed cappuccino ☕️). Textbook notes of big, juicy red & blue fruit, barnyard, herbs, hint of oak & a lovely acidity that cut through it all

Perfect for a homemade bolognese 🍝 , of which I have none 😔

Somewhere between 3.5 & 4. Rounded up for a great 🇮🇹 producer to start the tour 😎👍🏻

3.8⭐Dark ruby. On the nose blackberries, blueberries, dark plum, spices, oak. 

On the palate more of the above. Also vanilla, some violets, some leather. Deep fruit flavors. Fresh and juicy with mouth drying tannins. Well balanced, fresh acidity. 
Pairs well with classic Italian dishes, such as lasagna and pizza with some meat and spices. 

Medium body, medium acidity and medium tannins.

Deep ruby and fruity nose of dark berries. This grape is such a match for good Italian food. Carbonara was the choice tonight. The bright acidity and mild silky tannins make this such a popular choice. The Rhino 🦏 makes a good one. Almost a Merlot the way this just glides over the palate. A food / wine that compliments and enhances each other. 91. This seems a tad better than the 15. A couple of years to come together in the bottle works well.

This is  a bright and vibrant red. It has intense blackberry and plum on this nose. This combines with some hints of mint and vanilla on the palate. It is medium to full bodied and has chewy tannins and a nice finish...90 points

Summary: excellent little Barbera! True pleasure to drink and the perfect companion to a cold, wet, winter night. Very well balanced with great structure. 

On the nose: hints of cherry, plum, blackberry, blueberry, tobacco, leather, earthy tones, and even some licorice. A final touch of dried fruit, fig and some prunes. 

On the palate: nicely structured. Great tannin development. Length, depth and complexity. 

Points: 16-17

Warm and cosy nose with ripe cherry, tobacco, petroleum, oak and slight almond. Dark and ripe fruit, strawberries and raspberry, vanilla, tarragon, bay leaf. Will likely integrate better with a few more years but very pleasant! Reliable with La Spinetta🥰! (16p)

Another great vintge! Inviting vanilla and cherry nose followed by a lush and succulent palatte.  blueberry and blackberry tartness combined with some more earthy oak and vanilla make for a very well balanced wine. Mediumbodied and a great partner with lambracks.

Lovely

Deep garnet, nose a bit closed but beautiful after some time open. Black cherry, blueberry, plum, oak on the nose.

Still young, high acidity, high alcohol, full bodied. Same flavors like on the nose with some extra chocolate and vanilla

Lovely

Barbera doesn’t get much more serious than this, and I generally prefer examples from Asti as they tend to be better value. La Spinetta have long been at the forefront of epic examples that age gracefully, setting a benchmark for the variety. While 2014 was a challenging vintage for red wines in Piedmont, this wine has depth and structure, good fruit and firm tannins. Could certainly benefit from some more time in bottle.

Dark blue-red colour. 
Nuanced nose with dark cherries, oak, and some herbs. 
The taste a bit spicy with dark cherries, oak, vanilla and some blueberries. 
Tannines not to powerful, well balanced - this will be a 4,5, maybe a 5 in a few years.

Medium ruby red colour. Pronounced intensity nose from cherries, plums, oak,  blueberry and some chocolate. Dry Sweetness, medium acidity, medium tannins, high alcohol and full body. Medium intensity palate from mainly dark cherries, dark plums, oak, chocolate and some spices. Long lasting finish and overall excellent quality! 

Fantastic wine with good balance, excellent palate and long lovely finish.

Pizza + Barbera = ❤

Black forest cake aromas, with a strong savoury liquorice/herbal/white pepper dimension. Some vanilla & marzipan, a touch of roast ham with time. Yum!
Juicy palate, enhanced by a very high, mouthwatering acidity. Mouth-coating sandy (but Whitehaven Beach style 😎😉) tannins. Could benefit from a few more years but quite nice now. So food-friendly, very much needs some 🍕!

3.9

14% abv, Diam.

Thick and dark ruby red, with an equally thick and fleshy cherry, raspberries sweetness, blueberries, blackberries and chocolate. Still very pronounced but soft and silky tannins, and long finish. What a great Barbera. (July 2021).

Wow! Fantastic Barbera!

Dark cherry, blackberry, oak and some flowers, maybe like violet.

Simple, yet complex.
Easy, yet structured.
I seriously loved this like crazy - and I only had one glass!

Booom! 👊🏻💥

Looking for a pizza wine and picked this one 👍🏻

Very spicy and herbal on the nose. Oak, smoke and dark fruit

High on tannins, high but very pleasant acidity, quite bold, taste of blackberry, black currant, licorice and spicy notes

Very nice  Barbera 👍🏻

4.0 🇮🇹 
👃🏼 plommon
👄  earthy oak cherry blueberry blackberry raspberry comes to mind. 

Very god wine but this bad boy need some attention of some good meat. Bit this with meat and you are  have a home run!

Good luck

On the nose, new leather, game, black cherry, barbecue meat, milk chocolate, crushed rock, tobacco leaf, cigar box, forest floor, potting soil, flint, iron. 

On the palate, savory with black cherry, sour cherry, black plum, red plum, wild strawberry, red currant, pomegranate, tomato skin, some orange peel, dried fig, milk chocolate, blueberry jam. 

Medium plus acidity, medium tannins, medium body.

Fruity and spicy Barbera, fresh with smooth but noticeable tannins. Bramble, black cherry, pepper, licorice, dried herbs and just a hint of chocolate and cinnamon on the nose. On the palate the typical Barbera acidity is balanced by a good structure. The smooth tannins are very noticeable on the finish.

Wow. A very dark color & meaty/smoky nose for a barbera. An initial hint of sulfur—give it decanter time to dissipate. Unusually base-note/umami for a barbera, and thick, but solid & it works. This 2017 is a food wine that went well with a hearty hors d’oeuvres plate. 3.8 to 3.9 woofs.

Deep Ruby robe. 
Pronounced nose: black pepper, black cherry, chocolate, toast, smoke, coffee, leather, balsamic, dried herbs, wood. 
Palate: dry, high acidity, medium tannin and alcohol, full body, medium intensity. Spices, chocolate, leather, smoke, wood. 
Balanced and complex.
Fine Italian from the north. A gift from a friend doing a short visit. Strong nose. Notes of chocolate, blackberry and vanilla.
Very good and balanced wine. Strong scents of black fruits. Good tannins and acidity. Good finish where you can taste the oak and vanilla.
Rich and full bodied with blackberry and cherry notes. A bright acidity provides balance. Fine tannins. A nice example of barbera.
Black Currant, nice earthy notes with some deep spice a touch astringent. Some black licorice perhaps..  Yep leather. Nicely done
Deep dark red. Floral nose (violets). Blueberry, blackberry, tart cherry and high acidity. Liquorice in the finish. Still a bit rough around the edges, even when decanted +1 hr. before drinking.
A perfect Saturday wine. Good balanced. Ruby red color. Medium levels of tannins. Loads of fresh blackberries and  cherry with a touch of chocolate. Long aftertaste of cherry and  blueberry.
I suck at picking out Italian wine but this one was great. I paid $26 for it and it drank like a $40 bottle. Bold, punched notes like Miles Davis in my mouth (don't be dirty, not like that).
Black currant, soft tannins and something that goes very well when you are listening to Red Hot Chili Peppers. Berries and Love ❤️.
4.0. Medium tannin, deep color like Bordeaux blend. High alcohol, fruity, oaky, but red fruit mixed with black fruit. Overall kind of like barbera because of high cost performance.
I taste raspberry and other red fruits. Maybe a touch  of blueberry too. Fruit dances across my palette. Very nice when paired with a steak or pasta with red sauce. Tart finish, but a soft landing.
Just a touch of earth and leather on the nose but quickly gives way to nice soft cherry fruit. Beautiful wine. Fuller bodied for Barbara and lush. Barbara for a new world palate

A nice Barbera, quite sour and fresh. Easy to like and easy to enjoy. 🍷
Aromas  blueberry earthy oak sour cherry
Flavors  blueberry  blackcurrant tobacco cedar leather  sour cherry
This vintage is a killer. One of the most expressive Barbera l have ever tasted. See also my previous note 1 year ago. This beauty will stay at top conditions for at least 3-4 more years.
Pretty good Barbera that doesn't require you to break the bank. Slight oak, fruity, and spicy. Gets so much better on day 2. If you were to drink this now, decanting would help.
Black fruit, medium tannins
Nice Barbera of La Spinetta, very fruity, redberry, cherry, raspberry, acidic, proper tannins, floral, rose, easy to drink, matched very well with Italian dishes!
I really think this is great consistent wine, fantastic grip on the body, acidity there where it should be, fruit.  Very nice. A classic I do not get tired of
This is a muscular wine, with big tannins, big body and a finish that goes for miles. Not for the faint of heart. Black fruit, spices, and some cedar.

Lovely sweet cherry and vanilla nose

Bold flavours of cherry, citrus, licorice - medium bodied but a long aftertaste

A delicious wine, good body, nose and finish. Paired extremely well with my homemade pizza. I always enjoy everything this winery puts out so perhaps a slight bias here. Was a great starting point that flows nicely and everyone enjoys.

4,2 ⭐️ excellent top quality Barbera. I tried my second bottle 5 years after vintage but it should keep develop well many years. 
Red berries, fleshy fruit, well balanced oak nice acidity chewy tanins

Dark purple color in aroma and taste mixed red fruits and dark fruit notes of oak vanilla chocolate coffee tobacco earthy leather smoke tar pepper mushrooms well balanced high acidity slightly irritable tannin great wine with Italian cuisine.  🍇🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻

La Spinetta was founded in 1977 by the Rivetti family and started as a producer of Moscato d’Asti only. Their first red came in 1985 with Ca di Pian Barbera and than Barbaresco’s. 2016 vintage is aged 12 months in oak barrels. It shows a fark ruby red color with purple hues. Boisè nose at first where a vanilla hint is coming along with increasing intensity. Then opens up with dark berries and plum notes followed by officinal herbs, enamel, a bit of pepper and cedar. To the taste it’s a solid Barbera >>>

Medium ruby color. Leather, cedar, raspberry, red plum, anise, and sour cherry nose. Dry. Medium (+) acidity. Medium (+) tannins. Sour cherry, cranberry, vanilla, raspberry, violet, blackberry, cigar tobacco, chocolate, and clove. 4.0⭐️ delicious balanced sour fruit with earthy notes.

HPM! My first 🦏 Spinetta red; Barbie w/no Ken😂, she's an independent woman😉! Of course it needs air, VSpin🌀 saves the day😆. Med ruby👁, dried herbs🍂, black tart fruit & resinous tar singe the nose hairs🤣. Lip👄smacking, cheek suckin acidity balanced by the chalky tannins smooth w/air. Mulberry, early blackberries & unripe plum flavas👅. Whisper of mocha🍫 in the mid ends with some spicy black pepper on the finish🏁. $27 George Washington's💵 & needs a few yrs but classic Barbera👍. 3.8 ⭐in the now🤗.

Cranberry nose. On the palate, richer than I expected, with lots of tart red fruit but also black cherry, tobacco leaf, smoke, a touch of cinnamon. Really great, quite complex, a little mellower than most Barbera d'asti I've had. 

Definite buy again.

Vivid oak cassis fruit aromatics nose wrapped around a firm structure at first. Evolved to add leather earthy notes. Tannins feels unresolved with a dry and ginger spice end.

Drinking window: 2019-2024
Grapes: Barbera
Region: Piedmont, Italy
Vintage quality for Piedmont is excellent

It’s not my first vintage of this wine and definitely not my first Barbera, but I am always surprised how powerful Ca di Pian is for a Barbera. Rather high acidity, rather tannic, but gorgeous fruity and earthy notes, admirable structure and complexity. It should be more smooth and accessible in a couple of years, but already a very good wine.

On the nose cherry with a whiff of lavender.
On the palate blackberry, vanilla and a smooth texture with a hint of tannin in the end. 
A good wine combined with aircured ham and slightly salty olives.

Very nice barbera.  Initial taste was acidic and peppery. Letting it breathe and pairing with creamy coconut shrimp provides a full-bodied oaky wine with rounded edges.  The wine is smooth with a nice dry finish. The black pepper becomes minimal and the dark fruit flavors (plum, dried cherries) together with some earth and leather make for a great barbera.

✨ I give this wine a rating of 3.9

🌎 The origin of this wine is Italy

🍷 The color of this wine is dark red

👅 This wine has a taste palette with notes of cherry vanilla oak

📝 I tasted this wine during a dinner with friends

I’m pleasantly surprised, I must admit. Normally I don’t care much for barbera d’asti. But this one liked.  Very fragrant with tones of leather and smoke. I see that others say blackberry and plum but I didn’t get those fruity notes my self. It’s pretty bold but smooth. I drank the 2016 vintage and the tannins were nice and smooth. A very nice wine. I makes me wanna buy more barbera.

2016 vintage
Ripe and dried fruit character
Dried cherry, red currants, 
Dried roses, tar, dried oregano, white pepper, cocoa

Still really young and aggressive with a little VA. Not too much development yet but gonna be great in a few more years.

Plump and purply, first impressions are of a sweet-ish fruit bomb. But! An hour and a half in the decanter and a lovely garden of violet, lilac, spruce appear alongside the plum, blackberry and vanilla. Glad it got the extra air-time.

Lots of bright young berry fruit, blackberry, blueberry, strawberry and cherry, and some plum, it’s definitely predominantly fruit with some baking spice, a little tobacco and soil too, fresh violet as well, wine is bright with tangy acidity and light tannins, great wine actually

La Spinetta vineyard and winery began in 1960 by the Rivetti family and is still family ran and  owned to this day. This beautiful DOCG  Piedmont 100% Barbera d’ Asti is very valued for its price. Aromas of blackberry and morello cherry will hit your nose and taste.  blueberry earthy blackberry oak cherry

Deep red almost black in colour, pronounced nose of black fruit and spice. Complex, mint, leather, pepper, coffee and chocolate with damson fruit. Long finish. Quite high in alcohol and with softish tannins.

Deep Ruby
👃🏼 Smells juicy, like blackberry jam, leather, herbs, maraschino cherry, licorice
Really lovely complexity, high acidity, juicy punch of maraschino cherry, blackberry jam, licorice, pepper, earthy, leather, vanilla 
Nicely balanced
3.9

In the glass blur red dense 
On the nose wood cherries plums dark chocolate smells like a tannin bomb
On the palate coffee leather dar chocolate plums licquorice wood dry
Powerful huge body mounds of character 
Long aftertaste 
Superb quality

3.75/5 ⭐️ Very affordable 1/2 bottle modernist Piedmont with oak, broad acidity and ripe concentrated fruit. The high acidity almost feels tannic but is more under the tounge

🍷 A: clear; medium ruby

👃🏻N: clean; pronounced- intensity; aromas of oak (VA, coffee, tar, some vanilla), alcohol, red fruit (ripe cherry), blue fruit; developed

👅 P: dry; high broad acidity; medium tannin; high alc. (14.5%); medium body; medium+ flavour intensity; flavours of red fruit (cherry), oak (coffee, tar, VA); medium+ finish
Perfect Barbera. Earthy, not too fruity I would say. Lots of tannins. well balanced. some liqourice at the finnish. very well balanced

Medium viscous, defined legs, garnet core with slight brownish tint on rims.
Floral notes, licorice, oak, black fruits on a beautiful nose. Bright red fruits dominate the palate. Racy acidity and raspy tannins power the energetic medium to full muscular body. Dry and classy Barbera. Promising but give it more time.

Medium body dry Barbera. Perfectly balanced with great nose and palate. Velvety tannins. Notes of plum in nose,  notes of cherry, oak in palate with light vanilla in aftertaste. Must try Bardera especially taking into account value.

The wine is deep ruby.

It has pronounced intensity of aromas including primary aromas of rose, sour black cherry, blackberry, and dried herbs and tertiary aromas of dried cranberry and leather.

The wine is dry with medium body. It has high acid, low tannin, and high alcohol with pronounced intensity of flavors including primary flavors of black cherry, black currant, black pepper, and dried herbs, secondary flavors of cloves and smoke, and tertiary flavors of leather and tobacco. Medium finish. Very good.

Medium ruby in color with a developing medium intensity nose. Red cherry, raspberry, vanilla, sour cherry, nail polish remover, violets, floral, chocolate. Dry, high acidity, medium tannins, medium plus body, medium alcohol and medium plus intensity on the body. Sour cherry, dried herbs, raspberry, red cherry, leather, violets, blueberry, velvety mouthfeel. Outstanding quality of wine. Can drink now, suitable for further aging. 4.1 stars.

Great producer La Spinetta. Maybe prosaic to say, but I always loved their iconic etched Rhino labels too. Winery told me once the story of those but I forgot…anyone know?

Powerful fragrant bouquet of cherry mixed with blueberries and the smell of the oak which follows thru on the dense flavorful palate. 

Sexy legs on the glass and this 2016 seems properly aged and the perfect blend of fresh and mellow.
Dry, very bold, high acid
Cherries, some chocolate, really nice barbera as always from La Spinetta.
Great wine for fall! Deep berry notes after it opens up a bit
Perfect ripe. Nice roundness. Acids and black fruit still very fresh. Some coffee and earthy notes. Drink now it's at it best now
Dark cherry, spices, leather, vanilla, clove, Mountain herbs, smoked, prune, overripe raspberries, good balance, long aftertaste

84.
A very nice italian Barbera, well-bodied and with a diverse bouquet. Fruity taste, with cherries, spices and chocolate.
Recommended.

Another lovely wine from this producer 🍷.

The wine has developed beautiful taste of dark berries, chocolate, plum and elegant tone of light tobacco.

Dark purple /garnet

Silky and beautiful in the glass.

Cherry, plum and raspberry. Tar, dark chocolate and smoked meat

Really great drinking
Earthy and vanilla on the notes.  Sharp in crisp on the palette. Light tannins. Not very fruit forward. Pairs well will cured meats
Sun mature fruit, warm strawberries but not too much. Silky fine tannins. Very good already but will drink well up to ten years from now.
Wow, full bodied, big and bold. Black currant, dark plum, licorice, tobacco with a hint of earth and dried spice. Great wine!  Cheers.
Nice bottle to lead off our day of CFL Division Semi-final watching yesterday. Cherry and oak were very evident to both of us.
Leathery spice and chewy tannins good with long finish. Slightly reductive under diam cork. Much better 20 mins after pouring
Burst of fruits, red currants, berries  with hints of oak. Medium bodied with very nice palate, fine tannins with decent acidity. Limited length
Initially a bit harsh, let it open if you can! Smoke, berries, medium+ body, medium acid, very little tannin, dry yet lucious once open.
I liked this one a lot, more fruit and less earth than i normally get from Italy. Soft tannins, balanced acid. Great price point.
Took a while to breathe and open up - third sip was MUCH better than first.  This wine maker makes an AWESOME Barolo, highly recommend
Great acidity and korints and spices... it does its job with tomato sauce! There is more to it but i feel it need food for being at its best!

Red fruit and herbs. Medium and refreshing palate with good acidity/tannins balance. Lingering pleasant finish.
Very good value wine.
Strong tannins and acid moderated by unique turnip flavor on mouth followed by dark cherries, and vegetal elements. Delicious.
Beautiful wine. Harsh and very acidic initially and completely changes becoming velvety smooth after a few mins of breathing.
Dark, only indigo colour with notes of black currant, dark plum and tobacco. Continues to be a stand out, high value, Italian red.
Great wine, last night opened the second bottle and again surprised by that wine. Now 4 surprised are still waiting in my cellar.
Deep purple. Cherry chocolat with red berries a bit of spices and vanilla. Nice red WEINE with full body soft subtle tannins and long finish.
Leather, cocoa, barn, cherry, tannic and acid, probably needs to open. Good ageing potential. Not ready to be drunk. 2024-2034.
Very nice again technologival. Strawberry and plums for a nebiyolo..? Some leather on the background . Tannic with good ageing potential
Blueberry, baked cake, earth, and aromatic burnt wood on the nose. Palate is soft, a bit citrus, with mouthwatering acidity and along finish. After an hour of opening up it was very nice.
A great bottle that comes in a personal size to drink while watching the N.H. returns when you want to make sure you don’t accidentally drink an entire actual sized bottle of wine.
Good barbera. Bit young but powerful body and tannins. Plum, oak, pepper, cherry and leather. There are some notable acidity too. A complex but strong, price-performant wine :)
Drinking nicely now despite its youth , cherry , cassis, plum , blueberry and fig . some earthy notes vanilla , cedar on the finish . Great with Italian buffet . 3.9. V spot on  🎯
Very good Barbera! Dark ruby red! Good level of complexity. Red fruit, black fruit, chocolate, tobacco, cardamom, licorice. Full body, velvety, with good finish. Good, perfect with heavier pasta.
Cherry strawberry pepper leather blueberry

Dry, acidic, creamy, and strong. 
Notes of berries, oak, and dark chocolate.

cherry blueberry licorice

Interesting barbera. Went nice by itself and with a simple pizza.
2017 need more time. 2016 was excellent!!
Deep short & clean flavors of oak tabaco smoke plum cocoa vanilla
Excellent Barbera D’asti. Cherry and chocolate
Decent Barbera, very dry and long tannins
Good bright table wine. Smooth on the front end.
Very nice barbera d'asti. Raspberry, red American sweet liquorice, soft acidity, some boldness, nice on the palate with lingering flavors.
Blackberry, blueberry, black tea, tobacco licorice.
La Spinetta is always a good bet. It went well with spaguetti a carbonara. Well made
Cherry butter and ash
Great Barbera, nice acidity makes this wine balanced. Darker fruits, fullbodied.
Tons of leather. Cherry, blueberry. Initially this seemed a bit harsh, too many tertiary flavors, but it softened quickly with a bit more time.
oak blackberry blackberry chocolate
Let it breathe. Cherry and raspberry with moderate acidity. Moderate tannins and dry.
cherry earthy oak blueberry blackberry

Simple but delightful. Red currant, black currant, plum and raspberry. Easy drink.
So earthy, smoke-y, leather-y
But this. Amg wines.
A year later since last time I tried it and it’s still a panty dropper wine! Toss this out at a picnic and she will melt like butter.
La Spinetta delivers not only on site. This (not so classic) barbera is superb! Lots of flavour and good body. Truly a fine wine
Complex notes of blueberry, dried plums and wood. Refreshing acidity and ripe fruit
A bold, smooth and fruity wine. A very nice dinner wine. However, we had it at a restaurant dinner. More subtlety would have probably come out with some aeration. .

Lovey smooth and perfectly dry Barbera D’Asti from La Spinetta. I found it rather bold and fruity with subtle notes of oak and tobacco. Looking forward to trying more wines from La Spinetta. And the beautiful rhino on the label is a plus.
An earthy nose with flavors of black cherries and macerated cherries.  The finish is extra lingering and rich.
Great elegance and power. Ripe viola and old oak. Where can I buy a case? Unbeatable value for money

Italian Barbera with deep red color. A bit harsh at the beginning, but after becomes smooth.
