Poured from magnum, excellent value. Deep ruby color. Juicy flavor with dark fruit. Drinks very nice!

Very good Barbera. Nice colour and smelt, ready to drink.
Very good value for money (60,- in restaurant)
Very nice Barbera, goes well with some good Bolognese. Dry finish just and hints of  oak blueberry cherry
Intense BlackBerry a real dense and delicious Barbera.  Strong wine, not for a summer salad, more for a hearty winter stew.
High acidity, medium tannins, complex and exciting. Give it a few years and it should be even better.

Mix of red fruit and dark fruit on the nose, some earthiness, palate is medium bodied & savory, retains good acid and fine tannins. Excellent value, and a one of the best pizza wines we've come across
Big red fruit, slightly dry but not too much
Red fruit and bold

I really enjoy this Barbera superiore. Full body wine. Deep ruby colour. Red fruit, black cherry, red cherry and oak on nose. Full body. Acidity medium. Lot of tannins inside mouth. Alchocol is little bit high. Nice medium plus finish

Whole Foods wine selection is a bit lacking compared to that of Château Costco or TJ and is generally priced higher. Jeff Bezos really needs to do something about it 😎 The wine is just okay, nothing to write home about. Fairly balanced but not terribly complex.
Dark purple. Cranberry and sour cherry at nose. High acidity, light body. This one too old as well maybe? Medium high tannin. For sure lovely. @ Osteria Cotto, 압구정
Nice nose of vanilla wood, marsipan and jammy red fruit, spices. Dark red color. Medium body and acidity. Nice tannins and wood, balanced and long rich finish.
Smells of vet clinic. I love kitties and puppies so that helps. Fruity. Acidic. Rating only based if served with food. Perfect with pasta. Loses body with piave cheese
Simple wine from a producer I love. Red fruit, cedar, green, soft tannins and a long finish. Entry level juice that always delivers a great drinking pleasure.
A solid 4/5 - everything you'd expect from a barbera wine, but doesn't take your breath away :) Rusty in color, rather subdued in palate, lots of dark berries and plum.
It’s surprisingly heavy with big tannin dark color and matured notes as the label indicates:).  Cherry earthy with cacao and thick and tannic palate.

....young, but yet so tasty already now. A juicy, high quality wine with notes of ripe black cherries, blueberries, licorice and italian herbs, with a light touch of dark tobacco. Light tannis and just lovely acids, all very well aligned. I love this wine. Will for sure imrove a bit after a couple of years in the cellar but is lovely already now.

3.9 Ordered this wine at a Mediterranean Restaurant and it was an awesome pairing with Lamb Chops and Moussaka. When I first tasted this wine it was like a punch in the mouth full of dark fruit and lots of tannin and acidity. The more Olive Oil you consume, the more the oak flavor starts comes forward. Quite a tasty bold wine. Enjoyable with a meal.

Yum. Much darker, silkier fruit than expected with a good amount of oak and sturdy tannin, not much acid shining through. Not typical of a barbera, but really formidable and delicious on its own and with pasta and meat sauce. Worth the $23 for a special-ish treat.

4.0 Young and very nice Barbera
The nose has dark cherries, blueberries, earth, leather, thyme, tobacco
The taste is juicy and fruit forward, medium acidity, good integrated tannins, long taste. Very promising Barbera that is already a good glass of wine but will win with a few years in the cellar. Good thing I have 5 more 😊

Barbera has become my go to Italian red 

👁 Medium to dark ruby

👃 Tobacco, blackberry, cherry, violet, leather and vanilla

👅 Blackberry then cherry and tart raspberry followed by violet and tobacco with an acidic and astringent finish of tobacco 

🥘 Risotto diavolo and cavatelli alla sarda

Could the taste last longer. YES. It's a tasty friendly easy going. Young musk leathers. I copy those from other reviewers but agree. Light chalk fine finish. Only fault would be that I can drink it so fast. Enjoying it w a Camacho Cigar. I also grabbed its sister sane price. Eager but will wait till tomorrow. It's awesome 🤙🏼

Very powerful and savory,Strong scent of black fruit blackberry a bit of  cherry and a touch of spices  tobacco chocolate medium+to full bodied nice mouth feeling  good acidity and fine tannins.never disappoint from this winery
Good not great

Dark berries, vanilla, licorice, floral violet tones, and woody notes.
Salt licorice, slate, cherries, medium tannins, medium+ acidity. Balanced aftertaste!
Dark purple in the glass, quite some alccohol on the nose, cherries, plum, pepper and vanilla on the palate. Medium length
So delicious at a great price point. Pairs well but great alone. Bold with black fruit and red fruit galore! Drank at swag. Would love to drink again. Prov
2015 vintage. Very high acidity with a lot of tannin. Medium bodied dry wine. Blueberry, Oak, Cherry flavor. It's really fresh when you first take a sip, really attractive style
What a nice surprise this Barbera. Beautiful color, full body and dry, very elegant finish. For a moment I thought I was having a Barolo. Great value. Go for it…

In my opinion this one has typical characteristics for a good Barbera, considering acidity, dryness and body. 

 cherry oak  pepper violet  earthy
earthy red fruit tobacco chocolate coffee black cherry dark fruit truffle
Post Cabernet Franc "Rodney Dangerfield of Wine" Show a Little Respect Wine Tasting selection shared with Nat 10/19/19. Rich & fruity with lovely nose of blueberry. Crisp & sharp acidity. $28
Great Barbera!  Has the cherry and earthy notes I love from Piedmont wines.  Nice and light and paired perfectly with a light pasta dish on the couch.  I wouldn’t hesitate to buy this one again.

Blackberries mild blackcurrant in nose 
Taste mild oakness vanilla with length dark red plums  chocolate spicies. 
Try it with starter warm dades turkish yoghurt red chili 😊
Lively blackberry and plum fruit with tart acidity. Some earthiness and very light tannins.
Good nose, dark ruby, pepper, red fruity, acidic, earthy, good finish.  First taste was jammy.
Smooth and dry with notes of oak and plum
Taste of mixed berries, notes of pepper and hints of licorice. In total a very positive experience
Dried red fruit, cherry, raspberries, red currant, licorice, smoke, tar, earthy, tobacco, pepper, and oak. Very big tannins, very dry, I would age for 5-10 years before open.
Super vin easy drinking.
Mouth filling delicious flavors of dark ripe summer berries and plums, wild thyme and fennel, beautifully balanced fruit and structure. An elegant rendering of the Barbera grape.

As having an old friend for dinner. 
Always fun and interesting with few surprises
Wet soil, red fruit and oak/leather. Good value I must say. On the short side however
A decent Barbera but a bit to much fruit flavor for my taste, however if you prefer it..gogogo

Ruby red beauty, with dried cherry, plum, cedar and floral nose.
Medium to high acid, cherries, black tea, pepper, leather, grippy tannins, Long finish.
La Spinetta is always good!
Quite acidic. Lots of fruit. Worked well with a creamy pasta dish.
cherry oak blackberry blueberry chocolate vanilla plum
Great value barbera, tasted at La Spinetta in Barolo
An honest, dry, direct and tasty Barbera. It reflect the tradition of Piedmont. Dry with a balsamic, spicy zesty touch on the nose, smooth and fruity on the palate within a great balsamic after taste
Cherry, tobacco, leather, really great balance, not super complex but a great all-around Barbera!

Nice full bodied red. 
M/m+ acidity
 cherry oak blackberry earthy leather chocolate plum tobacco licorice red fruit cedar 
Complex and chewie.
Pair with grill meat.
Great timming.
Very nice, good performance $$
Typical Barbera, nicely done
Junior spinetta. Great dinner wine with pasta
Dry, medium tannins, earthy nut not dirty
Excellent Barbera - very fruit forward, dry, medium tannic/acidic, heavy flavors of cherry, raspberry, and blackberry, with a lingering finish
A very "serious" Barbera. Almost certainly aged for a few years in oak. It's a nice, drinkable, flexible wine, but there's nothing about it that screams (or even whispers) Barbera!
Amature very nice wine with lots of dark fruits. Very pleasant.
Excellent. Smooth with rich ruby fruit.
earthy cherry notes with hints of chocolate.
Fresh and easy going Barbera. Lot of fruity flavors of red berries.
Same as prior.
Very well balanced, dark cherry, prune notes, mild acid, earthy notes lasting
Tasty Barbera. More subtle and reserved than some of its younger peers. Dark fruit and oak come through most strongly. Very smooth body, with elegance triumphing over brashness
La Spinetta wines are excellent and this is no exception. This is hearty but remains smooth and luxurious to the palette. Top shelf.
La Spinnetta never disapoints. Not this time either. This is one classy Barbera!
Nice Barbera, good depth, spicy and fruity, couple more years will make it even better
100,000 bottles. Blended from many blocs, but lots of complexity not just acid. Cherry really comes through. Barbers dAasti better than Barbers d'alba. In Alba best exposure goes to ne biolo.
Black fruit, oaky, full bodied, medium tannins.

3,9.
It was good, not the best Barbera
Absolutely fantastic wine, great vintage.
Blackberry incl oak and hints of coffee. Amazing value!
Dry with high acidity, earthy, wet hay, slight barnyard, blackberry, tart cherry.
Strong berries on nose. Deep color. Fruity but some earth too.
Happy hour at Tapas inside San Diego Liberty Station.  Plums, blueberries, some tart cherry and minimal acids unlike the Amador California Barberas that I recently experienced.
Yummy, high acidity and sharp tannins.
Almost as good as 2014!
Really balanced, black fruit, good acid, earthy, long finish.
The nose is deep and  rich.  Redolent of stewed black currant and hints of Cinnamon and new leather. The palate delivers more of he sane with fine grain tannins and a long finish.
Red cherry and dark fruit combined well with this quaffable barbera…delicious
4+ very well made Barbera d’Asti. Good tannic grip. Fruit evidently healthy.
Almost a reliable wine to order (esp in a premium marked up restaurant).  Flexible in pairings and open beautifully through main course. Good balance and friendly flexibility on food pairing,
Very tasty and drinkable with some cherry and spicy flavors. Mellow with low tannins and somewhat acidic. Great value and pairs with hard cheese, charcuterie and pizza. Bene
Nice Barbera wine from very good producer. It is balanced, with very refreshing accidity, medium bodied and pairing perfectly with many kinds of dishes. At its best after 30-40 minutes.

Fresh and fruity, good acidity, cherry, plum, chocolate, a little bit hot in alcohol
89p
A big fan of the Gallina Barbera. This one falls a bit short but also comes in at half the price. A decent wine. Need to get my hands on the rest of their collection! 3.7
Very enjoyable
Not bad
cherry raspberry
Complex floral  scents and tanning

14.5% alcohol and it is prominent on the nose. Deep plum color with great legs. Smell of red fruits like sour cherry. Plum. No bitter bite. Med tannins, med finish with a lingering presents of great wine  caprice salad and warm Fresh bread.
Had this one a few times.   It’s nice.    earthy with dark cherry and blueberry.     oak and soft tobacco notes.
Fruity, blackberries, oak, cherries, long finish. Nice! We tried with vintage 2014 and it’s more complex.

Nice fruity scent. Full body.  Very Dry and smooth but too acidic and high on tannin. 
1,360@ ITALASIA

Full-mouthed and sweet Barbera. Bit of alcoholic punch but still not too much with a good balance. Lovely Barbera overall!
Had w/ Mike, Kelly, & Colleen in Jackson Hole. Lots of blackberry. Really drinkable. Everyone loved it.
The label has a rhino on it and the wine is as dry as a rhinos hyde in summer. Treats you very well
Fruity, little acidish with a nice leather smell.
Tasty, little spice, great to food
Plenty of mixed young berries, licorice, violet, dark chocolate and tea leaves. Rounded tannins and moderate acidity. Uncomplicated but it’s a pretty enjoyable fruity wine.
good italian table wine - nothing fancy but really solid.
La Spinetta is a vineyard I've been visiting several times. Yet just medium intensity aroma of black cherry, blackberry, herbs and pepper, the complexity in general gives good quality.
deep, dark berry and blueberry notes, with a smoky texture, perhaps even gunpowder. quite dry, and packed with flavor. short, pleasant finish. overall, a complex and well-rounded Barbera.
Dry, needs to decant.

Overall a pretty good drinking wine. Tannin was pretty smooth now, but with a few more years cellaring I am sure it will get optimum. Typical Italian nose of ethanol, pretty well balanced on the palate.

Very beautifully structured wine...Full body,quite concentrated,velvety tannins and a long powerful kick on the finish!In the nose the fruit is tense  blackberries,blueberries,cherry tart with the palate being very balanced...Very nice!

Dry, medium bodied, dark ruby red to purple.  My third wine in the region - I am sitting in a restaurant in Barolo...  Why not Barolo?  It's coming soon!  Interesting that there is no touristic atmosphere here; lie key

4.2 - This is the kind of wine you buy by the case. It’s interesting, dependably delicious and opens up well in 30 minutes or less. Vivino claims that Barbera is the varietal of the Italian “working class”. If that‘s true, the upper crust is really missing out. Rich aromas of blueberry, plum, raspberry and lavender. Medium body, 14% ABV and medium+ acidity. On the palate: cherry, blackberry, blueberry, cocoa and truffle. This wine just sits really well on the tongue—highly recommend.

Drank this last year and gave it 3.5

This year it has matured. Much the same but it has settled, the nuances are more harmonious and its not quite so fruit forward. A very rounded effort. Went well with our Piemontese lunch, particularly with the vitello tonato. A match made in heaven!

Then followed up the evening with back to back Barberas last night, one from Asti and one from Alba. La Spinetta is an awesome producer and this wine was well balanced, had bigger tannins and more complex flavours and aromas.

3.9pts.
La Spinetta
Ca'di Pian Barbera d'Asti 2014.
Ruby red colour with purple hue.
Rich concentration and flavorful fruits.
Bright acidity, smooth texture and harmonious.
Aroma from violet, cherry, blackberry, blueberry, plum, chocolate, licorice and  earthy.
Medium body, with wonderful fruit of cherry, strawberry, a-bit if smoke makes it interesting and really easy to drink . Having post thanksgiving at an impromptu dinner at lovely bistro in Gloucester.

Very fun vintage to crack at 10yrs old. Very clean and easy drinking but shows complexity. A pretty dark cherry color. Nose is plentiful with a red fruit forward approach with red licorice and sweet tobacco undertones. Medium tannins, medium to low body. Clean, velvety mouth feel with plum and red delicious apple on the clean, subtle finish. I’d seek this one out again.

Yammy fruits and quite persistent alcohol. Once passed that very well integrated tannins and very fine herbs come through. Mid-palette is moderate but refined in bouquet. I liked it a lot, but had higher expectations perhaps (2014?)

Wonderful Barbera d asti!(4,2 is it’s fair grade). Perfectly matured all these years(vintage 2007) it is ready now to offer all its beauties. Intensive aromas of black and red fruits, cedar(usual at good Italian wines), tobacco, some chocolate and vanilla, liquorice, pepper, oak hints, overrun your palate at this high acidity wine. Good structure, well balanced, medium body and medium- long aftertaste sensation. I tried this with roasted duck and it was perfect. Highly recommended!

Tasted twice in a day, once during lunch, with bottle already opened for sometime and the second bottle just popped. 100% used barrel, the fresh bottle has a more intense nose of incense, eucalyptus, smoke, oak and vanilla, tighter in the mouth with tannin slightly more pronounced, great QPR for this beautiful Barbera.

The first red of the evening was way better then the white before. The last bottle of this wine in my closet performed even better then some months ago. Beautiful almost purple dark red colour and the smell was delicious: cherry and some leather. Almost chocolate sweet taste combined with a full body gives this wine a great price/quality. Really a must try wine..

Red fruit, bold and dense, autumn forrest, blackberries, pepper,  tobacco and roasted coffee.
A developed palate, round and tight, plenty on nice silky tannins and a tart nice bitterness like from cherry pits and grapefruit in the finish. Excellent cellaring result proof of quality for this inexpensive wine.

A superb nose of fresh picked cherry with vanilla  spice and black pepper cardamon and distant tobacco.  Following a period of breathing the wine emerged with fantastic red current  and black cherry flavours with Madagascan vanilla hints of black pepper and a hint of bitter chocolate.

Yes I was seated at table 3 😉 Surprising fine wine. A touch too high on the acidity though it is compensated with a sparkle on the first encounter with the tongue and combined with lovely ripe dark cherries and Forrest fruit. It also has some oak coming through but it is not dominant. The elegant texture and soft tannins as well as its freshness makes this a great enjoyable wine.

This is a wine that needs a lot of years to get mature. Fruity on the scent to berries and cherry. Very dry on the tasting. Very complex wine but I seriously advice to buy bottles from previous years.

Ca' Di Pian shows rich ruby red with purple reflections, a very dense bouquet with scents of cherry, plum and fig. Floral of violets, some light spice and chocolate. Fresh and fruity, the acidity is balanced by generous alcohol and mild tannins.

Very elegant Barbera. Maybe the age gives her a complexity rather than the harshness of hers younger siblings? Nose full of licorice, blackberry and touch of cherry. The taste is still juicy, but not flamboyant as other Barberas. Plum, raisins, oak and some pepper tones in the mouth. Nicely rounded tannins and almost a chocolate finish. Nice.

The basic barbera from this House. But to me there  is nothing basic about this great Barbera. Deeply colored layered and complex with loads of black fruits. Acidity is very balanced. The wine has a lot of dry stuff feeling to it. Will age very well.

Bit heavy thus fruity Barbera from La Spinetta. These grapes grow in Asti and clearly they are bit more heavier than the ones from Langhe (south from Alba). This is really good barbera, fruity and full bodied. Few more years is the cellar will not do bad, vice versa.

Violently purple in the glass, this wine smells of dark chocolate covered coffee beans, fennel seeds and black liquorice, black plums, black cherries, blueberries, balsam, fig Newtons, Cuban cigars, leather watchband, a touch of musty cabin or old sawmill. The dark fruits are flashing some prune and black raisin underneath the oak. I find the palate more balanced than the nose.

I love Spinietta wines! This one is of the more basic Barbera’s they have, but that’s still high quality in my opinion. Deep red coloured, with a scent of dried Strawberries. It has plenty of acidity, but the fruity aftertaste makes it a very nice experience.

Nicely aged, still burgundy- bright red. Decanted for 1 hour. Smooth tannins. Acidic and dry, with fantastic full texture. A little cassis, a little oak and earth. 
100% Barbera, from 25-30 year old vines. 12 months aged in oak, the. Transferee to stainless steel for 6 months before bottling!!

Somehow, somewhere I managed to acquire half a dozen of these and drank most young. Somehow missed this one in the cellar and I’m glad I did! Contrary to most barbera I’ve tried which is best consumed early, this has certainly developed well with time. Inky, almost black colour. Blackcurrant fruit pastilles, black cherry, liquorice root, coffee, tobacco, violet, bright acid for age, silky tannins. Best barbera I’ve had!

Black with glowing garnet hues. Deep seated aromas of dark cherries, blackberries, cloves, leafy vegetation, violets and a nice whiff of tarr and earth. The palate is full bodied, rich and lively: charged with juicy sour cherries, dried strawberry and kallamatta olives and with a slate-like minerality and bitter cacao. It is finishes long and savory with a relentless drive of brooding fruit with a sour twang. Premium Barbera is something else entirely: both juicy and dry: incredibly moreish. 4.2

Packed with dark spicy fruit and loads of intriguing earth and forest floor. If you like it deep and earthy this gem is for you. Rich mouth feel, soft tannins that could use another year or two to really soften and let it really express itself. Good wine.

A ruby red with a beautiful nose. I can't quite put my finger on a distinct aroma I'm getting beyond the fruity. The tannins are welcome, just there to make their presence known but not at all intrusive or aggressive. I still chuckle, that this grape in Northern Italy is seen as the working man's wine. I love the Barbera tastings I've had to date.

Nose is garlic and anchovies and thyme, which may be either in glass or on my hands. Structured and tannic. Will hold up well. Legs are lingering and long. Full body. A bit of a hot finish but at 14% Abv you wouldn't expect it. Let it open its nice.

Very smooth and Nice wine with a rich fruity nose like plum and black currant and a little stable and earthy.
The palate focuses fruity and Fresh with blue berry soft tannin with a little pepper and vanilla. Drink now.

A lovely wine enjoyed with a top notch pizza at a Copenhagen restaurant. Less fruit driven as mostly seen and quite robust in tannins. I would keep it in the cellar for another couple of years (or rather: longer than that). 
Some wines just speak to you and convinces you of their class although they don't really show it. This is one of those wines.
Would love to taste this in five years time, I'm sure there are 4.5 or even 5 stars hidden here...

The 05 Ca di Pian is singing right now.

The nose is of the highest calibre - rich, complex with nuances of anise and slightly sweet dried black berries. Rustic elegance. 

The smooth mouthfeel is backed by layers of cherries and dark fruits, followed a dry hint on the back palate. It ends long, fruity  and a touch dry. 

I had wine a few times in previous years and I was never impressed. But this bottle changed it all. Like Braida's barberas, La Spinetta's drops benefit greatly from proper cellaring. 8/10
Earthy and oaky with some spicy notes on top of dark cherry and plum. Great wine, though still a bit young with medium high tannins.
Blue. Berry. Crush.
Fruity, spicy, dark fruit flavours
Great producers. Decent value.

Pours a very dark red color. Somewhat tannic and harsh. This is a wine that needs to be paired with a hearty meal. Some of that harshness softens with said meal. This is not a wine to have without food.

Modern style of Barbera with maturation in barrique. Still maintains classic Barbera characteristics with high acidity but it is balanced very well. Maybe a bit predictable. Best with red meats rather than pizza and pasta. Solid.

Truly wine of the people! 

Medium ruby colour
Medium intensity aromas and flavours of lavender, violet, morello cherry, red plum, blackberry, clove, anise, dried leave, a bit herbaceous 

Super dry, medium (-) body, high acidity, medium (-) tannin, medium (+) finish

Good to very good wine
Blackberry, plum, a bit of cherry, on the dry side

2018 vintage
Color is medium ruby 
Nose has Raspberry, chocolate, eucalyptus, and pencil lead.
Palate has cherry, wild berries. Some nice vanilla and bitter blackberries. 
Good QPR good weekday wine. 
91 points.

Very good. Rarely enjoyed casual wine with Dark fruit. new leather, tree bark, smoke, cocoa, soft but firm. Lovely bouquet reminds me Malbec but to me just more going on, less inky. At Ferraro kitchen with Andrea and Jeff

Enjoyable Barbera!
Cherries, dark fruit, oak, and spices.

Dark ruby red color. Dark cherry, light licorice flavor with a sweet, rich and lasting finish. Though still easy, but a good d’Asti from the beautiful hills close to one of my favorite places to stay in Italy.
68 degrees bottle

4.3 I finally tried this one and it blew me away! Complex, balanced and drinkable.

👀 Deep ruby

👃🏼 Beautiful nose of ripe black cherry and smoke-y sweet tobacco dominate with hints of nutmeg and vanilla creating notes of espresso. 

👅 Initially bright notes of blackberry, plum and vanilla with hints of cherry, then smooth decedent chocolate with hints of baking spices such as cloves. Chocolate-y long finish. Full bodied and dry with medium rough tannins and medium + acidity. 

Buy this wine!

I just love this winery - all their wines are divine. Lots of tannins in this one and clearly worthy of the DOCG rating with superiore status. Taste of oak, cherry, blackberry and in general earthy flavors. Quite a heavy wine though so probably better to pair with some great Italian food than simply enjoying as such.

👀 very dark blood red, deep and opaque
👃🏻 cherry black and red, plum, wood notes like tobacco and a touch of spice but all in a positive way - I like the nose. 
later also black tea and leather, after reading the tasting notes I also recognize the chocolate 
👅 even better than I was anticipating from the nose - smooth and round, fruit but not sweet

Excellent Barbera from an excellent producer!
Great depth and complexity (on each of their wines I’d say).
Intense clean ruby red color.
Intense bouquet with red fruit, violet, earthy, dark fruit, spices, oaky.
Medium to full body, important tannins for a still smooth texture.
In the palate notes of cherry, plum, licorice, truffle, tar, tobacco and cedar.
Long finish on the spices, super!

4.2

Deep purple. Very dry, peppery, with good acidity. After taste in line.
Beautiful barbera!
Dry and somewhat tight right after opening but opens up A lot. Screams hot summer day in Italy.  Leather berries. Tannins really delicious if you want a big dry euro style red
Excellent. Best Barbera d’Asti I’ve had.
Sweet liquorice, plum, cinnamon. Great stuff!

Best Barbera I´ve had, but it´s true to say that it´s unusual full and complex for a Barbera. Normally I don´t like "heavy" wines but this was still within balance with great nose of "Karlssons Klister" :-)

Really comes alive after its had some time to settle down.  Intense aromas of black cherries, blueberries, and nutty oak on the nose.  Very refreshing on the palate, medium body, supple, concentrated and dry.  Ripe fruit flavors are met with perfectly balanced levels of acidity and tannins.  The finish lingers, with underlining notes of menthol and tobacco.  A really enjoyable Barbera, paired up well with soft cheese.
Not as good as I remembered it (2015 vintage) but still a pretty decent and food-friendly wine. There is a funky or bitter note that I don’t fully appreciate.
In the first sip, I noticed it was not best time to open. Totally out of balance. Yesterday, 4 days after the open, quality changed into quite good to drink.

blackberry blueberry cherry red plum oak

Very nice Barbera from 2007, a bit too old though but still a pleasure
Spinetta and CW are good friends 😁 Not a bad combination 😉. It is one of the better 2013 Barberas. 90p
Bright color. Green peppers and  little leather on the nose. Nice acidity and lingering tannins on the palate.

Great Barbera!
Aromas of wood, wild herbs and flowers, nice balanced. 
Very long and pleasant finish. 
4.0☆
Strong fruit- blackberry, cherry and other sour berries. Menthol finish. medium+ acidity. Needed some air.
Wow... Very full bodied, but due to the acids still balanced. Amazingly lingering. Spicey, tabacco, minerals.
This is still delicious after 7 years , let it open up and it will surprise you, really delicious round complete wine
This was good I would definitely drink this again. a little Barnyard e would go really well with game

Full on the nose with spicy tannins a dry sharp finish.
Classy Barberra with flovours of cherry and amaretto.
Much better than your average Barbera. Dark cherry, vanilla and just the right amount of bite at the end.

blueberry, blackberry, vanilla, oak, leather, pepper, licorice, plum.
impressive wine. well balanced.
Full bodied and earthy Barbera. Unripe cherries, blackberries and plum. Hints of mocha and vanilla. High quality wine.
Great full bodied wine with hints of berries. Definitely try, but don’t order at a restaurant ;) Not Worth the up charge
Blackberry, blueberry, plum, deep red fruits, vanilla. Medium+ bodied, acidity, tannins, dry. Excellent.

Red berry with some floral hints and mixed with sweet spice. On the palate, high acidity with also high tannins but not raw, still it can become smoother with time I can feel. The body is filled with red fruit body and supported by the tannin structure, giving you a sunny impression.
Berry, dried fruit, pepper, jam, and acidity
4.0 easy to drink and well balanced wine
Bold tannins plus oak but structure does not overwhelm fruit  flavor
Love me some Barbera and this one doesn’t disappoint. Great drinkability. Earthy, slight fruit.
I really like this one. Super interesting nose, very medicinal and herbal (licorice, mint, thyme), candied red berries, barnyard and leather. Great value. I
Medium tannins across from start to finish.
Nose: cherry black licorice cracked pepper mouth: slight acid and tannin. Paired with: lamb, cous cous, and herbed mushrooms
3.7 solid cherry and earthy tannic backbone plenty of pepper leather and bramble but nothing too extraordinary or offensive
Spicy and mouth-filling, great with Italian dishes. La Spinetta does not disappoint, look for the rhino on the label.
Medium-bodied. Dry. Medium tannins. Dark fruit, plum, cherry, chocolate and leather notes. Balanced and elegant.
Really nice cherry flavours as well as oak and vanilla
Tannic, Woody and lots f dark cherries. Needs some time to develop then leather, tobacco and nutmeg flavors evolve.
Smooth, bold, dry, soft. Slightly acidic tops. Goes exceptionally well with parmesan and I can't wait to try it with licorice 😍
Nope, this renowed Italian failed the quality test. Too linear, without anything that distinguishes this 2016 from other Barbera's.
Great red that makes you very curious about the better la spinetta wines. Excellent value for money.

Very impressed, tasted three months ago, it had special tones with some herbs , maybe thyme, and a forest-like association like labrador tea perhaps. No vanilla oak that many bordeaux can have, but a more fresher and interesting taste.

4.3. This wine is a absolute gem. Crazy good value and one of the best (if not the best) barbera’s I’ve had at the price. Intense but with finesse and great structural balance. Complexity is here too. Yummm.

Lovely, complex and wonderful on a summer night with a light dinner. Complex aromas of red cherries, vanilla, mushrooms and leather. Really wonderful mellow tannins, high acidity and a long finish. Bolder than expected but still very elegant.

Dark purple in color. On the nose it's as if I am swimming on the inside of an oak barrel in a dark fruit plum pool. More tannic than acidic but not enough more to be out of balance. Seriously I could drink this all night... through tomorrow... and the next day. Please don't take my juice. So yummy...

🍷 Barbera d’Asti DOCG from the Piemonte region, Italy 🇮🇹
 
🍇 100% Barbera grapes with calcareous soil (terroir), aged partly new and used medium toasted French oak for 12months.
👀 Ruby red with purple hi-lights.

👃🏻  Aromas of cherry, plum and berry fruit with herbal notes.

👅 Full body and intense with balanced tannins and bright acidity.

🍽  Appetizers and soft cheeses as well as pasta dishes
Chocolate, Oak, Tobacco, Baking Spices. Great off the nose and does well is drunk immediately.

La Spinetta is doing a great job-  I would try anything from them i could!  This Barberra is no exception!  For under $25 to have a wine this nice is a treat. Dry yet smooth, but still a bold wine. The reasonable price point earns it another half a star in my rating. 

I did have this as a part of a tasting, but I bet it would be even better with food.
3.5+. Nose is typical barbera, dark cherries, pepper, oak, bit complex. Palate is pretty smooth, had expected bigger body, bit grippy tannins. Got some sage, cacao, plums. Needs food imo.

Not a big Barbera fan but this sang to me. Textbook acidity combined with juicy tannins with fruits that were mostly black. There's some oak lingering in the background which made for a nicely balanced wine. My first taste of La Spinetta.

3.75. Smoke, meat and ripe plum  on onset turn to black cherry on nose. Loads of tart cherry that are somewhat dry, reminiscing of tea leaves on palate.  Nice Barbara from La Spinetta, just not worthy of superlatives.

Decent Barbera d'Asti which offers very good value for money.  Quite deep ruby, it has a classically Italian nose with lots of sour cherry, savoury notes and herbs.  The palate is earthy, red cherry, black fruit and forest floor, tannins medium(+), acidity high.  Plum, tea, well-judged oak.  Less rustic than most Barbera at this price, smooth, fruity, juicy.  Really enjoyed it.  3.5*+.

The aromas consist of matured dark berries; blackberries, blackcurrants with hints of herbs and slight caramel. The palate is tight with an overall spicy, yet rounded expression. Plums, cherries, blackberries with an earthy layer. The Italian "temper" is felt throughout. Worth its weight in wine, but it isn't a bargain per say.

Just love the Rhino on the label! Ruby red with blue and black fruit aromas and woodsy spices. The palate focuses on the fruit and shows plum and cherry flavors with some oak and spice. Vivid acidity, smooth tannins and mineral hits on the medium finish.
very nice barbera, a little young that packs a punch, but yet nice and enjoyable. vanilla and smoky flavors huge body long finish.

Bright ruby red color with wonderful aromas of red fruits like cherry and raspberry and hint of tobacco on the nose. Medium-to-full-bodied and follows by very delicious flavors of pomegranate, dried cranberry, mocha, and sweet spice on the palate. Dry and fresh taste, very good balance of acidity, soft & solid tannins, savoury mouthfeel, and nice medium length on the finish. Very good value for money; and it suddenly has become my most favorite Barbera D'Asti.

Not sure if this wine is past its peak or if it just entered a next stage of maturity. A: morel based rum-topf and loads of leather. T: leather, horse dung,  tobacco, chocolate. Great acidity, alcohol, richness balance. Super pleasant to drink. Long aftertaste. Still it’s something about the aroma and the slightly flattened ending that say “drink now” to me! The harmonious seekers out there may be reverent, but for my taste this has takes one small step towards the end. Drink now. 92/93p

The 2014 BdA is a dark ruby colored balanced wine. This one is dessicated. Dried fruit prune and raisin dominate. Not sure if this has already peaked. Reminded me of an Amarone. But wow is it good. Really nice round balance to the dried fruit.

Founded in 1977 by Guiseppe and Lidia Rivetti. Now run by the three sons, Carlo, Bruno and Giorgio. This wine was first made in 1985. 🍇 Barbera. Aged 12 mos in French oak. Deep ruby colour. Aromas of toasted oak, plums, blackberries, blueberries, spices and violets. On the palate toasted oak, plums, blackberries, black currants, blueberries, spices and coffee ☕. A dry, fruity, spicy and complex Barbera from Piedmont. A med+ body with med+ tannins.  A med+ acidity and med+ 🏁. With sausage Stroganov. 3.7 🌟

Quite intense, tight, and oaky. A bit atypical barbera with deep concentration, rustic tannins and quite heavy oakiness. Less acid and tannins than nebbiolo, but more concetration due to long maceration.

the Caˊdi Pian Barbera is first red wine of la Spinetta in 1985

sourced from 27~32 yrs old vines on calcareous soil
fermented 6~7 days, MLF in oaks, aged 12 mths in partly new french oaks, another 6 mths in steel vats

14% AbV

P&P; Bˊdx Tumbler used; deep plum hue w/violet rim; very alc. + volatile acid. on entry, along w/floral iris, sage like spiced mulberry/sweet cherry + mineral slate & herbal edge
an overly extracted red w/volatile mouthfeel, herbally dry yet chalky tannins

not my type of Barbera...

the wine is clear and filtered. It is star bright. Its dark ruby with purple highlights, almost inky. there is sign of aging in the bottle by the different color between core and the ring. The viscosity is medium high (14%). On the nose notes of black cherry, violet, raspberry. Earthiness, leather. The palate confirms the nose with high acidity medium low tannins , some oak (30-50-% new). Medium body , a very good barbera .

Barbera tasting: Alba vs Asti #4/6
I have no luck with Spinetta recently. My guru said this may be a faulty bottle. Fermented with rotary for a week, aged in barriques partially new for 12 months. 14.0% abv.

Med ruby. Raspberries, black pepper, cloves & humus. Dry, high acidity, med tannin, robust structure but lacks good fruits flavor from the middle palate. I tasted a different vintage of this cuvée, which was totally different. 2014 was a difficult vintage.

Needed a few swirls in the glass to air out the alcohol notes. However, once that was out of the way you'll be swayed by deep, lush, dark fruits. Hints of tobacco if you wait for it. If not, you're mouth is simply welcomed by a juicy fruit extravaganza. Serve lightly chilled and this will hit home with 99% of all balconies, terraces and backyards in Denmark when firing up the BBQ this summer. It also drinks well in its own or with light meaty tapas which we had.

Blind taste tested a second half bottle of wine tonight. Oddly enough it was another Barbera de Asti !

Completely different then the last one. Deep/dry prunes & raisins, 1000% old world that showed some age. Dark berries dominate with elements of cassis and leather. My guess was Amarone. 

Appeared to be a bit past it’s peak as it was an old half bottle. Very disappointed in this one after the nice Barbera I just had. 3.1 stars due to the past it’s peak.

Lovely Asti I don’ t think it should play second fiddle to the Nebbiolo 
This has great fruit, albeit dried with a bit of earthy nose.  Smooth tannin and dry on the tongue slight acidity to it. Accompanied our phenomenal meal at Osteria Langhe in Chicago

3.75. In the top Barberas I have tasted to date. Nose and palate very rich, very substantial will lovely chocolaty notes plus light leather over the dark cooked fruits. Tanins clearly better than in most Barberas but still with a little weakness

Still vibrant colour even though it’s 9 yo. Aromas are from the verge of red fruit and black fruit. Smoky, leathery notes but slightly dried fruit comes forward. It’s not a typical Barbera - tannins are quite high. So in a way it’s special however I find it overwhelming

A bright red color towards the edge violet reflexes this Barbera is taking presence in the glass - the bouquet lovely aromas of plum, cherry and juniper berry floating on notes of toasted wood, mocha and malt - in the mouth complex smooth, tight and juicy with a harmonic structure...

Decanted - still very unbalanced alcohol distinctive Undeveloped tannins
Quality indicates, understanding and knowing to producer, that the wine will improve but at the moment the -12 seems very unruly..
I have an increasingly strong feeling that the 2012 is to jammy all over the line. This is what JR wrote:
In Piedmonte 10% down on 2011, with intense heat meaning that the cooler vineyard sites may turn out to have produced the best wines, with some sunburn affecting the most exposed sites.

This has straight forward nose of balsamic, sour cherry and warm herbs. On the palate is a bit better (initially), quite rich w high acidity and balance but getting heavy as the oak kicking in. Short - Med length.

3.6 🌟! I really do enjoy wines from La Spinetta! This Barbera was delicious. Notes of blackberry, prune, sour cherry on the nose. The palate was medium bodied with some decent alcohol behind it. Black pepper, licorice, and cherry dominates the palate. Spicy acidity that actually overwhelmed the palate for me a bit. Well put together wine but I wasn’t overly feeling this one. 🍷🍷

3.7 much better turn out than previously with some age.  Rounds off some of the rougher edges.  Still has good acidity, just no longer rough.  I have often found that I prefer Barbera with at least 5 years of age

dark ruby • dried black cherries, strawberry, anise, herbs • high acidity, very prominent oak tannins, 14% ABV • made from sustainably farmed 100% Barbera aged in party new French oak barrels for 12 months

💯% Barbera d'Asti from a great producer; 12 months in French oak, another 12 months in steel tanks. Ripe dark fruit, plum, peppery spices, black olives, chocolate/tobacco, some roses in the open nose. Good body, full and juicy. Present acidity balances the concentrated fruit, grainy tannins. Dry, berry finish. More power than elegance. This one just seems to be produced to pair with spicy Italian pasta! Drink now.

Nice, not worth the price in my opinion. Especially from this wine maker. Very dark color. Dark fruit on nose with blueberry and no dry fruit. Juicy palate makes up for the dry, heavy tannins. Try it in a couple more years?

At Factory Kitchen in LA sharing this 2013 DOCG Barbera D’Asti. Deep deep purple, velvety, and well balanced. Notes of dark cherries, prunes, and licorice followed by a perfect tannins level and notable but appropriate acidity. A really good wine

This is a pretty big Barbera. Dark bluish red, it Opens up with young, dark cherries, pepper tones, good fruit balanced with fresh acidity and holds its length and finish structured by balanced tannins. Could hold for still a few a more years.

A halfie!  Although bit long in the tooth for a Barbera, it still tastes delicious.  I think it is my favorite Italian red grape. 
Meek nose of plums and bark.
Bright acidity still present with black tea, spices, blackberry and raspberry flavours. Tannins still present to give it nice balance.

An incredible example of a good Barbera with loots of red fruits , high acidity, mineral and yet you get tones of spiceness, cigar taste comes at after taste..  quite an "adult" personality on the wine as if it's just a grown up person but still childish... 👌🏻

Vegetal on the nose, with fall leaves and leather dominating. Christmas spice and ethenol in the background. Not very fruit forward at all.

Palate plays host to varied levels of oak. Black currant, dried fruit and pepper play a supporting role. Acid, tannins, and sweetness are well balanced.

The finish is tannic, and musky but short.

Overall, a nice, focused wine drinking well now. An approachable representative of Barbera.

Nice, complex flavours and jammy plum. Also a big hit of chocolate. Low+/medium- body, eminently drinkable

Pale Ruby
Pronounced nose with raspberry, cherry, black cherry, licorice, black pepper, wet leaves, rose

Dry, high acidity, medium body, medium minus tannins. Cranberry presents on the palate along with aromas above

Medium length

3.7

Good wine with lovely rich fruity and earthy aromas, with a solid structure. needs greater fruit intensity on the palate to be considered higher quality.
Pale ruby colour. M intensity on nose. Red cherry cranberry earthy gravel grass. Dry M intensity on palate. H acidity low fine grained chalky tannins m alcohol 13% m body m finish.

Cru Bojo from a magnum! I didn’t dislike the wine by any means, but I feel like a lot of beaujolais is really honing in on being a touch “too natty”. It was all sour cherry, tart and extremely sour raspberry, tart pomegranate, touch of funky earth. Acid was piercing in a way that almost gives you heartburn lol. Palate was tart and funky and finish was long. Not bad, but not my style!

Light, fruity and crisp natural Beaujolais. Dusty red with strongly perfumed nose full of red fruit - raspberry, sour cherry, cranberry.

Light bodied with very refreshing & juicy acidity. A feel of herbs and white pepper on the palate. Long finish. Nice to have slightly chilled in the summer. Had the 2018 vintage.

3.75 - This opened with a fantastic, pronounced nose of fresh cherry, field berries and a smear of barnyard dirt. The flavours were bright and fresh, mostly offering bright cherry, but some savoury mushroom and minerals. A moderate finish of field berries and earth.

Very delicious Brouilly from ~60 year old vines. For me, this is ‘natural winemaking’ in perfection. No ‘funk’ whatsoever, but simply a pure expression of the region. Cherry and raspberries, bit of spice, good balance of acidity and fruit. Goes down easily but also lingers in your mouth and keeps you analyzing the flavors for quite some time. Better on day one than the next day though. So drink fast.
Reasonable quality beajoulais, serve slightly chilled with soft cheeses
Easy to drink. Enjoyable.
Great AW wine with energy. Kicks you up
Easy going, light and crisp.
Good start of the week with this Brouilly from Lapalu. Well-made gamay without getting too overpowering. Violet, juniper , minor oak tones. Drinks well now. Have it with your cheese.

Served to me blind by our Somm who wanted to have fun on the job and test my blind tasting skills. Pale ruby hues. Fragrant perfume of garden roses, violets, raspberry, candied cherries, was that bubblegum? Medium (-) body, modest tannins, medium acidity and finish. Easy drinking sipper. I guessed the grape as Gamay and the bottle as 2016 Beaujolais Cru...maybe a Fleurie? I think I passed!

Brouilly is one of the cru of Beaujolais (the legend says that name comes from Roman soldier called Brulius). Intense notes of fresh red fruits and earthiness. Palate delivers ripe and elegant red fruit with slight tanins. Very Good Brouilly with some ageing potential. 15/20.
A very dry wine with medium body and a slight fizz. Flavours of red fruit and minerals. Light pepper finish.
Crispy small red fruit, fresh a hint of earthy note but easy drinking and with a nice bitter finish.

Love this, so classy, elegant and vibrant. Bright red cherry color. Nose full or red fruit, with cherry, raspberry, cranberries, red currant, violet, tar, cardamom, with some earthy notes on the back. This is probably the most impressive Beaujolais Cru I’ve ever tasted. On the palate, silky, elegant, crisp, with a very long and lovely finish with red fruit and spicy after taste. This is really good indeed.

(4,0) Clear and pure fruit in this Beaujolais that's obviously had maceration carbonique. Cherries, cranberries, cinnamon pillow candy, some banana. Bright acidity. True to Brouilly. Very fruit-forward. Subtle floral notes too, hint of tomato paste. Mineral core.

M(-) garnet.

The nose is more complex Pinot than simple BoJo:  green peppercorn, hazelnut, cranberries, iron, red cherries, meat juices and salted caramel.

High acidity, m(+) abv, m(-) body & tannin.

M(+) blood orange, red flowers, cherry stone, iron & lemon pith flavours with loads of salt and fair amount of white pepper spice.

Finish is short and savoury.

Nose is first class but the complex flavours are a bit overshadowed by the searingly high acidity at present…

One to keep and revisit in a few years.

Third of these I have had. First time I  reviewed it I said "Bright cherry on the palate initially that turned to a precise, long, savoury finish. Excellent light bodied mouthfeel with refreshing well balanced acidity. The grapes come from 60 to 80 year old vines that are farmed biodynamically and the wine is made without sulphur". Little to add to that other than either the wine is getting better or I am simply enjoying it more. The depth of the flavour on the finish was lovely. Excellent Beaujolais.

Yummy gamay. This is a bit more refined than your average Beaujolais. It’s a playful balance between sour candy and refined mature fruit. Big notes of raisin and anise, but I can’t help but taste jolly rancher notes! Notes of new French oak, think vanilla, help round this thing out. It’s perhaps a bit too sweet but undeniably tasty and well made.
Top
Great value
Drinking better with a little more age and after being decanted a few hours.  Light Fran grant nose, silky tannins with rich sour cherry notes.
Impressive Gamay- fruits , full month and palate. Very well done. love it
One of the best beaujolais for me
Bright and herbaceous and a very fine expression of Gamay.
Bit pricey but went down well
Fuller bodied than typical. Nice balance between fresh fruit and earth.
tar, pencil shavings, smoke and cedar, this is a crunchy wine, cranberries, unripe raspberries
Nice fruit forward.  Soft tannins and lush finish.  I could drink this wine every day.
Absolutely delicious. We had this wine at Fontine de Mars in Paris.
A full bodied Brouilly with a crisp, clear fruity taste that explodes in your mouth. Has a cranberry finish but, at the same time, am earthiness that I enjoyed very much.

Very nice wine, this 100% gamay from 50 to 70 year old vines, biodynamically grown. No sulphites added until bottling. Slightly petillant, very concentrated, lacks a little bit of length though. Medium intense aromas of red cherry, blackberry, forest floor, yoghurt, graphite, black pepper, tobacco leaves. Dry wine, medium+ acidity, low tannins, medium body, pronounced flavour intensity, medium+ length finish. 13% - €18,75 @ WijnDijck

Light body, light tannins, medium light acidity, nose has a faint whiff of funk and after it sits in glass for a couple minutes shows cedar and spices (like clove). A nice wine but I prefer the bigger richer Beaujolais these days

3.85/5.00. An organic Beaujolais that was fruity and fresh with notes of red fruit and dark fruit. A good red wine to pair with seafood. Nice balance, but overall didn’t “wow” me. Work dinner selection.

Excellent Cru Beaujolais. The region is so underappreciated. 12ha Lapalu is a newer winemaker than the Gang of Four (Lapierre et al), but gives me the same kind of excitement. From 60yo Gamay on granite soil. Whole-cluster fermentation. 6mth Carbonic maceration in inox.

Nose: brooding goat cheese funk with strawberry jam+cherry and a hint of cedar. Meaty sausage weight vs minerality.

Palate: concentrated yet elegant. Gentle peach vs sour red berries that prop up the smooth fruit before meaty finish. Yum.

88pts.

I'm a fan of Cru Beaujolais so was excited to try my first Brouilly. The nose was beautiful with hints of cherry and pepper however the palate didn't quite live up to what I was smelling. A little thin with some weak strawberry fruit. I much prefer the few Morgons I've had.

You can feel the old vines, and the barrel (I think). It gives an oaky taste that I wasn't expecting, but very good one.
Not what I expect from a Beaujolais though.
Yes! Neojolais!

April 10: Just as cheerful as the villages. Effervescent. Lots of red fruit and black fruit: raspberry, blackberry, plum. Barnyard funk all the way—the aroma even carries into the palette.

May 20: Soft tannins, but gripping.

Jean-Claude Lapalu has a relatively small vineyard of old vines in Brouilly which he farms biodynamically; natural winemaking methods are used in the winery. This wine has a beautiful perfume with aromas of red berries and violets for which Brouilly is known. Some examples of Brouilly can be pretty robust but this has a fruity complexity whilst retaining a refreshing acidity. It is mouth-wateringly good.

Paired with baked chicken and pasta.

Pale ruby red colour

Medium aromatic intensity. Aromas of ripe red fruits. Strawberry, Plum, red cherry, cranberry, earth . 

On the palate is dry. Medium acidity. Medium  tannins. Medium bodied. Medium flavour intensity. Medium finish

Wet forest floor, floral tones and raspberries on the nose, similar flavor of berries on the palate with high acidity and some tannins. Finish lingers for awhile but is highly acidic and somewhat spicy. Good, not great.
Fruity delicious
Light, with acidity to go with Christmas turkey.  Loads of red fruit with  raspberry and strawberry.  There were some floral notes.  Slightly peppery on the finish.

Good example of a classic Beaujolais. Fruit forward nose with notes of wild berries, red cherry, and strawberry sweets. The body is round with soft tannins and low acidity.

Intense purple red wine. Intense nose with red fruits, rose, pepper, meat, underwood. Balanced acidity, medium tannins, peppery and fruity on the palate, long finale. Complex and powerful beaujolais.

Medium ruby Gamay. Quickish legs - 12.5%? Label says 12%. Interesting nose - cherry lozenges, with hints of menthol and hay that dissolve into the cherries on a long inhale. Light on the palate - a woody cherry. Gentle acidity and no noticeable tannins. Short finish. 85

The 🔠 theme continues with this super tasty Tempranillo blend named after the quaint village of El ♈️ilosell, where Tomàs Cusiné’s vineyard is based, 700+m above sea level. It’s a blend of 55% Tempranillo, 18% Syrah, 12% Merlot, 11% Cab Sauv & 4% Garnacha. It’s a soft, smooth and spicy wine, with blackberry, blueberry & plum balanced well with rustic, earthy mushroom flavours. It’s full and rounded in body with a bit of a creamy peppery mocha finish, a really good value wine that I’ll re-buy 3.9⭐️ very yummy

A quite so pleasant red from Tomas Cusine in Costers del Segre, Catalonia. Second time I taste this wine at Restaurant Holger in Skagen, Denmark - now in a new vintage 🙂 

Dark rubyred towards purple in colour. Fruity aroma with sweet dark fruit, plum, prune, cherry and spices. 

Based on Tempranillo with some help from Syrah and Garnacha. The wine has first spent 8 mths on French oak barriques, then a further 3 mths on steel (40%) and other oak (60%) before bottling.

Full bodied red wine.

Loved Cusine’s Azuells white blend and delighted to try his red last night at Sea Containers. 
This is a Tempranillo-biased blend. Deep ruby in glass. Great and complex of nose of concentrated strawberries and cherries followed by vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg. Good acidity, balance and length with flavours evolving and building in the palate.
This more than compensated for the too-warm white Guigal we had before!

Very nice, deep dark red colored wine offering a complex and rich nose of red fruits, cherries and even some roasted notes. On the palate a rich variety of red fruity and jam-like tastes continues, lined by an enjoyable acidity, hence freshness, as well as some soft velvety tannins and a touch of discrete vanilla, originating from the 14 months of oak barrel aging. Medium to long lasting finish with vanilla and red fruits continuing. A great wine, which surely could have preserved for some more years.

Tempranillo with Granacha and Syrah in proprietary blend delivers a big bold dark fruit package! Immediately rich plum, blackberry, black cherry and licorice hits the tongue. Quickly followed by equally epic oak, smoke, leather, and especially tobacco. Smoke a cigar with this one. 

For about $13 this really is an excellent QPR wine. Quite dry it's probably best with fatty foods, including pasta with sausages and meatballs. 

3.6, unfortunately, it was underwhelming on day 2,

A beautiful wine with wide aromatic red fruits spectrum. Most notable floral rose pedal note balanced with gentle oak aromas. Blends are often more interesting some might say.. This wine is dominated by Tempranillo, blended with some Cabernet Sauvignon, merlot and tiny bit of Syrah. It has structure and intensity. Very expressive, modern and easy drinking.

Better drunk with rich food, but a singular 3.5/5 when alone.

Muito bom! Excellent juice made from a crazy blend of several type of grapes from vines that average 120 years of age. The producer even disclaims that 18% of the grapes come from vines they can’t really identify. It’s on the lighter end of the scale - pale red and completely transparent. Elegant and structured with smooth tannins. Carries plenty of red berries on the nose and palate but the 28 months of oak also shine through with notes of cloves, licorice and smoke.
Licorice, cherry, leather and oak. Dry and light. Very pleasant finish.

5⭐️ for this Portuguese Trás-os-Montes 🇵🇹 red wine. Incredible red wine accompanied by lagareiro octopus 🐙.  👁 Clear visual with a brown ruby color.👃Good aroma with a first sniff dry with red fruits and a second sniff focused on tobacco, vanilla, chocolate, 
raspberry, cherry, oak and some vegetables. 👅 In the mouth dry wine with good acidity and good balance, retro-odors of red fruits. Good persistence in the mouth with long finish. Elegance red wine with good balance and alcohol. Cheers 🍷

Blend of dozen of different, genuine sorts from centennial vineyards of Transmontano - underrated region though well priced (no Park... nor Suck...stickers, etc) & very interesting! Forget bold, tannic, big. It's light, vivid. It's curiously different. 

L: clean ruby, light viscosity at 12,5%. Shy N: rye-bred, game, geranium at the beginning. It evolves with rosemary, jasmin, forest floor, cranberry later. P: med(-)bodied, high acidity, scrupulously fine tannins, fruity-earthy balance...

⬇️⬇️⬇

3.8 ~ 88% ($18.99)
Casa do Joa 🇵🇹 Tinto 2016.
Med bodied soaking wet, thin, light color, dry (3 gs/13% abv). Reminded me of a wrestler trying to GAIN to make weight 🤣.
Much better with food. Deelish Northern 🇵🇹, but not enough kick ~ Hank the bar boss raved 👍. 
It’s nice, just not a good match for my tastes 😑

Good wine, light ruby ​​color with garnet tones, medium-bodied. On the nose aromas of blackberries, and cherries, with notes of pepper and cinnamon. In the mouth flavors of cherries. Round, dry and smooth, with a good and long finish.
Minerals, light but super complex… it delivers
Dry, subtle, interesting, but a little pricey to be a regular pleasure, sadly
It worth it 4.1
A nice drinking red, perhaps a bit predictable but good value in a country that is good value…

Spicy, with cherry and prune flavors.
A great, great red wine.
Light, bright, with an electric palate showing fresh red fruit, earth, and savoury notes. Elegant wine from the Trás-os-Montês one of the most Northern regions in Portugal.
one of my favorite wines already!

92 pts deep purple very complex blend of Syrah with a bit of Viognier. Dense and concentrated with lots of ripe tannins very pleasant and very long and lingering

Excellent. Beautiful nose of cedar and forest floor. The taste is complex and layered with fruit forward notes followed by notes of mushroom and freshly baked bread. The finish of chestnuts and cocoa round off this amazing wine. One more reason to seek Lisboa region wines.

Lovely red wine from the Lisbon area produced by Jose Bento de Santos. Deep ruby colour. Complex nose of black fruit, spices graphite and dark chocolate. Round texture with fine integrated tannins.
Elegant, long and persistent finish.

Gorgeous, with lush flavors. Beautiful oak and bourbon on the nose, then smoke, pepper and black currant. Then, it opens up brilliantly when paired with umami food, black cherry and cola come through, and even a hint of mint. Balanced and just a beautiful ride from start to finish.
Beautiful, smooth red. Medium to full bodied, blackcurrant, chocolate and cloves. Elegant and well balanced. Garafeirra  in Principe Real.
Without words, guys. Turn on the enjoyment to the maximum!
oak pepper black fruit plum vanilla

4,2/5 Good tannic wine, with nice black fruit, plum, blackberries, chocolate, spices, cinnamon and some earthy notes. Velvety, tannic, good acidity, a very nice structure and a very nice long finish. Deep purple color on the glass an morish on the monthfeel.

Made with syrah and viognier
Tobacco, spices, oak, milky and fat aromas. Red acidic cherry and red current, cranberry, medium-plus to high acidity, almond but, great structure, mature tannins. Ripe fruits, dark chocolate. Long finish. Flagship of the winery. Tasted at the winery with very strong local mature curated goat cheese in olive oil. Delicious.
Softness to this Lisbon region red imparted by the viognior blend to the Syrah grape predominance, with spice, leather and vanilla notes. Ageing has added some further elegance and structure.
Interesting north Rhône blend in Portugal

4.3 in my opinion. Extremely elegant for a Portuguese Syrah from Lisboa region. Very refined tannins, smoothness and balance. Long and delicate finish. Highly recommended.
N

Usually I'm not a fan of Portuguese wines, but a reserve with an almost classic low alcohol percentage of 13.5% and a price of almost €30,- creates some expectations. 
Deep dark red. Slightly woody, but otherwise wonderfully firm, neat scent. Medium bodied. Dry and tight finish. Quite a lot of oak but, despite the low alcohol percentage, well balanced. This wine needs a bit more as a wine-food combination than just a few nuts like I did. Notes of blackberry, red fruit and much more. 

Recommended!

[Winery visit Quinta do Monte d’Oiro 4/5]
The Reserva is also Syrah driven with a Côte-Rôtie style injection of Viognier. Warm nose with prune, strawberry compote and oak followed by a super smooth palate with fresh red fruit, vanilla, spice and pepper. 4.1
Normally I prefer local grapes but if they’re so good at getting the best out of an imported grape, I can look the other way 😉
91 points - Light medium garnet; floral and mineral nose; taste of ripened cherries and kirsch with a peppery finish. Medium body with great balance.long lasting finish.

And we opened another one last night, a fantastic visitor from Portugal, but unfortunately we liked him so much, he had a short stay ..... a nice deep ruby red in the glass, a nice nose of black cherries, blackberry, pepper. On the palate with air an wonderful long, wide and soft wine, ripe fruits, well balanced, blackberry, cherries, pepper, mocha and chocolate, some barrique. Lingering long ...  heavy wine for just a glass, but with some cheese perfect, better thought with red meat
Blackberries, cassis, raspberry, juniper, pepper, oak, lovely balanced palate, smooth tannins, great, elegant wine
Dark red, almost black wine. Great nose with black fruit, Plum and cherry. Well balanced palate with lots of black cherry and chocolate. Great long finish.
A bit on the rough side, a lot of tannins, need some time in the glass. Heavy Blackcurrant with hints of green pepper and unripe strawberries
Very good wine from the Lisbon region with Syrah grapes, well balanced, tasty, smooth and youthful.  Aroma of black fruits and oak.  Very good finish.
Fruity, balanced and pleasant
Light elegant fruity nose. Vanilla and chocolate, but also creamy butter. Cherries. What a great Portuguese!
Very heavy. Big chocolate and resonant black fruit with a long finish. Could go some years more. If you like your wine strong, this is your guy.

Fresh and vibrant
Very intense spring flowers. Very fresh bouquet with apricot and peach.
Wine dinner at the Yeatman Oporto: A blend of various plots. 96% Shiraz and 4% Viognier. 40% new oak. Paired with suckling pig. Ruby colour. Bluebrries, spice and slight vanilla. Plenty of tannins.

Vacation @Porto, tasting admiring Douro river.
Intense red color, berry aromas, dark chocolate notes, elegant, full bodied, interesting acidity, rich tannins, firm structure, long finish.
Paired with a local goat cheese, spectacular!

Quinta do Monte D'Oiro Reserva 2009.
One of my favourite vineyards in Portugal.
This tasting note is completely biased by my tasting preference.
For me this wine has a perfect nose, and impressive nose to mouth combo.

Great Portuguese Syrah,didn't expect this 2003 to be this good!Decanted for 2 hours,very deep garnet with a dark brown rim.Surprised me for its very full nose,not a bit shy,notes of spices and deep ripe fruit,discrete wood and cocoa,just can't remember the name of that incense!Still great body,and a mouth full,a palate of quality fruit and spices,bit balsamic and herbs,great integration of wood!Acidity is top notch making this a tremendous gastronomic proposition,begging for good food and company!Ends long.

Splendid red from the Lisbon region!
An elegant and aromatic blend of mostly Syrah with a bit of Viognier, aged 12m in French oak barrels. Already with 20y and still full of life. 
Bold, complex and deep, with great acidity and length.
Ruby color with brownish hues, ripe dark fruits aromas/flavors, floral, with notes of cassis, spices, mint, and well integrated oak. Full body, polished tannins, and a long tasty finish. Excellent red, showing beautiful evolution!

A colour that reminds of ripe blood and instils in me vampiric urges. The nose is overwhelming like the aromas of the incoming high tide of the southern Indian ocean. Smooth and profound dark berries, lush oak and subtle layers of spice. I taste and all I can say is "oh... this is good". Smooth like Egyptian Cotton after a hot long shower, a palate that changes as the wine slides down the tongue from initial ripe blackberry to smooth ripe plum, all tempered by oak and age. A lasting finish. Happy newyear
Elderberry. Thyme. Bramble.  Pretty darn interesting.

This Cote-Rotie style blend's on a weaker side of wines from a respectful winery. It firmly reflects 2014 was really chalanging in PT. 2nd day of aeration didn't help visibly. 

L: garnet with violet rims, long legs at abv.13,5%. N: nice but one dimentional with anise, dark fruit&earthy notes. P: tart acidity taking over squeezed tannins. Sourish, earthy mid-way but quite nice, spicy aftertaste.

Good to support a steamed chicken with vegetables in herbal souce. 3,5 points.

Dominant Syrah with a touch of Viognier, this wine starts to get more elegant with rounder tannins, very ripe black fruits and wild berries, the oak is well integrated, a nice wine that will pair nicely with rich dishes :) Quinta do Monte d’Oiro (“Hill of Gold”) was founded by winemaker José Bento dos Santo in 1990. His goal was to develop top-quality wines in a European style while respecting his vineyard’s unique terroir

Full-bodied, half dry, med-acidic, violet / ruby color. Aromas and flavors of fruit (black fruit/red fruit). In the sensory dimension it`s a nice wine. On the non-sensory dimension, the label advertises it has added sulfites and 13,5% ABV.
Sunday 24/9/22.

While this rich wine is 96% Syrah, it does follow the Cote Rotie style by adding a splash of white Viognier to soften the tannins.
Great aromatic presence, dense and fresh with a tiny hint of mint, ground clove, cedar and crushed black pepper alongside sweet berry and cherry fruit.
Nicely spice with lovely focus and grip.
This has nice weight and a great texture and will evolve beautifully!
Olive and earthy tones the nose. On the palette there are flavors of plum, black cherry, mineral and dirt. Aftertaste has some pepper flavors. Smooth and hardly tannic overall.
On the continuous celebration of Lili’s birthday. A white wine from Lisboa, excellent. Fruit on the palate, high accidity, typical of Viognier. And a nice finish!!

I opened this gem without having a clue about what it was: a top wine from one of the best wine makers around. I did so disrespectfully (no decanter) but she did not mind. The nose is intense and I detected some horse saddle (leather) so I had to double check the label to confirm it is from the north side of Tejo. The taste is phenomenal, ripe fruit, chocolate, roast something. I had to google for the varieties: Syrah, Viognier. It figures: foreign!, no way for me to guess. But truly excellent!
Full body with smooth taste, walnut and chocolate. Loving it

What a great wine! 2004 and fresh,wonderful bouquet, despite being a 14.5% you cannot feel the alcohol. Very well balanced. An easy to drink wine that you want to last available longer! I would definitely recommend.

Multicomplex- but no grapes stated...middle year 14 % and honestly on the more expensive side for what you can buy from this region. I am doubtful.
But the wine is harvested from the best location in the region, but it doesn’t really convince me that this is priceworthy.
Drank at Vila Vita. Great balance. Minerality and low acidity.

Aromas of rich plum, fig and cocoa. Palate is dry, moderate tannins, moderate acidity. Flavours match the nose, with a bit more plum and blackberry. Long finish that opens up with black pepper, toast and chocolate. Elegant and savoury.
plum black fruit blackberry dark chocolate vanilla oak pepper
A great full long lasting wine.
A dark purple Portuguese wine with strong aromas of red fruits and tobacco leaf. medium bodied and firm with some roasted nuts emerging.
Great fruit, freshness and 12 years old! Give it time to breath!
Spicy 🌶, tannin rich. Blackberry, black fruit.  pepper
Excellent wine. Soft tannins, oaky but in a good way and it has a peach taste that is easily perceived, very interesting.
Smokey, not tobacco, but smoke. Smooth.
Such a different wine from previous ones I've tried in Portugal. Complex with Tabasco and leather. A bit of fruit. Paired well with our diverse meat dishes!

8th paired wine at Yeatman’s Gastronomic restaurant Porto 🇵🇹 95% Syrah 5%Viognier. Late release of 2011 vintage 👁 Deep ruby👃 Prune, raisin, fig, black pepper, vanilla, chocolate, earth, leather, mushroom 👅 Dry, high acidity, high fine grained tannin, flavours of prune, raisin, fig, black pepper, chocolate, vanilla, earth, leather, mushroom, long finish! Drinking at it’s peak! Very good & paired nicely with suckling pig!
Dry, fruity, spicy, less acidity, round, dry in the end
Fruity luxury smell
Ok, balanced
Needs a considerable amount of time to breathe. Not much depth or complexity to the wine.

Lovely wine - smooth velvety Syrah with a hint of Viognier at its peak - finishing long and stylish. 
Single glass in Bairro Alto.
4.25 for this red with a lot of character, great freshness despite the 14.5% and superb fruit coming from the syrah + viognier (only 2%) blend.

4,1- the other Syrah was this 14 yr old Portuguese which some consider to be their best. And this was indeed very nice and not showing the age at all. Still very nice fruit power and acidity. Just a bit short on the length that’s why I rated the same as the Montes Alpha 2016. Good wines

A rich red with high tannins and a long finish. More elegant after an hour on opening. Nutty and heavy plums give way to hints of wood. A good value for price wine that I would pair with a stewed meat dish or perhaps a lightly spiced curry.

Has a large presence aromatic, with impressive ripe fruit, black pepper, wood of high quality very discreet and fully integrated. In the mouth impressed by the texture of velvet tannins, the barrel does not feel, force and elegance shake hands at the end strong and very long.
It is a world-class wine, excellent and consistent, highly recommended.

Aromas of plums and black fruit, wet earth, some leather and sweet spice. Good acidity with smooth tannins and with nice long finish. A very well balanced Syrah in an elegant fresh style giving great pleasure

Intense ruby red colour. Fruity aroma with predominance of very ripe black plums and wild berries, light toasted notes and fine spices. Elegant in the mouth, reveals a balanced between fruit and well integrated wood, velvety tannins, pleaseant acidity, and very long overwhelming finish.
Syrah (94%) and Viognier (6%) - charming wine, hot, elegant and memorable. Enjoy !
Elegant wine with a dark fruit spicy character. Excelent balance of acidity and tannin. A wine that every wine lover should own.

Syrah, Viogner from Lisbao, black bouquet of fruits, forest floor, damp, earthy, leather, herbs, woody. Quite complex with ripe tannin. As usual Portuguese wine, alcohol always high.

Blind sample by @[1|4057966|Robinf]! Bright light red colored. Opening smoky & herbal with bunch of forest strawberries, crushed cranberries, red cherries, morello freshness, rose petals, forest floor & brushwood. Red fruit driven palate with forest strawberries & refreshing morello acids followed by a medium finish with drying tannins and bitters of herbs & cranberries. It’s PN for sure, don’t think we’re in France, think we’re in Germany, Nahe? Youngster this one, let’s go for 2-3y. Portugal, really 😳👌

What a nice find at my local wineshop; a red wine from Azores!

A blend of many local grapes with Merlot and Syrah added. Remarkably light colored, translucent. Very fruity nose; mixture of cherry, red apple, slight waxy tone, a little sulfur and tobacco. 

Med/med+ acidity, med tannins. Elegantly punching, lovely light texture. Only 12% abv. Yes, me like 😉🍷. 15 pts @wijnhandel Francoise.

My first wine from the Azores islands - presents itself like a beaujolais with some gunsmoke. I guess this could be Baga as s varietal. Blind tasted thanks @[1|4057966|Robinf] Blend of indigenous grapes with Merlot and Syrah.
3.8. A fascinating red which offers the heartiness of Douro with the elegance of Pinot Noir. It’s definitely noticeable that it comes from volcanic soil.
Very light red, red fruit and dirt dishrags on the nose. Salt, spice, cinnamon and red fruit on the palate.  Very ashy from beginning to end the ash lingers for quite a long time.

Red wine from Azores, mix of Portuguese grapes planted in volcanic soil, although didn’t fit with my palate, it’s different and really interesting wine to tasting, starting from the no translucent red light colour, the acidity and freshness characteristics, earthy, mineral, metallic and salinity nuances in a wine with few fruits and light body.

4,25. Ruby-purple color. Dry, medium bodied, medium acidity and medium tannins. Very interesting fresh and salty taste palette with cherry, red fruit, minerals, licorice, green grape and saline.
Portugal wine tasting.

A: Pale ruby
N: Pronounced intensity of rose petal, beeswax, sour cherry, earthy, smoke and spices.
P: Dry, medium(+) acidity, low ripe tannins, medium body, medium alcohol, medium(+) intensity with flavors as aromas on the nose and with a vulcanic saltines. Medium(+) finish. 

This is a very good quality wine! 

Great complexity with nuanced aromas and flavors, lifted acidity giving freshness to the wine, lacks some intensity and finish.

Light ruby, dusty on the nose, pomegranate, rhubarb, violets, earthy like wet dark dirt, it has a salty character, iodine, light body, subtle to none tanins, spicy finish. Interesting wine, very different of what I've been tasting lately.

Salty raspberry, saline, minerality, stewed cherry, and floral, rose, and raw tuna. Touch of smoky. Slightly petillance. SO2<35mg/l, unoaked. 12%, manual, free run. 22k bottles.
Aragonês, Agronomica, Castelão, Malvarisco, Merlot, TN, Saborinho, Syrah etc. minimum fining. Viticulture Paulo Machado. Wm AM. Elegant, sense of terroir!

Dinner wine. After listening to the newest I'll Drink To That podcast from Pico in the Azores I got quite curious and really wanted to try a wine from here. This is not from Pico though but still vulcanic with several native grape varieties I've never heard of in the mix. Very interesting wine! Right after opening quite fruity and funky earthy nose, like a beaujolais. With air it evolves: beeswax, eucalyptus, lavender. On the palate very bright and lean, crisp red berry fruit, great acidity, pure and fresh!

Informal mixed bag wine tasting event in Oslo. Not enough time for detailed tasting notes.

Very decent red blend from Portugal. Juicy, crisp and bold. Red fruit of cherry, red currants and dark fruit of black cherry and mulberry. Ripe tannins, moderate grip. Good intensity and medium fruit concentration. Good acidity. Long finish.
Spicy Fruit punch in a glass! Cherry, raspberry, strawberry, black pepper. Low tannins, slightly bitter, light in color.
Very strange light colour. Sulphur spicy, rocky, lingonberry. Tickling salty. Never had anything close to this one.
Red cherry, red fruit, black cherry, cranberry, clove & earthy.
First Portuguese wine that I’ve tried. Volcanic soil and biodynamic light wine that made the tasting very interesting. Looking forward to further exploring this region

3.4 

Quite a diffrent red, reminded some local wines at Canary Islands with the general character of bitterish grape fruit juice. Which vere ok and nice, but not great to my taste. Or would require some learning and adapting.

Maybe some soil, sand earth as well, together with several, but slight red berry tones.

At work dinner, with grilled beef fillet. Ok but not great match.

At least something different and new.

Dark purple colour. Smell of sulphur, black cherry and clove. Taste of smoke , black cherry, saline and clove with a tannic finish. A blend of Castelão 15%, Aragónez 10%, Syrah 10%, Touriga Nacional 10%, Merlot 5% and 50% other local grapes from the Azores. This was a different one. Feels like having a glass of wine, while going for a swim in a volcanic spring in Iceland. Needs air
Between 3 and 3,5. Understanding the wine’s different style, I still believe it is stunningly over priced and despite being elegant, delicate, doesn’t deliver an outstanding experience
It worth it 3.6
earthy and red berry enjoyable
Portugal😍 fresh cherries 🍒
You can feel the WoVesuvio vibes in this guy.

Pungent nose of mushroom, brioche, pencil shavings, lavender, and balsamic, but also reminiscent of ocean breezes. Light bodied and lush with strong acidity and moderate tannins (the acidity gives it the illusion of being slightly frizzante). Sour cherry and cinnamon on palate with vegetation and mushroom. Long sour finish. An unusual yet pleasant wine that goes down easily, but not one I’m inclined to repeat.

(12/20) Blind tasted. I'm sure this is an obscure wine, because quality wise it is quite mediocre, and otherwise Robin would not share it with me, haha. Enough fruit, nice acidity, but it lacks structure and length. Feels ripe and unripe at the same time, not very well sorted grapes I suspect. No idea what this is, not a classic variety.
Medium intense aromas of redcurrant, red cherry, raspberry, violet, coffee, wet iron.

Very acidic with strong scent of smoke and minerals. Almost frizzling. Long finish of sour cherries. Quite complex wine that should be enjoyed with a food pairing (may work well with fish).

Smells of leather, oak, stone, smoke, and hints of red fruits. Minimal fruit and sweetness with tastes of sour cherry, leather, smoke, and salty saline with some meaty flavors. Really starts to open up after 30 minutes or so. Opens up with notes of dried and preserved fruits. Super interesting and unique wine, and very indicative of its volcanic island terroir. Reminiscent of wines from the Canary Islands.
